story:
The New Orleans Project

The New Orleans Project team is a diverse group of Juilliard students who devote their spring break to volunteering to help the hurricane affected community of New Orleans. During our week in New Orleans, the team empowers local youth through arts education, presents free public performances, and volunteers to rebuild homes.

Originally conceived in 2006 by the Juilliard student group ARTreach, the project erupted from the desire to help and rebuild areas devastated by Hurricane Katrina. The project continued to grow with return trips each year from 2007 to 2013. Currently in its eighth year of service, the 2014 NOLA Team is eager to further the project's mission to assist, empower, and enliven members of the New Orleans community.

How You Can Help

Getting from New York City to New Orleans is a big leap - and we need your help!

Our total budget for the trip is $17,000! Here on Indiegogo we only set $5,000 as the goal so we could (hopefully) reach our goal and get the funds. But in reality we have a lot more to raise! So even when we hit $5,000 here, please keep donating and spreading the word! Since it's flexible funding we can receive more than our indiegogo goal!

Each contribution helps us cover travel, food, and housing costs for our 20 team members - just the bare essentials! Your contribution ultimately enables our team of exceptional artists to continue the New Orleans Project's legacy of generosity, collaboration, and volunteerism which invigorates the community.  

Please help us keep this legacy alive and donate!

Donations of $150 or more will be recognized by The Juilliard School as tax deductible gifts.

The Impact

Since its inception in 2006, the New Orleans Project has:

  • Empowered over 1,000 children through a free after school arts program
  • Coached arts magnet school students on conservatory preparation and admissions
  • Planned and performed in over 30 free performances
  • Assisted in the construction of 12 new homes
  • Collaborated with the Dryades YMCA, New Orleans Center for Creative Arts, First Street United Methodist Church, Habitat for Humanity, HandsOn New Orleans, and the Lusher Charter School

The New Orleans Project has also received formal recognition by the City of New Orleans for their service:

  • In 2011, they received the key to the city for 5 years of service.
  • In 2013, they received a certificate of recognition directly from Mayor Mitch Landrieu of New Orleans.

Other Ways You Can Help

All forms of support, moral and monetary, are the lifeblood of this project. Please help us spread the word via Facebook and Twitter - post and tweet away!

And for updates leading up to and during our stay in New Orleans, visit our blog!

Art Nurtures.

Thank you!

The 2014 New Orleans Project Team

story:
Hi, we're Lil, John and Mike and we are the creators of Ramen Party!  Learn more about our project by watching the video below:

Ramen Party on IndieGoGo from Ramen Party on Vimeo.

WHAT IS RAMEN PARTY?

Ramen Party is a collection of characters that introduces preschool children (and their parents) to hip trends in culture, music and food.

We've created six characters based on ingredients found in traditional Japanese ramen.  Each of them have a distinct musical theme that matches their quirky personaliities, and when you mix them together, you create a catchy tune! Let us introduce them to you...

From left to right: Mr. Ramen (Noodles), Tomorokoshi (Corn), Ms. Tamago (Egg), Mr. Negi (Green Onion), Ms. Naruto (Fishcake), and Mr. Chashu (BBQ Pork).

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

We are looking to raise 20K to launch Phase One of Ramen Party, which includes:


Ramen Party Interactive Storybook
An interactive storybook app which tells the story of Mr. Ramen as he picks up his friends to go to a party. We’ll add interactive elements, puzzles and games (like shape-matching) as kids collect different characters and their musical themes.

Ramen Party E-book 
We’ll also create an e-book series that focuses on the adventures of the individual characters as they encounter other ingredients and recipes in the Ramen Party world.

Ramen Party Interactive website 
Finally, we’ll create a website where the characters will reside.  We’ll have games and activities for kids to play, and a place where they can learn more about the foods and recipes that the characters were based on.

 

WHY RAMEN PARTY? 

We all know that kids can be picky eaters.  Ramen Party represents a way to get kids excited about food by allowing them to combine ingredients in the same way that a DJ combines music.

We are also creating a resource for families to learn about foods from a wide-range of ethnicities.  While growing up, simply knowing about things like bok-choy or kimchi helped us connect to our Asian roots—and we’d love to pass that along to our own children. 

So, why ramen? Well, it’s not only a delicious food that we grew up with, but it’s also one of the hottest trends in North America!  That said, we’d love to see characters based on ingredients from other cultures—all introducing kids to an entire universe of foods!

 

WHO WE ARE 

Lillian Chan is an illustrator and animation filmmaker from Toronto.  Her children’s film, Jaime Lo, small and shy, was produced by the National Film Board of Canada, and won public prize at at several international festivals.  See more of her work HERE. Her favourite pastime is drawing silly doodles of her two cats, Frankie and Mao.

John Poon scores music for commercial clients (Hewlett-Packard, UPS) and plays and produces music for various artists in Canada and abroad.  John had the good sense to marry Lillian Chan in 2008.

Michael Mak has been successfully solving problems and delivering solutions for years now.  He loves standing in front of a whiteboard drawing boxes and arrows. He shares a love for the creative, the gastronomic, and the nerdy with Lillian and John.

 

PERKS WE ARE OFFERING

As a thank you, we've created some Ramen Party merch rewards for our supporters -- but sorry, no ramen...it's too hard to ship!

Ramen Party Stickers!  Removable, water-resistant, even dishwasher and microwave safe! The stickers will be added to all combos over $25.

Ramen Party T-shirts or Onesies! Pick your Ramen Party character!  Choose from various sizes and styles (we'll contact you to customize your order).

Ramen Party Gelaskin Smartphone Covers! Pick the character of your choice.  Each cover will be custom ordered to fit your phone (both brand and model).

Ramen Party Limited Edition 5”x7” print, and/or Trading Card Set!  Collect them all!

Ramen Party Tote Bags! Fun, functional, and indispensible... Carry your ramen with you everywhere you go!

A Ramen Party Hand-made Soft Toy!  Each of these limited edition custom pieces is lovingly sewn by Keiley Stewart, a local textile artist in Toronto (www.leikey.com).

And, for our top contributors, join us as we build the Ramen Party universe!  We’ll work with you to create a custom character, based on an ingredient chosen by you! Have your one-of-a-kind character framed as a lovely art piece on your wall, or let us create a storybook about one of their adventures (you’ll receive a hard copy, as well as a digital version).

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please share the video with your friends and family! Spread the joy of Ramen Party!

If you love ramen, tell us! If you love some other food, tell us! If you see something cool involving ramen or cats, tell us!

  • Join us on Facebook

  • Follow us on Twitter

  • Email us at love@ramenparty.ca

story:
Short Summary

I am trying to raise money to participate in the International Scholar Laureate Medical Program, which would allow me to travel to China for 13 days to learn about how they implement both western and traditional Chinese medicine in their health care system.

I need your help!  But in addition to your financial contribution, you'll get one of the super awesome perks listed to the right!

What We Need & What You Get

As many of you know, I'm working towards an education in traditional Chinese medicine, with the hope of becoming an acupuncturist.

I was accepted into the ISL program through my school, which permits select honor students to take part in a study-abroad program in their field.

This trip will allow me to travel to China for 13 days to learn about how they implement both western and traditional Chinese medicine in their health care system.

I have some of the tuition cost covered, but we're coming up a little short on funds for the flights to and from China. 
 
Your financial contribution will go towards my plane tickets, the remaining tuition costs, and traveling expenses. 
 
There are some fantastic perks available for your contribution - souvenirs from the trip, dinner or even home redecorating services.  Thank you for checking them out!

The Impact

Besides the immediate impact of helping me further my educational goals, you will help me achieve this transformative experience that will allow me to help others in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that's OK!  Thank you for looking. But it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

The first time i knew i wanted to teach was in my 6th grade world history class. It changed my life forever. Since then I’ve been on a journey to create the same experience and environment that inspired me to teach. It has taken me many years, roadblocks and struggles to finally graduate college with me degree in teaching. I am excited to finally start my first year of teaching as a 6th grade history teacher. 

I have a vision and passion to allow students to not only learn about world history but also experience it. I believe education is only effective when students can engulf themselves in the subject area they are learning. I want students to walk in my classroom and step into a new world of learning. This means that I will need to decorate my room with large amounts of artifacts, posters and history related items. No one likes a boring teacher. So I need your help!!!!

I need the ability to buy these items to create this experience. I need friends and people who care about education. Who care about supporting a teacher who wishes to be more than a regular teacher. 

 

Imagine those students’ faces the first day they walk into a classroom you help create. 

 

I need $1000 to fully create this environment for these amazing students. Since I am a first year teacher I am lacking in classroom materials and world history artifacts to have as visuals. 

 

Anything you donate I will send in return you a picture of my classroom so you can see the impact you have made. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate a specific world history artifact to my classroom. (Egypt, Israel , china , India , Greece , Rome, Christianity , Islam , medieval Africa and Europe

story:
About the Project

Interview an Atheist at Church Day is a project created by Kile Jones, a Ph.D student at Claremont Lincoln University, an inter-religious school to train ministers. Kile is an atheist who is interested in helping liberal religious people work together with unbelieving communities for the betterment of society.

Interview an Atheist at Church Day is a community project aimed at bettering the understanding between atheists and religious persons. We hope to connect atheists who are willing to be interviewed with congregations in their area that are interested in developing ties with atheists in their area. The "day" represents our desire to grow into something far-reaching and beneficial to atheists and churchgoers alike. 

As unbelieving populations around the world contion to rise, dialogue and understanding between atheists and people of faith is more important than ever. We live and work in the same world: understanding better what both unites and divides religious and non-religious people can only help us make this world a better place.

We hope that these interviews will benefit both believers and non-believers.  Possible questions include:

  1.  How does your atheism influence your day-to-day actions?
  2.  Why don't you believe in God?
  3. How do you find meaning in an atheistic universe?
  4. Where do you think morality comes from?
  5. How can we find a way to work together?

Help us Get There!

In order to make this big, we need funds to help with advertising and promotion! Currently, we rely entirely on volunteers to reach out to churches and atheists and to spread the word. We hope develop a small pool of funds that we can use for promotion and advertising, and to employ a small staff to help with adminstrative and promotional tasks: from coordination and database creation to web design and social media promotion. 

Ideally, we'd love to be able to establish a nationally recognized movement of atheists and Christians engaging with each other.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know you can't always give money, but if you're interested in helping out we'd love to hear from you!

  • Are you an atheist who would be willing to be interviewed?
  • Are you a minister who would be willing to host an atheist at their church?
  • Can you take a minute to press "share" on facebook?
  • Would you be willing to volunteer your time and skills to help us get the word out?

Let us know! Your contributions are greatly appreciated!

story:
ITEAD studio is based in Shenzhen, China, which is located with China's biggest electronics market as well as one of the most integrated electronic supply chains in the world. A vast number of exciting and innovative products are designed, sourced and manufactured around us every day.

In electronics the big picture is usually more compelling than the nuts and bolts of electronic design. To make innovation easier, we offer various modules and development platforms to accelerate the development process and to reduce barriers to entry and to soften those steep learning curves.

You can visit our site for more our products: imall.iteadstudio.com 


PURCHASE IT HERE:

http://imall.iteadstudio.com/development-platform/arduino/arduino-compatible-mainboard/iteaduino-lite.html

With the popularity of open-source hardware, Arduino boards are being recognized by more and more users and you can find them in a variety of innovative and creative applications. As it is priced about 20USD, users with insufficient capital budgets will regard its price as too high, which also limits its applications in a large scale of products.

Someone launched a low-cost Arduino-clone board project on Indiegogo before, which meet the needs of many users of low-cost mainboard. As we can see, actually the main control chip influences the cost most. After selection and comparison, we picked out an inexpensive main control chip of strong compatibility with ATmega328 for development, and we programmed Arduino-compatible bootloader and modified IDE configuration for it, so that it can be almost 100% compatible with the present Arduino IDE and various libraries.

We do not simply offer these cheap boards by cloning Arduino board with mass production, but we replace the main control and develop relevant contents to make it compatible with Arduino. Here, we would like to initiate a fund raising for mass production of the board, so that we can further reduce costs through bulk purchasing and processing to provide you with a world's lowest-cost full-sized Arduino derivative board.

Yes, this is the main selling point. If you are the first 50 doners, you can get a unique full-sized Arduino compatible board in the world with 5USD only including shipping cost! If you miss that chance, you still have the unlimited supplies with 8USD which are certainly the world's cheapest! And you can get more benifits by compaigning packages. For details, please refer to the following package information.


Arduino UNO board can only support 5V IO output. If you want to use an external 3.3V module, you will need to ensure security by making a level conversion circuit. On our new board, you can switch the output level 5V or 3.3V only with a flip of level selection toggle switch on Iteaduino Lite, thus you do not need to worry about the level conversion issue any more.

By replacing LDO power supply design with DCDC circuit, it not only offers a wider range of input options, larger output current ( only for 5V), but also reduces the power loss - if you use an external battery as power supply, reduction on power loss will be more evident.


Like Iteaduio UNO, it offers a lot of expansions. However, in order to save costs, these pins will not be welded on it, and you can do it by yourself if needed.


Iteaduino Lite adopts chip LGT8F88A which is highly compatible with ATmega88. Compared to ATmega328 on UNO, FLASH and RAM resources of LGT8F88A are relatively less, yet enough for most simple Arduino applications or getting started.

It has as many digital GPIO and AD interfaces as Arduino UNO, with same SPI, UART and IIC interfaces, thus it can be basically compatible with all the Arduino Shields on the market.

Summary

  • Microcontroller: LGT8F88A
  • Operating Voltage: 5V / 3.3V
  • Input Voltage (recommended): 7-20V
  • Input Voltage (limits): 7-24V
  • Digital I/O Pins14 (of which 6 provide PWM output)
  • Analog Input Pins6
  • DC Current per I/O Pin80 mA
  • DC Current for 3.3V power supply 250 mA
  • Flash Memory 8Kbyte of which 0.7KB used by bootloader
  • SRAM 1 KB
  • EEPROM 504Byte
  • Clock Speed 16 MHz

Due to basically the same internal structure, with use of Arduino IDE expansion package we offered, it is proved that most of Arduino codes can be applied on Iteaduino Lite directly after being compiled.

1) Install driver

To reduce costs, the board adopted CP2102 as USB-to-serial conversion chipinstead of ATmega16U2, and we also used CP2102 on Iteaduino nano. You can download installation instruction for the driver, which contains the downloading address and the tutorial for installing on Windows 7:

DOC_Driver_Installation.pdf

2)Update Arduino IDE

You need to download a native Arduino IDE. The latest version 1.05 can work normally as we have tested, while version 1.5x is unusable. Here you can download the latest IDE software.

After extracting and installing Arduino IDE, you can download the patch package we offered here:

Iteaduino Lite Patch for Arduino IDE.zip

After extracting the zipped file,copyand paste folder Iteaduino Lite to arduino-1.0.5 \ hardware.

Then open Arduino IDE, you can find option Iteaduino Lite below Board, which you can useto upload the code. By the way, do not forget to select serial port first.

3) Bootloader programming

Each board will be programmed with bootloader before leaving the factory, so that you can use it directly after connecting via USB adapter.

If you want to program bootloader by yourself, you can refer to the tutorial on our blog:

Install the bootloeader for Iteaduino Lite

LGT8F88A is a main control chip launched by LogicGreen, which is highly compatible with ATmega88 and with same resources, electrical properties and stability as ATMega88. Moreover, its processing performance is improved through structure adjustment, thus it can work at 32MHz between 1.8V and 5V. In addition, it is equipped with built-in control circuits and registers for touch buttons, which can be easily applied in a variety of small appliances and small projects.

ITEAD STUDIO, the global distributor of this new chip, launched Iteaduino Lite with LogicGreen - an Arduino-compatible derivative board, and offered Ariuino IDE patches and Bootloader, so that you can develop your prototype more quickly. You can use Iteaduino Lite as a evaluation development board for LGT8F88A to develop your project. If you need to order the chip or customized PCB’s for your project, feel free to contact us.

Many users wondered how to program bootloader for Iteaduino Lite or how to download codes to LGT8F88A with use of programmer. Here we would like to recommend SWDICE_mkII programming debugger with open-source hardware:

Opensource SWDICE_mkII debugger and programmer (Using LGT8F88A)

Meanwhile, we are writing codes for Iteaduino Lite that can be uploaded onto the bootloader through Arduino IDE,thus Iteaduino Lite will be able to work as a programmer and can be used to programm codes for those chips without bootloader.

At present, we are working on translation of the documents for the chip, and you can find the translated documents in "Downloads" section. If you have any problems in the process of use, please send E-mails to ITEAD STUDIO, we are glad to help you to get them fixed. 

Schematic of Iteaduino Lite

Datasheet of Iteaduino Lite

Arduino IDE Patch of Iteaduino Lite (Includes bootloader code and HEX)

LGT8F88A Overview_EN_v1.1.1

Migrating from ATmega88 to LGT8F88A v1.0

LGT ISP tool


For orders of a single board, we will use simple bubble bags; for orders of more than one board, we will use cartons. Both packaging will be filled with sufficient protectivematerials to ensure the board will not be damaged during transportation.

All SMD components on the board will be welded in advance. For DIP components, we will weld power socket and toggle switch only. To prevent from being damaged, 6pin and 8pin female headers will not be welded as which can be crushed easily, and we will attach them as accessories in the package. All pin locations on the board will remain untouched, so you can buy 2.54mm standard pins on your own.

Pack List:

  • 1x Iteaduino Lite Board without headers
  • 2x 2.54mm 8pin female header
  • 1x 2.54mm 6pin female header
  • 1x 2.54mm 10pin female header


If you know about ITEAD STUDIO, you are sure that we will arrange delivery as schedueled whether we can achieve the funding target or not. The production cycle of the board is about one and a half months, which is expected to be delivered in mid-January, 2014.

If you choose free shipping or airmail,  the parcel will be sent via Hong Kong Post or China Post with non- registered airmail, so we cannot offer you the tracking number to check the shipping progress, and we can only provide you with a number with which you can check in our logistics company website that the parcel is received by them and sent to China Post or Hong Kong Post.

Since we are shipping in mid-January , and the Chinese Spring Festival is by the end of January when the whole country will be given about a 10-day long holiday, and it is often the busiest time with an excess of parcels before the holiday – that is, we do not know whether the parcels received during Christmas have been processed or not yet. Therefore, do not expect to get your parcel in 2 to 3 weeks as usual, you may receive the package at the end of March - although we did deliver the parcel in mid-January, it is normal to take about two months to get it from our experience last year.

So please be noted that: We will send the parckages via non-registered airmails and there will be no tracking numbers offered ! Besides, as it will be sent out in the busiest time period plus a 10-day Spring Festival holiday, you might receive the parcel in about 1 to 2 months! If you are time demanding, you can choose group buying – for example, you can compaign a DHL shipping package which contains 10 boards, and you can distribute them to your group members after receiving it.

As the board is cheap and it is offered to users to make various development, we do not provide any warranties nor accept returns & exchanges, but we do guarantee that each board will be strictly tested before leaving the factory:

  1. Power Test
  2. Programming bootloader
  3. Passing Arduino IDE programming test program
  4. With the test fixture, run the test program to test all GPIO’s and LED indicators to ensure proper functions.

If you cannot accept the above risk terms, we are sorry that we cannot provide you with the products and services.
story_txt:
ITEAD studio is based in Shenzhen, China, which is located with China's biggest electronics market as well as one of the most integrated electronic supply chains in the world. A vast number of exciting and innovative products are designed, sourced and manufactured around us every day.In electronics the big picture is usually more compelling than the nuts and bolts of electronic design. To make innovation easier, we offer various modules and development platforms to accelerate the development process and to reduce barriers to entry and to soften those steep learning curves.You can visit our site for more our products: imall.iteadstudio.com PURCHASE IT HERE:http://imall.iteadstudio.com/development-platform/arduino/arduino-compatible-mainboard/iteaduino-lite.html
With the popularity
of open-source hardware, Arduino boards are being recognized by more and more
users and you can find them in a variety of innovative and creative
applications. As it is priced about 20USD, users with insufficient capital
budgets will regard its price as too high, which also limits its applications
in a large scale of products.
Someone launched a
low-cost Arduino-clone board project on Indiegogo before, which meet the needs
of many users of low-cost mainboard. As we can see, actually the main control chip
influences the cost most. After selection and comparison, we picked out an
inexpensive main control chip of strong compatibility with ATmega328 for
development, and we programmed Arduino-compatible bootloader and modified IDE
configuration for it, so that it can be almost 100% compatible with the present
Arduino IDE and various libraries.We do not simply
offer these cheap boards by cloning Arduino board with mass production, but we
replace the main control and develop relevant contents to make it compatible
with Arduino. Here, we would like to initiate a fund raising for mass
production of the board, so that we can further reduce costs through bulk
purchasing and processing to provide you with a world's lowest-cost full-sized
Arduino derivative board.
Yes, this is the main selling point.
If you are the first 50 doners, you can get a unique full-sized Arduino
compatible board in the world with 5USD only including shipping cost! If you
miss that chance, you still have the unlimited supplies with 8USD which are
certainly the world's cheapest! And you can get more benifits by compaigning
packages. For details, please refer to the following package information.Arduino UNO board can only support 5V
IO output. If you want to use an external 3.3V module, you will need to ensure
security by making a level conversion circuit. On our new board, you can switch
the output level 5V or 3.3V only with a flip of level selection toggle switch
on Iteaduino Lite, thus you do not need to worry about the level conversion
issue any more.By replacing LDO power supply design with DCDC
circuit, it not only offers a wider range of input options, larger output
current ( only for 5V), but also reduces the power loss - if you use an
external battery as power supply, reduction on power loss will be more evident.Like Iteaduio UNO, it offers a lot of
expansions. However, in order to save costs, these pins will not be welded on it,
and you can do it by yourself if needed.Iteaduino Lite adopts chip LGT8F88A which is highly compatible with ATmega88. Compared to ATmega328 on UNO, FLASH and RAM resources of LGT8F88A are relatively less, yet enough for most simple Arduino applications or getting started.It has as many digital GPIO and AD interfaces as Arduino UNO, with same SPI, UART and IIC interfaces, thus it can be basically compatible with all the Arduino Shields on the market.Summary

Microcontroller: LGT8F88A


Operating Voltage: 5V / 3.3V


Input Voltage (recommended): 7-20V


Input Voltage (limits): 7-24V


Digital I/O Pins14 (of which 6 provide PWM output)


Analog Input Pins6


DC Current per I/O Pin80 mA


DC Current for 3.3V power supply 250 mA


Flash Memory 8Kbyte of which 0.7KB used by bootloader


SRAM 1 KB


EEPROM 504Byte

Clock Speed 16 MHz
Due to basically the same internal structure, with use of Arduino IDE expansion package we offered, it is proved that most of Arduino codes can be applied on Iteaduino Lite directly after being compiled.
1) Install
driver
To reduce costs, the board adopted CP2102
as USB-to-serial conversion chipinstead of ATmega16U2, and
we also used CP2102 on Iteaduino
nano. You can
download installation instruction for the driver, which contains the
downloading address and the tutorial for installing on Windows
7:DOC_Driver_Installation.pdf
2)Update Arduino IDE
You need to download a native
Arduino IDE. The
latest version 1.05 can work normally as we have tested, while version 1.5x is unusable. Here you can download the latest IDE software.
After extracting and installing Arduino IDE, you
can download the patch package we
offered here:Iteaduino Lite Patch for Arduino IDE.zip
After extracting the zipped file,copyand paste folder Iteaduino Lite to arduino-1.0.5 \ hardware.
Then open Arduino IDE, you can find
option Iteaduino Lite below Board, which you can useto upload the code. By
the way, do not forget to select serial port first.
3)
Bootloader programming
Each board will be programmed with bootloader
before leaving the factory, so that you can use it directly after connecting via USB adapter.
If you want to program bootloader
by yourself, you can refer to the tutorial on
our blog:Install the bootloeader for Iteaduino Lite
LGT8F88A
is a main control chip launched by LogicGreen, which is highly compatible with ATmega88 and
with same resources, electrical
properties and stability as
ATMega88. Moreover, its processing performance is improved through structure adjustment, thus it can work
at 32MHz between 1.8V and 5V. In addition, it is equipped with built-in control
circuits and registers for
touch buttons, which can be easily applied in a variety of small appliances and
small projects.
ITEAD
STUDIO, the global distributor of this new chip, launched Iteaduino Lite with LogicGreen - an Arduino-compatible
derivative board, and offered Ariuino IDE patches and Bootloader,
so that you can develop your
prototype more quickly. You can use Iteaduino Lite as a evaluation
development board for LGT8F88A
to develop your project. If you
need to order the chip or
customized PCB’s for your
project, feel free to contact
us.
Many users wondered how to program
bootloader for Iteaduino Lite
or how to download codes to
LGT8F88A with use of programmer. Here we would like to recommend SWDICE_mkII programming debugger with open-source hardware:
Opensource SWDICE_mkII debugger and programmer (Using LGT8F88A)
Meanwhile, we are writing codes for
Iteaduino Lite that can be uploaded onto the bootloader through Arduino IDE,thus
Iteaduino Lite will be able to work as a programmer and can be used to programm
codes for those chips without bootloader.
At present, we are
working on translation of the documents for the chip, and you can find the translated
documents in "Downloads" section. If you have any problems in the
process of use, please send E-mails to ITEAD STUDIO, we are glad to help you to
get them fixed. Schematic of Iteaduino LiteDatasheet of Iteaduino LiteArduino IDE Patch of Iteaduino Lite (Includes bootloader code and HEX)LGT8F88A Overview_EN_v1.1.1Migrating from ATmega88 to LGT8F88A v1.0LGT ISP tool

with sufficient protectivematerials
to ensure the board will not be damaged during
transportation.

story:
My Story

Namaskar beautiful people!

My name is Elena Colón and I am a Support Coordinator for Tender Heart, a non profit NGO which provides educational opportunities for women and children in rural Northern India.

I first went to volunteer in India almost three years ago with absolutely no experience with non government organizations, foreign countries and cultures, working with the underprivileged or doing any of the things I do now. I am a childcare worker and simply wanted to work with young children where I felt encouragement was needed the most. Seeing some of the world’s worst poverty completely broke my heart. I couldn't stand to see tiny children in the streets begging for food and better lives. I was crushed. I bounced around, teaching at different slum school projects in Delhi, but I felt lonely and discouraged with little support. I wound up at Tender Heart with a broken spirit, but they nurtured me and gave me a whole new perspective on the world. I organized a mural painting project with the children to allow their individual creativity to blossom, and I got a taste of the beautiful things that can happen when you invest yourself in others. I found myself inspired, encouraged, loved, overwhelmingly grateful and motivated to serve for the good of all beings.

I now support Tender Heart from Austin, TX through fundraising, selling handicrafts made by the women’s empowerment group, raising awareness through events and presentations, recruiting international volunteers, and creating new partnerships. My vision is to create an international non profit which will function as a fair trade marketplace, international volunteer connection, and support network for educational projects around the world – connecting those in need to those who are willing to offer a helping handJ

So that’s my story..

 

Let me tell you a little more about Tender Heart..

Tender Heart works to uplift, and provide social and educational opportunities for disadvantaged children and children with special needs. It is based on the outskirts of Faridabad, in one of the rural villages of northern India. The dedicated women who run the project apply a variety of methods with the developmentally disabled children, such as tactile sensory stimulating activities, music and dance therapy, speech pathology, physical therapy, and group sports therapy. Our primary school children are thriving as well, working hard to become accepted into India's competitive high school system, performing in religious and cultural events and learning about new cultures and language through the international volunteers who come to share heir own skills.

We also run a women's empowerment program to create educational and employment opportunities to widows and underprivileged women from the village of Bhatola. The program is very holistic, emphasizing the need for women to be empowered from the inside out. This involves giving them health education, women’s rights education, vocational training and an opportunity to earn a livelihood through our international fair trade marketplace.

Tender Heart provides these opportunities because we are working towards alleviating the poverty the rural villages of Northern India as they adjust to encroaching urbanization. We are motivated by the belief all of us are part of a singular whole to which we are responsible to protect, encourage and uplift. We are all brothers and sisters on this planet, and it is time we started working together for the good of humanity.

If you’re interested in seeing Tender Heart in action, you can watch a short documentary on the organization here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KDZ2M3WFRmY&feature=results_main

 

So what are we raising funds for?

This November (just over a month!) I will be traveling to India to meet and work at Tender Heart with a group of international volunteers from Austin, TX. They will be the first volunteers recruited directly to the organization, a huge success for our volunteer recruiting project! I will also be working to facilitate a partnership with Tender Heart and the amalafoundation.org  of Austin, TX which supports another school in the area. Our objective is to bring the two communities together and integrate the women in their community with our women’s empowerment program, providing new options for them to not only live more sustainably, but thrive in their environment.

Additionally I am organizing a school supply and art supply drive in Austin, and I will be hand delivering all supplies to our school in the village Bhatola. I will also be able to transport fair trade handicrafts back to America to sell for the women’s empowerment group. This will save a lot of money on international postage and ensure safe and timely delivery of the products.

All of the work I do for Tender Heart is a unpaid volunteer effort, fueled by my passion and devotion to the cause. This fundraising campaign will ensure that I am able to afford

  • A roundtrip ticket to India from Austin, TX
  • A visa for India
  • Costs associated with my three-a-half week volunteering venture including other transportation fees (taxis to and from airports), baggage fees for any extra school supplies or handicrafts I will need to transport, and coverage for my housing expenses here in Austin which will ensure storage for all Tender Heart materials and handicrafts in addition to all of my personal belongings

 

What will happen if I exceed my fundraising goal?

Wonderful things will happen! If I exceed my fundraising goal, the extra funds will be contributed to one or more of our current fundraising projects..such as:

  • Raising funds for a new generator for our school in village Bhatola. This will allow us to teach the women and children using the computers that have been donated to Tender Heart. It will also maximize production for the women’s empowerment program since a lot of the hand work they do requires the use of electricity for sewing machines.
  • Raising funds for a new, internationally accessible website for the organization which will also function as an online fair trade store supporting our women’s empowerment group!
  • Raising funds for promotional materials such as signs and banners which will help us to promote and raise awareness for Tender Heart in America.

 

Other ways you can help!

Although there is a huge need for fundraising and donations, if you find that you are not in a financial position to donate, we welcome you to get the word out to friends, family and any other networks you think may be interested in supporting this cause. If you feel passionate about this campaign, please share it with others!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my campaign!

With loving gratitude,

Elena

story: ...

Creativity involves breaking out of established patterns in order to look at things in a different way.  ---Edward de Bono -----     

               

The Story

Ever felt like giving up? Be encouraged  and choose persistence! Ever felt like failure was most likely to occur? Choose determination and know that success comes in various shapes and sizes.  The Crossover that Won the Game is a movie that is sure to work on a child's lack of confidence. It also shows  parents that just paying the bills is inadequate. Time must be spent with their children. The movie has several paralles to some of Jamell's experiences. Children who struggle with self-esteem issues, as a result of negative words that have been spoken about them, will greatly benefit from this movie. The Crossover that Won the Game shows that success is possible as long as you believe in yourself. Another key element of this movie is the belief that Coach Crossover has in Shay. This dynamic is very poweful. We, the authors , Joseph and Jamell, want viewers to learn that their belief in the children in their lives can make a monumental difference in building their self confidence and assisting them with feeling that, not only is success possible, but failure is not the end of the story. 

We are very excited about this movie and trust you will be too. We personally invite you on this journey with us. Being the best version of yourself is always a choice.

Why Indiegogo? 

Joseph and I believe creativity means breaking outside of established patterns to achieve our goals and desires.  Not letting the limitations of the traditional publishing and production industry hold us back, we took the indie route to publish our book and acquire a production team that shared our vision.

Strongly committed to a story we put our hearts and souls into, a story that has never been penned before, we believe Indiegogo will help us achieve the funding needed to bring this epic action film to the main screen.

“You have not because you ask not!”  Well we are asking you to help us bring this film to mass audiences through the utilization of creativity, teamwork, and an exceptional production and literary team.  With your help, we can continue to fulfill our dreams, breaking outside the established patterns, and continue being the unique, individualized thinkers we are.

The Impact

Jamell and I grew up having our father read us bedtime stories at night.  People may not think it is important, but having parents read to their children teaches them to think outside the lines. When parent’s read to children they open up worlds beyond their everyday existence and teach them to dream more, want more, live more. 

Our love for reading inspired Jamell and me to write books of all types.  Mostly, we write books that inspire children and people to be the best people they can be.  From The Crossover that Won the Game that teaches determination, to Your Pants are Saggin', which teaches young men how the outward appearance affects the way people think about you, these books entertain while teaching important lessons in life.

The filming of The Crossover that Won the Game will not only be a personal accomplishment for us both, it will also be the stepping stone to releasing some of our future projects, and our desire to become motivational speakers, impacting the youth of today.  Again, we can’t do it without you!

There are over 32 million people in America who cannot read.  Teaching literacy can enhance a person’s life, emotional well-being, and economic status.

What we need!

To make The Crossover that Won the Game as authentic as possible, the production will be filmed in two distinct locations, Ohio and New York.  The funds raised will pay for the production company, talent, locations, transportation, sets, and all things required to produce a high quality film that you will want to see again and again.

Other ways you can help!

You can be part of the team.  We need you to make this campaign a true success.  The power of social media and word of mouth advertisement is a dynamic tool to getting this project out there and getting support.  This is where you come in.  After you pledge, please take a moment to tell your friends, family, and everyone you know about the project.  Share it on Facebook, Tweet it, Pin it, Instagram it! Thanks!  

The Perks

We have worked hard to put together a collection of perks to ensure everyone who donates to our project will go home a winner!  We thank you for your donations.

Risk and Challenges

The Crossover that Won the Game is an independent film and we are working on a minimal budget to get this movie completed.  We have yet to acquire distribution but our team is working on getting full distribution.  In the meantime, The Crossover that Won the Game will be screened at various film festivals and private viewings with considerations for Amazon direct distribution and other outlets such as Netflix.  We cannot guarantee the scope of distribution.  What we can guarantee is the show will go on! 

The Team

Joseph Ponder, Co-Author, The Crossover that Won the Game

Joseph is the Co-author of The Crossover that Won the Game and the creative consultant to script development for the production of Bentley’s Revenge:  The Movie.  Bringing over 10 years experience as a writer and author, Joseph is committed to the creative content of both the book and the movie.  Joseph is also the author of Bentley’s Revenge, and a myriad of children books.

  

Jamell Ponder, Co-Author, The Crossover that Won the Game

Jamell is the Co-Author of The Crossover that Won the Game and is in charge of personal impact of the team’s creative content.  With a Master’s Degree in Social Work from Roberts Wesleyan College, Jamell ensures all content meets stated requirements for age appropriateness and content impact on viewers of all ages.  Jamell is the Co-author of Bentley’s Revenge, author of Your Worst for the Best of Me, and a myriad of children books.

Coal Under Pressure Publications

www.coalunderpressure.com     

Coal Under Pressure is the creative consultant for the screen adaptation of Bentley’s Revenge.

The Crossover that Won the Game shows that success is possible as long as you believe in yourself. Another key element of this movie is the belief that Coach Crossover has in Shay. This dynamic is very poweful. We, the authors , Joseph and Jamell, want viewers to learn that their belief in the children in their lives can make a monumental difference in building their self confidence and assisting them with feeling that, not only is success possible, but failure is not the end of the story. We are very excited about this movie and trust you will be too. We personally invite you on this journey with us. Being the best version of yourself is always a choice.Why Indiegogo? Joseph and I believe creativity means breaking outside of established patterns to achieve our goals and desires.  Not letting the limitations of the traditional publishing and production industry hold us back, we took the indie route to publish our book and acquire a production team that shared our vision.Strongly committed to a story we put our hearts and souls into, a story that has never been penned before, we believe Indiegogo will help us achieve the funding needed to bring this epic action film to the main screen.“You have not because you ask not!”  Well we are asking you to help us bring this film to mass audiences through the utilization of creativity, teamwork, and an exceptional production and literary team.  With your help, we can continue to fulfill our dreams, breaking outside the established patterns, and continue being the unique, individualized thinkers we are.The ImpactJamell and I grew up having our father read us bedtime stories at night.  People may not think it is important, but having parents read to their children teaches them to think outside the lines. When parent’s read to children they open up worlds beyond their everyday existence and teach them to dream more, want more, live more. Our love for reading inspired Jamell and me to write books of all types.  Mostly, we write books that inspire children and people to be the best people they can be.  From The Crossover that Won the Game that teaches determination, to Your Pants are Saggin', which teaches young men how the outward appearance affects the way people think about you, these books entertain while teaching important lessons in life.The filming of The Crossover that Won the Game will not only be a personal accomplishment for us both, it will also be the stepping stone to releasing some of our future projects, and our desire to become motivational speakers, impacting the youth of today.  Again, we can’t do it without you!There are over 32 million people in America who cannot read.  Teaching literacy can enhance a person’s life, emotional well-being, and economic status.What we need!To make The Crossover that Won the Game as authentic as possible, the production will be filmed in two distinct locations, Ohio and New York.  The funds raised will pay for the production company, talent, locations, transportation, sets, and all things required to produce a high quality film that you will want to see again and again.Other ways you can help!You can be part of the team.  We need you to make this campaign a true success.  The power of social media and word of mouth advertisement is a dynamic tool to getting this project out there and getting support.  This is where you come in.  After you pledge, please take a moment to tell your friends, family, and everyone you know about the project.  Share it on Facebook, Tweet it, Pin it, Instagram it! Thanks!  The PerksWe have worked hard to put together a collection of perks to ensure everyone who donates to our project will go home a winner!  We thank you for your donations.Risk and ChallengesThe Crossover that Won the Game is an independent film and we are working on a minimal budget to get this movie completed.  We have yet to acquire distribution but our team is working on getting full distribution.  In the meantime, The Crossover that Won the Game will be screened at various film festivals and private viewings with considerations for Amazon direct distribution and other outlets such as Netflix.  We cannot guarantee the scope of distribution.  What we can guarantee is the show will go on! The TeamJoseph Ponder, Co-Author, The Crossover that Won the GameJoseph is the Co-author of The Crossover that Won the Game and the creative consultant to script development for the production of Bentley’s Revenge:  The Movie.  Bringing over 10 years experience as a writer and author, Joseph is committed to the creative content of both the book and the movie.  Joseph is also the author of Bentley’s Revenge, and a myriad of children books.  Jamell Ponder, Co-Author, The Crossover that Won the GameJamell is the Co-Author of The Crossover that Won the Game and is in charge of personal impact of the team’s creative content.  With a Master’s Degree in Social Work from Roberts Wesleyan College, Jamell ensures all content meets stated requirements for age appropriateness and content impact on viewers of all ages.  Jamell is the Co-author of Bentley’s Revenge, author of Your Worst for the Best of Me, and a myriad of children books.Coal Under Pressure Publicationswww.coalunderpressure.com     Coal Under Pressure is the creative consultant for the screen adaptation of Bentley’s Revenge.

story:
About Puertas Abiertas

Puertas Abiertas is a social and outreach project for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer Latin@s and Allies in Southern Arizona. The group holds regular meetings, hosts events, forums, and educational and social events; bringing Latin@s together to celebrate their heritage and LGBTQ pride. Puertas Abiertas is open To ALL and love all LGBTQ PEOPLE, our ALLIES and FAMILY in Southern Arizona’s. 

Puertas Abiertas provides support, information, advocacy, and social services to youth, victims of violence and discrimination, families, and seniors. Collaborators include Wingspan LGBTQIH Anti-Violence Project, immigration rights organizations such as Derechos Humanos and the Rainbow Defense Fund, advocacy groups such as Emerge! Center Against Domestic Abuse and Southern Arizona Center Against Sexual Assault, and behavioral health entities such as CODAC and the LGBT Behavioral Health Coalition of Southern Arizona.


Our Needs

  • Administrative expenses: office and storage costs, operating costs
  • Continuation of programs: Latin@ Pride, outreach materials
  • Advocacy for LGBTQ rights and awareness of Latin@ LGBTQ concerns

Impact

  • If we make our goal, we survive. If not, we disappear.

Can’t donate? Share the link!

  • Please spread the word to as many as you can!
  • Like, share, email, speak, yell it at the top of your lungs!

story:
As I look outside the window from my hospital bed, I still remember that day, almost a month ago. I remember asking myself the questions, "Why? What have I done wrong?". And just a couple of days ago, the answer came, "You have not done anything wrong, but you have done everything right." Sometimes we find ourselves in life, going through what may seem as the darkest of hour, but truly, there is always a shiny, bright morning after every dark night, and during the dark nights the stars always shine. So this is just one chapter of the many chapters in my life, although the chapter that sets the springboard for who I am, why I'm here, what my life's purpose is, and how I came to find it in the most unthinkable and unimaginable place.

About a month ago I was rushed off to the hospital, I had lost around 15kg's of weight to my 172cm of height, I was underweight, undernourished and I didn't recognize myself and a sudden grief overcame my entire being and soul. Being disconnected from my family and friends, feeling trapped and stuck in a hospital room, every single day I gazed outside my window, longing for freedom and liberation, and the feeling of joy, every time I got to go outside to enjoy the sun.

A few days after I was put in the hospital, a friend's friend came by, Veronika, and she had brought with her art-material, colors and brushes. And I still remember that day as if it was yesterday, as I took hold of the brush, and all of a sudden, I couldn't help myself but to get caught in the now-moment, as my body expressed so much rage over this experience, and I had not been able to cry for several days, but that day the tears just fell down. At that exact moment, I knew, this is my life's passion, this is how I get to heal.

Ever since that day, instead of gazing outside the window longing for freedom and liberation, I have slowly, bit by bit, day by day, realized in my heart, that my healing, liberation and freedom comes from my inspiration, passion and creativity. And today I don't fear those emotions in the way that I used to, but allowing myself to be completely overcome with that passion. Getting in touch with creativity, and realizing who I am, what I'm here to do, has literally brought the light of dawn inside of me.

Painting helps me to heal in way that words are not enough. For several days, I could barely eat or drink without a lot of anxiety, and starting to paint has helped me to release the anxiety and as soon as I grab my painting brush, I feel hungry. And that's the way it has been for about a month now, gaining weight slowly and steadily and becoming myself again.

And this is where you come in to the picture.

My dream and goal is to attend education and courses in art therapy, music therapy and alternative healing modalities to build the foundation for my newly found passion, my biggest dream right now is to help children that are in hospitals, to help them to heal through creativity. I have found several educations and courses here in Sweden that I would love to attend and develop my creativity further, and with your help, I can achieve those dreams. Every contribution means the world to me! 

THANK YOU!

Here is a poem that I just wrote that I would love to share,

"Turn your eyes away from the past,
the history has already been written,
do not look for the future to seek hope,
look into your Heart, in this very moment,
Follow your passion, and you shall be lead to peace.
Take one step at a time, it is always about the journey, not the destination.
It is the chapters that make a book, and not the covers."

Here's my Facebook page with my poems and expressions;
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Indigo-Iceblue-W...

story:
Hello, friends and family!

I'm sure you've all heard by now that I'm going to study abroad in Florence, Italy this July *squeal*! As you probably know, traveling abroad is a wee bit pricey. That's why I've come to you, the people I care about most, to help make my dreams come true (cue the song, "A Dream Is a Wish Your Heart Makes"). You wouldn't want me to end up like poor Ariel, would you? "I'm not asking for much. Just a token really, a trifle!" All I want from you is your pocket change! 

The total cost for studying abroad in Florence is about $8,000, and a fair amount of that will be covered by financial aid and scholarships. I just need a small financial cushion to soften the blow. 

Here's the breakdown:

  • If I raise $5, I'll be able to buy a small meal while hopping from airport to airport. 
  • $10 will help me buy an italian hairdryer (apparently I'm not allowed to use my own) or mosquito repellent (mosquitos are terrible in Florence during the summer).
  • $20 is about how much an actual meal will cost at a restaurant.
  • $30 will cover books and supplies.
  • $50 would take me on a gondola ride in Venice! Whoa!
  • $75 is a train ticket from Florence to Rome (can you say "Trevi Fountain?").
  • $150 will pay for a hotel room in another city (such as Rome or Milan). I don't plan to stay with my host family in Florence during my entire trip, y'all! I want to see as much as possible. 
  • $500 is the approximate cost of food for my entire stay. 
  • Here's the big one: if I raise $1,700, my round-trip flight would be covered!

Now, who wants to help this poor unfortunate soul out, huh? 


With love,

Jasmyn

story:
Hi my name is Sergio Rey Avila, I currently live in El Paso, Texas originally from Northern California.  My background consist of being a family oriented, charitable individual with a go getter attitude. A dreamer at time, yet realistic in achieving my goals in life. Some of my many hobbies include helping others and traveling. I enjoy immersing myself in other cultures to experience a new way of living or possibly different way of thinking to ultimately find ways of helping.  Expansion of the mind, body and soul is key to reaching ones potential. With that said, I believe to have a natural knack for helping people, especially the less fortunate. Combining both my desire for helping people along with my drive to make a positive impact within my community I came up with my great idea.

My idea is simple; help families, especially ones with young children and elderly that have economic need or are below the poverty line with a homemade A/C unit. Giving a helping hand will:

1. Help give some heat relief to families or individuals that need it the most.

2. Help prevent possible illness due to heat strokes and or dehydration.

3. Keep El Pasoans safe and away from death, related to heat.

4. Give a sense of community throughout the city and county of El Paso, TX.

For those who do not know or ever been to the Southwest region of the states, well let me tell you, it gets hot. We are located in a desert area where average temps during the summer reach upwards of 100+ degrees. Folks here either have refrigerated air or swamp coolers, the latter only helps to a certain degree. As you can imagine no one is outdoors from the hours of 10 AM to 5PM that doesn't need to be. Everyone stays indoors and tries to keep cool.

Within the metropolis, El Paso has close to 800,000 residents within county lines, if we include Las Cruces, NM and Juarez, MX the area is home to over 2 million people. About 30% of El Paso is considered poor or living below the poverty line, a percentage much higher than the state of Texas. http://www.city-data.com/poverty/poverty-El-Paso-Texas.html. That's well over 200,000 people that are trying to survive. We can help,  a breath of fresh air can make a huge difference. Sometimes in life it's the little things that mean the most, a small gesture that keeps us going, helping us believe to never give up. We can be that gesture of hope. Your donation will do so much good and at the same time you get the satisfaction of knowing you were a part of something great, something that brought hope, relief and safety from possible heat related illnesses.

I'm passionate about my campaign because I want to give back to the community that has given a lot to me since I moved here 7 years ago. During the summer months I see the struggle that the less fortunate go through to try and stay cool. The city has suggested "cool zones" for the disadvantaged to gather at, when temperatures are peaking. Community centers and strip malls are among the suggested sites, yet for some it is difficult to get there with no means of transportation. Others with little to no money have a hard time getting to places or purchasing items to help keep them keep cool and safe.

You can help make this happen, I can't do it alone. I have discovered a way to make an affordable home made air conditioner ($25 please see video above) that is so simple and easy to use it can bring relief to so many. My biggest concern is the elderly and families that have small children. Together we can make a difference and here is how I plan to put your hard earned money and my efforts to work.

With the help of local organizations, non profits and religious groups, I will purchase the needed items to build and assemble the A/C units (with funds raised here). With a collaborative effort of  volunteers they will help me build, store and give away the units at a set event to occur at the beginning of summer. We will also target areas with a high concentration of both elderly and needy families with small children to set up stations where they can have easy access to the A/C units.

My humble goal is to have 1,000 units ready to serve our community and with your help we can all say "Stay Cool El Paso". All of the proceeds will go directly to this campaign. My efforts and organization is my contribution to this cause. It is not an easy task, yet I'm willing to put in the needed time to make this a success. As the campaign progresses, updates will be given via this website and via the "Stay Cool El Paso" website hopefully once we get a website built so all donors can track our progress. Please make sure to give us your e-mail address.

Lastly, I set it up so everyone that wishes to participate can. Monetary donations start at $2.00 and go all the way up to $1,000.00. (remember the higher the donation the greater the "perk" received) Your non monetary support is greatly appreciated too, please share this campaign with family, neighbors and friends. The more people that know about this the greater the chances of success.

Blessings,

story:
4 Days Left!

Help us end this campaign with excitement and momentum! Let's break $3000 and exceed all expectations!

Remember that every dollar that you add to this campaign is another dollar that we don't have to search for elsewhere.

Please, keep spreading the word and talking about your love for Boîte à Lunch. It's clear that this program is important to us all. Help us by donating whatever you can today!

4 jours restant!

Aidez-nous a finir cette campagne avec enthousiasme et élan. Dépassons $3000 pour excéder les attentes de tous! 


Rappelez-vous que chaque dollar que vous donnez à cette campagne est un dollar que nous n'avons pas à chercher ailleurs.

S'il vous plaît, continuez de parler de cette campagne et de votre amour pour Boîte à Lunch. Il est clair que ce programme est important pour nous tous. Aidez-nous en donnant ce que vous pouvez dès aujourd'hui!

Boîte à Lunch Needs Your Help!

Boîte à Lunch has been a fixture in the NDG community for the past ten years. With food security at the forefront of our minds, we aim to engage and empower kids, teens, and their families to make healthy food choices through experiential learning.

At the core of our project is a program of free cooking and nutrition workshops for children and teens in NDG, during which they prepare healthy meals to take to school for lunch. These workshops engage participants to take up both kitchen utensils and their critical thinking skills in order to take control of what they put in their mouths.

Boîte à Lunch has never needed your help more than it does today. Amidst cutbacks to funding for non-profits, Boîte à Lunch is facing a funding gap that puts at risk much of the progress we’ve made over the past years. We would not ask for your help if we were not concerned, and we hope you agree that our programs are worth fighting for.

Boîte à Lunch a besoin de votre aide!

Boîte à Lunch a été un pilier dans la communauté de NDG pour les dix dernières années. La sécurité alimentaire des enfants de NDG est une priorité pour nous. Nous cherchons à sensibiliser et responsabiliser les jeunes et leurs parents vers des choix alimentaires plus sains.

Au cœur de notre programme se trouvent des ateliers de cuisine et de nutrition participatifs et gratuits pour les enfants et adolescents de NDG. Les jeunes y apprennent à préparer des repas sains qu’ils peuvent apporter à l’école le lendemain. Nos ateliers permettent aux jeunes de se munir de leurs ustensiles de cuisine et de leur pensée critique afin qu’ils prennent le contrôle de ce qu’ils portent à leur bouche.

Boîte à Lunch n’a jamais autant eu besoin de votre aide. Dans un contexte de coupures financières des organismes à but non lucratif, Boîte à Lunch est confronté à un manque budgétaire qui met en péril la grande partie du progrès que nous avons fait au cours des dernières années. Nous ne demanderions pas votre aide si nous n’étions pas préoccupés, et nous espérons que vous conviendrez que nos programmes méritent d’être défendus.


What Your Donation Means

Give any amount that you can. We really mean that: Just $2 will put a healthy, homemade meal in front of a child, while engaging them to help cook it.

That is so significant.

Also, check back for new and updated perks over the course of our campaign!

Every dollar counts, whether we reach our goal or not. The funds will all go directly to our programs and will help keep them free and accessible to all.

La valeur de votre don

Donnez ce que vous pouvez. Nous le croyons sincèrement : une somme de 2 $ permettra d’offrir un repas santé, frais fait, à un jeune qui aura contribué à sa préparation.

Ces 2 $ sont vraiment significatifs.

Aussi, garder un œil sur les cadeaux offerts, qui seront mis à jour pendant la campagne !

Chaque dollar compte, que nous atteignons notre objectif ou non. Les fonds iront directement à non programmes, et aidera à les garder gratuits et accessibles pour tous.


Why Boîte à Lunch?

The benefits of an edible education to the youth of our community are multifold and beyond our ability to state in just one paragraph.

From reducing childhood obesity to increased engagement and ownership in accomplishments, and from changing preferences for fruits and vegetables to broadening cultural horizons; and from building important life skills to building nutrition knowledge and self-confidence, edible education can change kids’ lives for the better. Boîte à Lunch is committed to this idea, and has built its programs carefully and consciously to best benefit our youth, while ensuring that they remain free and accessible to all.

By supporting this campaign, you are not just helping kids enjoy healthy meals, but also helping to affirm the value of edible education, healthy eating, and home-cooked meals.

Pourquoi Boîte à Lunch?

Les avantages d’une éducation à la saine alimentation pour les jeunes de notre communauté sont multiples et impossibles à résumer en un seul paragraphe.

Disons tout simplement que l’éducation à la saine alimentation peut changer en mieux la vie des jeunes : en réduisant l’obésité infantile, en renforçant la confiance en soi des jeunes, en développant leur appréciation des fruits et légumes, en élargissant leurs horizons culturels et en renforçant leurs compétences et leurs connaissances en nutrition. Boîte à Lunch se dédie à cette idée, et a consciencieusement construit ses programmes afin que les jeunes en profitent au maximum, tout en veillant à ce que nos activités demeurent gratuites et accessibles pour tous.

En appuyant cette campagne, vous faites beaucoup plus qu’aider nos jeunes à manger des repas santé. Vous accordez de la valeur à la saine alimentation et aux repas cuisinés maison avec passion.


Spread the Word

Help us put this message in front of more people. From caring individuals to caring businesses and media organizations, we can use all of the voices we can muster.

Thank you so much!

Passez le message

Aidez-nous à faire entendre ce message par plus de personnes. Que vous soyez un individu, une entreprise, un organisme, ou un média, nous avons besoin de vous pour faire entendre notre voix.

Merci énormement !
Vidéo et certains photos par Hoda Adra. (Merci infiniment!)
story_txt:
4 Days Left! Help us end this campaign with excitement and momentum! Let's break $3000 and exceed all expectations!Remember that every dollar that you add to this campaign is another dollar that we don't have to search for elsewhere. Please, keep spreading the word and talking about your love for Boîte à Lunch. It's clear that this program is important to us all. Help us by donating whatever you can today!


4 jours restant!
Aidez-nous a finir cette campagne avec enthousiasme et élan. Dépassons $3000 pour excéder les attentes de tous! 
Rappelez-vous que chaque dollar que vous donnez à cette campagne est un dollar que nous n'avons pas à chercher ailleurs.
S'il vous plaît, continuez de parler de cette campagne et de votre amour pour Boîte à Lunch. Il est clair que ce programme est important pour nous tous. Aidez-nous en donnant ce que vous pouvez dès aujourd'hui!








Boîte à Lunch Needs Your Help!
Boîte à Lunch has been a fixture in the NDG community for the past ten years. With food security at the forefront of our minds, we aim to engage and empower kids, teens, and their families to make healthy food choices through experiential learning. 
At the core of our project is a program of free cooking and nutrition workshops for children and teens in NDG, during which they prepare healthy meals to take to school for lunch. These workshops engage participants to take up both kitchen utensils and their critical thinking skills in order to take control of what they put in their mouths.


Boîte à Lunch has never needed your help more than it does today. Amidst cutbacks to funding for non-profits, Boîte à Lunch is facing a funding gap that puts at risk much of the progress we’ve made over the past years. We would not ask for your help if we were not concerned, and we hope you agree that our programs are worth fighting for.



Boîte à Lunch a besoin de votre aide!
Boîte à Lunch a été un pilier dans la communauté de NDG pour les dix dernières années. La sécurité alimentaire des enfants de NDG est une priorité pour nous. Nous cherchons à sensibiliser et responsabiliser les jeunes et leurs parents vers des choix alimentaires plus sains.  
Au cœur de notre programme se trouvent des ateliers de cuisine et de nutrition participatifs et gratuits pour les enfants et adolescents de NDG. Les jeunes y apprennent à préparer des repas sains qu’ils peuvent apporter à l’école le lendemain. Nos ateliers permettent aux jeunes de se munir de leurs ustensiles de cuisine et de leur pensée critique afin qu’ils prennent le contrôle de ce qu’ils portent à leur bouche. 


Boîte à Lunch n’a jamais autant eu besoin de votre aide. Dans un contexte de coupures financières des organismes à but non lucratif, Boîte à Lunch est confronté à un manque budgétaire qui met en péril la grande partie du progrès que nous avons fait au cours des dernières années. Nous ne demanderions pas votre aide si nous n’étions pas préoccupés, et nous espérons que vous conviendrez que nos programmes méritent d’être défendus.






  




What Your Donation Means
Give any amount
that you can. We really mean that: Just
$2 will put a healthy, homemade meal in front of a child, while engaging them
to help cook it. 
That is so significant.
Also, check back for new and updated perks over the course of our campaign!
Every dollar counts, whether we reach our goal or not. The funds will all go directly to our programs and will help keep them free and accessible to all.


La valeur de votre don
Donnez ce que vous pouvez.
Nous le croyons sincèrement : une
somme de 2 $ permettra d’offrir un repas santé, frais fait, à un jeune qui
aura contribué à sa préparation.
Ces 2 $ sont vraiment significatifs.
Aussi, garder un œil sur les cadeaux offerts, qui seront mis à jour pendant la campagne !
Chaque dollar compte, que nous atteignons notre objectif ou non. Les fonds iront directement à non programmes, et aidera à les garder gratuits et accessibles pour tous.










Why Boîte à Lunch?
The benefits of an edible education to the youth of our community are multifold and beyond our ability to state in just one paragraph. 
From reducing childhood obesity to increased engagement and ownership in accomplishments, and from changing preferences for fruits and vegetables to broadening cultural horizons; and from building important life skills to building nutrition knowledge and  self-confidence, edible education can change kids’ lives for the better. Boîte à Lunch is committed to this idea, and has built its programs carefully and consciously to best benefit our youth, while ensuring that they remain free and accessible to all. 
By supporting this campaign, you are not just helping kids enjoy healthy meals, but also helping to affirm the value of edible education, healthy eating, and home-cooked meals.


Pourquoi Boîte à Lunch?
Les avantages d’une éducation à la saine alimentation pour les jeunes de notre communauté sont multiples et impossibles à résumer en un seul paragraphe. 
Disons tout simplement que l’éducation à la saine alimentation peut changer en mieux la vie des jeunes : en réduisant l’obésité infantile, en renforçant la confiance en soi des jeunes, en développant leur appréciation des fruits et légumes, en élargissant leurs horizons culturels et en renforçant leurs compétences et leurs connaissances en nutrition. Boîte à Lunch se dédie à cette idée, et a consciencieusement construit ses programmes afin que les jeunes en profitent au maximum, tout en veillant à ce que nos activités demeurent  gratuites et accessibles pour tous.
En appuyant cette campagne, vous faites beaucoup plus qu’aider nos jeunes à manger des repas santé. Vous accordez de la valeur à la saine alimentation et aux repas cuisinés maison avec passion.



 



Spread the Word Help us put this message in front of more people. From caring individuals to caring businesses and media organizations, we can use all of the voices we can muster. 
Thank you so much!


Passez le message Aidez-nous à faire entendre ce message par plus de personnes. Que vous soyez un individu, une entreprise, un organisme, ou un média, nous avons besoin de vous pour faire entendre notre voix.

story:
Boozhoo! (Hello)

I am asking for your help to raise money for my service learning trip to Nicaragua through my high school, Jefferson County Open in Lakewood, Colorado.  I will be leaving on Jan 6, 2015.   The reason I'm going is to educate myself on the marine biology, become deep sea diving certified, and I especially want to help the community of the small village of Omotepe by building a playground made of recyclable materials; a safe place for youth the play and interact with eachother and for families to come together as a community. 

I love travelling and have a desire to learn more about the culture, share my culture and to be a part of various cultural exchanges.

I plan to bring my regalia and share a piece of my culture by dancing for their community in an effort to educate them about who I am.  I'm 15, and a member of the Turtle Mountain Band of  Chippewa and a champion chicken dancer in the powwow curcuit.  I'm an active member of the Mile-Hi UNITY( united National Indian Tribal Youth) Leadership Council.  I love dancing, singing, beading, and attending ceremonies.  I also love longboarding, listening to music,acting, modeling, directing short films, playing lacrosse, and eating interesting foods.  I am also a DJ and either volunteer or am hired to do various events around Denver.

There's nothing I love more than travelling and meeting different people from around the world.  I've been very blessed to have these amazing opportunites to grow  not only educationally but spiritually.  

I'm not totally decided on what I want to be when I grow up, I'm interested in so many different things;  law, medicine, fire science and marine biology.  One thing I know for sure is that I am committed to being drug and alcohol free which I know will help me to find my way. 

Every single donation regardless of how small will help me to achieve my goal and I promise to do my best to absorb every moment and positively represent my school, my family, and my people.

Miigwech Biizhindawiyeg

(Thank you for listening to me)

Matene Wanna-Jerome

15 years old

Grade 10

Jefferson County Open School, Lakewood Colorado USA

story:
As current Event Management students at Queen Margaret University, Edinburgh, Scotland, Streamline Events are hosting a speakeasy themed 1920s event, taking place on the 23rd March 2015. It will be a fundraiser for Edinburgh Women's Aid – a charity relevant to our theme and in desperate need of support!

Edinburgh Women’s Aid is locally based in Stockbridge (Edinburgh) and provides support and refuge to women and children who are experiencing domestic abuse. This includes crisis counseling support, information and choices concerning domestic abuse, such as housing options, benefits, welfare rights and legal issues, temporary accommodation for women and any accompanying children, support for children and young people, and outreach and resettlement services. We chose Edinburgh Women’s Aid as we learned how little support they have currently. Streamline Events hopes to raise money and ultimately raise awareness.

As this is a charity event and we are on a tight budget, we are hoping to receive donations to enable us to host a fantastic event for Edinburgh Women's Aid. 

If you would like to join us for the evening, tickets are available from our website. 

Thank you and #speakeasybaby!
