story:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Graphr is a patent-pending, multi-function calculator app that prevents cheating, enables instant grading / results and comprehensive process examination.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who are we?

By day, we're just regular students at Carnegie Vanguard High School with a passion for math and computer science. By night we're entrepreneurs and app developers! Our business seeks to make it easier for our peers to pursue and succeed in higher-level math & science (STEM) courses, financially and otherwise.

So what's all the hype about?

Our project aims to bring quality calculators to the classroom - without the outrageous fees Texas Instruments and others charge for their bulky, battery-draining devices. More proprietary, however, is not our approach (there are already tons of multi-function calculator apps on virtually all platforms), but our concept:a calculator app that is actually teacher-approved for use on day-to-day tests, quizzes, and even the SAT. We can accomplish this through the use of ground-breaking algorithms that prevent cheating by accurately identifying background-app-switching / CPU usage.

Needless to say, this would not only encourage students our age to take higher-level mathematics & science courses, it would also give them the tools they need to succeed at both the foundation and advanced levels of education.

--

The most awesome thing about our app is that there isn't ONE cutting-edge feature, but MANY. Here are just a few things that will be included in the first full-version of the app (coming Feb. 2015):


  • Active Grading Sense: Our app will allow the teacher / test administrator to view the student's processing logic - so no need to rewrite complex formulas  / matrices on a separate sheet of paper just to show your work. It all goes to the teacher via electronic answer sheet, simply by one click of the button (students hits SEND once finished with a particular problem, and if registered to a classroom in Exam Mode, the app will automatically insert the student's calculations onto the server's individual student.txt file)
  • Multi-function / Multi-platform: Easily switch between calculator modes (scientific, four-function, graphing, and engineering) via an immersive and easy-to-use GUI. Among other things, the app offers 3D Graphing and slide-able, on-screen keyboards for full-screen / zoom display options. For as little as $0.99 in-app purchase, receive a themed-pack of calculator skins (by country, sports, and other personal interests). Purchase all packs with a bundle discount for just $1.99 . Donate $25 or more to our crowd-funding campaign to help suggest / design / try out all skin packs in the BETA version, at no extra charge. The Graphr App will be available for sale on the Android, Apple, and Windows App Stores starting early February 2015 (BETA only).
  • Instant Results: Unlike any of our competitor's, we offer instant grading so that as student's complete their calculator-supported answers, the classroom server will automatically send not only their work (see Active Grading Sense) but also a tally of the student's % correct, based on a custom-made answer key view-able and editable only by the teacher. Teachers can also easily set the % weight of each question  / sub-question as they deem necessary via their log-in credentials.
  • Anti-Cheating Feature: Finally, our flagship feature aims to build teacher / admin trust in using calculator apps during exams. As previously mentioned, we can accomplish this through the use of ground-breaking algorithms that prevent cheating by accurately identifying background-app-switching / CPU usage. If alerted, the app would notify the teacher account in control of the classroom via immediate text messaging, and also lock the student's access to the calculator unless voided by the teacher.

--

We’ve done the research and built a prototype, but a lot of our ideas are still on paper. Without your help, we will not be able to fund the development of this app. (And we're still just students, so we can't even pretend to be capable of programming every aspect of this initiative).

We need YOU GUYS, the community, to take part in shaping our app through the BETA phases. To do your part, sign up for a reward by pledging $25 or more and become a valuable member of our  BETA & developer team.

Your money will be used to fund:

Development: US-based and offshore software development teams to create a full version of the app.

Business Registration: Initial legal costs / fees associated with bringing up a business here in the States. We are also vying to become a registered LLC, as well as a multi-platform compatible app. Initial release is set for the Android, iOS, and Windows App Stores, which together comprise 95.71% of our target audience (high school and college-attending students).

--

Risks & Challenges

We, as high school students in higher-level mathematics & science courses ourselves, know we need to balance our time between school and well, extracurricular work such as this. Our school is such that by now, we know how to manage that time effectively and efficiently.

Please know that your money will be used with the utmost caution and care, and we will not waste a single cent on personal objectives or anything else aside from this project, which we will try our best to complete at the aforementioned dates.

Some setbacks (out of our hands) may include the level of funding we receive versus the level we need to develop our app into something competitive (not only competent). School work should not interfere with much because ensuring your money translates into tangible results IS our #1 priority.

--

Want to learn even more? Check out our interactive infographic at www.graphrapp.com or learn more about the company at www.insperiontech.com !

story:
We are Theresa Downing and Mark Kramer.  We recently returned from our fifth trip to Belize.  We started going in 2009 and during each trip have gone birding with a guide from Maya Centre Village.  The village is located in south-central Belize just to the east of the Maya Mountains.  Its location along the Southern Highway gives Maya Centre important highway access in a country where paved highways are few.  Its location at the entrance to the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Preserve provides an income source vital to the village’s survival.

 

 

View of the Maya Mountains from the village

 

Our guide for each birding trip was Ouscal Chun, a Mayan who formerly lived in the area that became the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary.  He and his extended family (as well as eight other families) were displaced when the preserve was created in the late 1980’s.

 

 

 

 

On the entrance road to Cockscomb Jaguar Preserve

 

 

 

 

Birding guide Ouscal Chun and Theresa

 

Each of our trips to Belize has provided us an opportunity to learn about the people of Maya Centre Village.  In conversation with Ouscal during our 2013 trip, the subject of the school at Maya Centre came up.  Ouscal spoke very passionately about the plight of the school and the children in Maya Centre, describing in detail how many of the children there don't even have the basic essentials they need for school.

The school at Maya Centre Village is nominally a Catholic-run institution for grades K-8.  A couple of years ago there was an attempt to consolidate this and another Mayan school.  The citizens of Maya Centre opposed the consolidation as the loss of their school would have greatly eroded their community and sense of identity (the Maya, like Native tribes in the States, can differ considerably by locality or group affiliation). 

 

 

 

 

 

Classroom at Maya Centre School

 

 

 

Classroom building at Maya Centre School

 

The citizens of Maya Centre were determined to retain their village school but it came at a considerable cost to the community.  The Belizean government pays the salaries of the teachers at the school.  The support from the church is minimal, leaving the burden of running the school to the community.  In addition to the basic school supplies there are fees required for each student to attend the school, a big financial burden for the parents and the community.

 

 

 

Headmaster Liberato Saqui and Mark

 

After our 2013 trip we decided we wanted to try to help the kids in some way and have spent considerable time in the last two years investigating what we could do. As individuals we can do a little but it seems like a drop in the ocean.  Added to that is the difficulty of working for the village as an outsider.

Maya Centre Village, like towns and cities everywhere, has internal struggles and divisions. We realized at a point that in order to get materials to the children it would be best to avoid any entanglements in local issues.  People who have worked in Belize for several years have advised us that the best way to see that help reaches the children is to give to them directly and to give the most basic supplies and materials.

The goal for our campaign is to use the money raised and spend it 100% on supplies that will be given directly to the students.  We have been scouring the Internet to find the best deals so that the money raised will buy as much as possible.  

For example:

•  $75 can purchase 937 #2 wood pencils

•  $75 can purchase 82 boxes of 8 color crayons

•  $50 can purchase 294 Bic pens

•  $50 can purchase 1,110 Band Aids

In addition, erasers, antibiotic ointment, toothbrushes and other necessities can be purchased with your help.

For our part, we have already begun to buy supplies and will continue to do so until it's time to ship to Belize.  To date we have purchased about $225 worth of school supplies (towards our personal goal of $250) to jump-start the project.  In addition, we are taking the financial responsibility to see that the materials get to Maya Centre.  We have identified a Texas NGO working in Belize that will ship the supplies to Belize City for us and we have hired a shipper there for the last leg of the journey.

 

What we've collected so far

 

When Belize became an independent nation in 1981, the country had an opportunity to avoid many of the mistakes and correct many of the wrongs that its people experienced during historic times.  Unfortunately, the Maya's situation was little improved.  When the families from the Cockscomb area were displaced they got no help from the government nor did they get any compensation or funding to begin their new lives elsewhere.  Our friends in Maya Centre told us that they used to get about 95% of what they needed from the jungle.  Now it's just the opposite.  Their traditional means of support - the jungle - is largely unavailable to them.  Much of the so-called Crown Lands have been sold off to private investors and the Maya can't afford to buy the land they once lived on.  Even a basic building material like thatch is no longer available because the jungle is no longer theirs.

 

This is a small project but one we believe can have an impact on the lives of the school children of Maya Centre Village.  By putting school supplies directly into the hands of the children we can free up funds that families can spend on other things, we can give the kids supplies they might not otherwise have and give them a little boost towards their future.  In some ways the Maya in Belize have one foot in the 19th century and the other in the 21st; running water and electricity are not taken for granted.  Change has happened very quickly and many are still struggling to find a new way to live.

 

If you’re reading this it’s possible you already have an interest in Belize, the Maya people or helping those in need in the developing world.  Belize is less than three hours by air from the U.S. but is a world apart.  Many of us have so much and take so much for granted.  Any help you can give is the right amount.  If a lot of us can only give a little, together we can help the kids at Maya Centre School.  If you can’t help but know others who might be interested, please pass this along to them.

Thanks.

 

There is much information available about Belize.  Here are a few links:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Belize

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cockscomb_Basin_Wildlife_Sanctuary

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Maya-Center-Mayan-Museum/120353814671831

http://www.belizeaudubon.org/?page_id=3605

This book (below) is a good way to get acquainted with the recent history of the Cockscomb area and Maya Centre.  It’s a worthwhile read and is a first-person look at the people and the area.

http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/213258.Jaguar

4/14/2015
Thanks very much to those of you who donated.  Within the first few hours we had already received 20% of our goal.  If you are a fan of Jeeves you would know he'd express it as "most gratifying"!  In addition to the contributions here, we've been given checks  exceeding  $100.  Thanks to everyone for their generosity.

4/21/2015
Eight days into the campaign and we're nearly at 1/3 of our goal.  Ten donors nearly averaged $50 each.  Every contribution helps no matter if it's small or large.  Because we're buying little things like pencils and pens, little donations still make a difference.  At $0.08@, a five dollar donation buys 60 pencils.  It's all good.

4/28/2015
Thanks to all who have donated.  Today we officially passed the 1/3 mark with 2 new donations.  To those of you considering a donation, please do so.  Even a $5 donation is important and the materials it can buy will go directly to the kids of Maya Center.  This is the first step of what I hope will be an ongoing effort to help the school at Maya Center.  I have been working on an idea for a computer lab for the school to prepare the students for the time they enter high school.  The success of the current campaign will set the course of future fundraising projects for Maya Center.  Please help if you can.

6/4/2015
Nine days left and still a ways to go.  The campaign has been quiet for a few weeks but following an update we've had a spike in donations today and are finally over 50%.  Thanks to everyone who donated and to those passing along the word.  Every donation buys something for these kids.  Thanks so much.

 

12/24/2016

Incredibly it was only two weeks ago that the supplies finally got in the hands of the kids.  By the time we received all the materials and got them ready to ship to Texas it was mid-August 2014;  they arrived in Texas by the end of August.  All was well but the pallet with the supplies missed the next shipment to Belize.  It was forwarded to a warehouse in Mobile, AL and was there until October 2016 when it was loaded into a container and left for Belize.  The supplies arrived in Belize City around the 6th of December, were picked up by our friends from Maya Center and distributed the following week by the PTA.  So, as promised here are some pics of the supplies finally in the hands of the kids at Maya Center.  Thanks to all for your kind support. 

 

 

 

 

Thanks!
story_txt: We are Theresa Downing and Mark Kramer.  We recently returned from our fifth trip to Belize.  We started going in 2009 and during each trip have gone birding with a guide from Maya Centre Village.  The village is located in south-central Belize just to the east of the Maya Mountains.  Its location along the Southern Highway gives Maya Centre important highway access in a country where paved highways are few.  Its location at the entrance to the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Preserve provides an income source vital to the village’s survival.  View of the Maya Mountains from the village Our guide for each birding trip was Ouscal Chun, a Mayan who formerly lived in the area that became the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary.  He and his extended family (as well as eight other families) were displaced when the preserve was created in the late 1980’s.    On the entrance road to Cockscomb Jaguar Preserve    Birding guide Ouscal Chun and Theresa Each of our trips to Belize has provided us an opportunity to learn about the people of Maya Centre Village.  In conversation with Ouscal during our 2013 trip, the subject of the school at Maya Centre came up.  Ouscal spoke very passionately about the plight of the school and the children in Maya Centre, describing in detail how many of the children there don't even have the basic essentials they need for school.The school at Maya Centre Village is nominally a Catholic-run institution for grades K-8.  A couple of years ago there was an attempt to consolidate this and another Mayan school.  The citizens of Maya Centre opposed the consolidation as the loss of their school would have greatly eroded their community and sense of identity (the Maya, like Native tribes in the States, can differ considerably by locality or group affiliation).      Classroom at Maya Centre School   Classroom building at Maya Centre School The citizens of Maya Centre were determined to retain their village school but it came at a considerable cost to the community.  The Belizean government pays the salaries of the teachers at the school.  The support from the church is minimal, leaving the burden of running the school to the community.  In addition to the basic school supplies there are fees required for each student to attend the school, a big financial burden for the parents and the community.   Headmaster Liberato Saqui and Mark After our 2013 trip we decided we wanted to try to help the kids in some way and have spent considerable time in the last two years investigating what we could do. As individuals we can do a little but it seems like a drop in the ocean.  Added to that is the difficulty of working for the village as an outsider.Maya Centre Village, like towns and cities everywhere, has internal struggles and divisions. We realized at a point that in order to get materials to the children it would be best to avoid any entanglements in local issues.  People who have worked in Belize for several years have advised us that the best way to see that help reaches the children is to give to them directly and to give the most basic supplies and materials.The goal for our campaign is to use the money raised and spend it 100% on supplies that will be given directly to the students.  We have been scouring the Internet to find the best deals so that the money raised will buy as much as possible.  For example:•  $75 can purchase 937 #2 wood pencils•  $75 can purchase 82 boxes of 8 color crayons•  $50 can purchase 294 Bic pens•  $50 can purchase 1,110 Band AidsIn addition, erasers, antibiotic ointment, toothbrushes and other necessities can be purchased with your help.For our part, we have already begun to buy supplies and will continue to do so until it's time to ship to Belize.  To date we have purchased about $225 worth of school supplies (towards our personal goal of $250) to jump-start the project.  In addition, we are taking the financial responsibility to see that the materials get to Maya Centre.  We have identified a Texas NGO working in Belize that will ship the supplies to Belize City for us and we have hired a shipper there for the last leg of the journey. What we've collected so far When Belize became an independent nation in 1981, the country had an opportunity to avoid many of the mistakes and correct many of the wrongs that its people experienced during historic times.  Unfortunately, the Maya's situation was little improved.  When the families from the Cockscomb area were displaced they got no help from the government nor did they get any compensation or funding to begin their new lives elsewhere.  Our friends in Maya Centre told us that they used to get about 95% of what they needed from the jungle.  Now it's just the opposite.  Their traditional means of support - the jungle - is largely unavailable to them.  Much of the so-called Crown Lands have been sold off to private investors and the Maya can't afford to buy the land they once lived on.  Even a basic building material like thatch is no longer available because the jungle is no longer theirs. This is a small project but one we believe can have an impact on the lives of the school children of Maya Centre Village.  By putting school supplies directly into the hands of the children we can free up funds that families can spend on other things, we can give the kids supplies they might not otherwise have and give them a little boost towards their future.  In some ways the Maya in Belize have one foot in the 19th century and the other in the 21st; running water and electricity are not taken for granted.  Change has happened very quickly and many are still struggling to find a new way to live. If you’re reading this it’s possible you already have an interest in Belize, the Maya people or helping those in need in the developing world.  Belize is less than three hours by air from the U.S. but is a world apart.  Many of us have so much and take so much for granted.  Any help you can give is the right amount.  If a lot of us can only give a little, together we can help the kids at Maya Centre School.  If you can’t help but know others who might be interested, please pass this along to them.Thanks. There is much information available about Belize.  Here are a few links:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Belizehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cockscomb_Basin_Wildlife_Sanctuaryhttps://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Maya-Center-Mayan-Museum/120353814671831http://www.belizeaudubon.org/?page_id=3605This book (below) is a good way to get acquainted with the recent history of the Cockscomb area and Maya Centre.  It’s a worthwhile read and is a first-person look at the people and the area.http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/213258.Jaguar4/14/2015Thanks very much to those of you who donated.  Within the first few hours we had already received 20% of our goal.  If you are a fan of Jeeves you would know he'd express it as "most gratifying"!  In addition to the contributions here, we've been given checks  exceeding  $100.  Thanks to everyone for their generosity.4/21/2015Eight days into the campaign and we're nearly at 1/3 of our goal.  Ten donors nearly averaged $50 each.  Every contribution helps no matter if it's small or large.  Because we're buying little things like pencils and pens, little donations still make a difference.  At $0.08@, a five dollar donation buys 60 pencils.  It's all good.4/28/2015Thanks to all who have donated.  Today we officially passed the 1/3 mark with 2 new donations.  To those of you considering a donation, please do so.  Even a $5 donation is important and the materials it can buy will go directly to the kids of Maya Center.  This is the first step of what I hope will be an ongoing effort to help the school at Maya Center.  I have been working on an idea for a computer lab for the school to prepare the students for the time they enter high school.  The success of the current campaign will set the course of future fundraising projects for Maya Center.  Please help if you can.6/4/2015Nine days left and still a ways to go.  The campaign has been quiet for a few weeks but following an update we've had a spike in donations today and are finally over 50%.  Thanks to everyone who donated and to those passing along the word.  Every donation buys something for these kids.  Thanks so much. 12/24/2016Incredibly it was only two weeks ago that the supplies finally got in the hands of the kids.  By the time we received all the materials and got them ready to ship to Texas it was mid-August 2014;  they arrived in Texas by the end of August.  All was well but the pallet with the supplies missed the next shipment to Belize.  It was forwarded to a warehouse in Mobile, AL and was there until October 2016 when it was loaded into a container and left for Belize.  The supplies arrived in Belize City around the 6th of December, were picked up by our friends from Maya Center and distributed the following week by the PTA.  So, as promised here are some pics of the supplies finally in the hands of the kids at Maya Center.  Thanks to all for your kind support.     Thanks!

story:
OUR PROVEN "BEE LINE" TO CHINESE FOR ALL CHINESE LEARNERS

Each word is presented through an animation. A picture is shown, a sound is heard, the character’s stroke sequence is shown, and an English translation and interpretation are provided.


The images are important as they show the meaning of a word and what each stroke represents – as Chinese characters are ‘pictograms’!


Even our modern images are based on expert research of Chinese paleography – relating the ancient Chinese characters to what we know.


References to Chinese culture that contribute to the meaning of words are included too.

Words with shared visual elements are identified and presented together to pinpoint those elements, and promote the understanding and retention of those words.

… and words are linked thematically within pictures representing actual contexts, to enable learners to understand the words’ overlapping meanings, and more quickly grasp new vocabulary.


BEELINE CHINESE ATTENDS TO FOUR ESSENTIAL ASPECTS

A team of four professionals have laid the plan for the Beeline Chinese:

1. Teaching via audio and visual aids

2. The structural underpinnings of the Chinese language

3. Cross-cultural communication

4. Developmental psychology and learning


Dr. Hsiao-ying Tseng, Chinese language learning program designer, NY, USA

From the first character in her childhood, an etymological picture sketched by her father, Hsiao-ying has been enchanted by the fantastic world of ideograms. Not surprisingly, she chose to study Chinese language and literature at university. After several years teaching Chinese literature in Taiwan, Hsiao-ying went on to further studies in England. She first pursued Museum Education as a means to facilitate voluntary learning, and then looked deeper into Cross-cultural Communication, so essential for the globe village we now live in. Along these lines, once she arrived England, she was blessed with a career opportunity that allowed her to put these points into practice - teaching Chinese as a foreign language.

As such, she counts herself as being very lucky to promote a greater understanding of world language and culture.

Dr. Jason Xiong, Computer Scientist, NY, USA

Dr. Xiong is a veteran computer scientist who is always passionate about using information technology to make a positive impact on society. He believes that technology should improve people around the world to freely communicate with each other and truly appreciate the value of and differences between various cultures. He fell in love with the Beeline Chinese methodology the moment he experienced it himself, as he saw Beeline Chinese not only make learning Chinese easy and fun, but also help people understanding Chinese culture better and deeper. Therefore, he is determined to do his part to make the Beeline Chinese way of learning Chinese accessible to everyone.

Dr. Shao-Tzu Chen, Lecturer in Chinese Philology, Taiwan

Dr. Chen is a Chinese philologist. Having completed a bachelor degree in Chinese language and literature, she spent ten years pursuing her M.A. and Ph.D. in Chinese philology. She became an assistant professor and, since then, has lectured in her favorite subject. Shao-Tzu is a shy, reserved but amiable person. However, she is always ardent and tough in questioning doubts and clearing up confusion in her philological research.

Beeline Chinese has certainly benefited tremendously from Shao-Tzu’s most rigorous and thorough research.

Dr. Anthony Rifkin, Developmental & Neuropsychologist, NY, USA

Dr. Rifkin has a keen interest in how people’s psychology and language work together. The very special etymological work shared in Beeline Chinese gets at the very core of how we use language to think. And it does so in the most fascinating way – as with Beeline Chinese, we get to see how those first language users in ancient times were ‘thinking’, and how that’s wholly related to our own thinking today! Getting to work with the folks at Beeline Chinese has therefore been a rich experience for Dr. Rifkin, which he’s thankful for, as it has interfaced with both his research in how we categorize, as well as his clinical work with language-challenged individuals, all of whom are going to love using Beeline Chinese themselves!


BEELINE CHINESE MAKES LEARNING CHINESE EFFECTIVE AND FUN

Acquiring words is the vital first step to communication

Beeline Chinese has one simple aim: to make sure its users understand every word, and how to use it in daily conversation of all types, i.e., in personal and business communications.

In Chinese, there are no alphabetic letters. Chinese words are made out of characters, which might look strange to an English reader.

However, Chinese characters are actually pictures of what they represent.

Some Chinese words are expressed by a single character (like those you just saw on the screen), while others are expressed by combinations of characters.


As such, Beeline Chinese emphasizes the recognition of Chinese characters as the building block of the Chinese language. The beeline to Chinese we’ve laid out is based on thorough research into the Chinese language system. It is organized and presented in a way that learners can understand it quickly and easily, and has been refined by the feedback we’ve received from users.

Generally speaking, our principal achievement is that it only takes one minute for a Beeline Chinese user to get one character, with a solid understanding. To be able to write the characters is different from recognizing them, and that won’t affect daily communication. So we include the exercise program for practicing the writing in the lessons App, as an additional option.

Knowing the structure of a language allows one to learn it efficiently

Starting from characters, we analyze the patterns of Chinese expressions and sentences, so that the learners will know how to use the language straightaway.

A team of Chinese language experts, led by Dr. Chen, have done systematic paleographic research, using the most authoritative sources on the history and teaching of Chinese characters, and have converted the information into a format accessible by even young beginners. Another team, led by Dr. Tseng, have produced succinct guides to Chinese sentence structures and the principles for producing Chinese phrases. For years, both aspects have been well received and continuously refined, based on users’ feedback.

The Beeline Chinese method therefore not only provides a means for easy absorption, but can also lay a foundation for appreciating Chinese literary classics, and comprehending academic concepts. A successful Beeline student will be able to understand subject matter such as found in the Tao Te Ching (道德經) and the theories behind Chinese traditional medicine. They could even complete their own professional studies in Chinese, as in their own native language.

Most importantly, Beeline Chinese will help you to learn Chinese, 1 character at a time – as you’ll be able to master the recognition of 1 character in just 1 minute.

… and with a bit more practice, you’ll know how to use that word!


USERS' TESTIMONY

Oh! I get it now!

I often hear exclamations like these from my students, when I present them with the Chinese characters, using Beeline Chinese.

I used to dread teaching this reading and writing to my American students. It was just too hard. Even for Chinese kids, they hated having to memorize the characters by copying. But it doesn’t have to be that way anymore!

With Beeline Chinese, reading and writing the Chinese characters became my student’s favorite part of the lesson, no matter if they were 5 years old or adults. And once they learned the characters, it stays with them. The sounds may then be tricky, but they remember the meaning of each character, so they have something to attach the sounds too.

Beeline Chinese materials help students understand the characters by sharing the clues behind each character, connecting it to a history 5,000 years old, showing the philosophy, history, artefacts, and science of those times, and in that, how they used to live and think.

Lesson after lesson, each of my students are fascinated by the characters. Some of the characters are very poetic, with beautiful imagery, like the verb, 是, depicting a person walking at dawn, looking at the sun rising, and at his shadow behind him, his own existence and the existence of everything suddenly becoming so palpable.

Beeline Chinese is going to revolutionize learning Chinese. You will never look at the characters the same way again.

Beeline Chinese is fun and saves me a lot of time.

All my father’s family members are English but my mother is Chinese, she is also a Chinese teacher. Luckily I have had the opportunities to go to China every year since I was little. So you can imagine that my Chinese is not too bad in terms of having Chinese lessons twice a week during the school time. It still involved a lot of hard work until my mum introduced me to the Beeline Chinese. I wouldn’t really say that my Chinese has been improved tremendously since, but I really enjoy learning on Beeline Chinese, it’s fun and saving me a lot of time as well as improving my range of Chinese vocabulary. I can then use the spare time to learn many other things such as saxophone and piano as well as playing with my friends.


WHAT WE’VE COMPLETED

We’ve completed the research for all 6,000+ Chinese characters. We’ve also determined the method for arriving at appropriate pictures, and the way to present the various materials that make the learning process easy, effective, and fun. And we’ve compiled all of this content for the first 300 characters for two forthcoming products: the Beeline Chinese Dictionary and the Beeline Chinese Lesson App.

Beeline Chinese Dictionary

An intuitive Chinese-English dictionary for all Chinese learners and teachers

While acquiring Chinese words is the vital first step to communication, learning Chinese has been greatly hampered by the lack of a good dictionary - till now.

Beeline Chinese utilizes an approach that makes searching for target words far easier. Our multi-index system even enables people who have no prior experience to start their search right away.

Core features of Beeline Chinese Dictionay:

VARIOUS WAYS TO FIND A WORD

Quick Search
Simply key in any trace you know of the target word


Pictorial & Categorized
Find the target word from categorized pictures


Component Index
Find a word by click one of its elements


Radical Index
Find the target word by its radical


PinYin Index
Find the target word by its PinYin


English Index
Find the target word by English equivalent


ADDITIONAL TOOLS AND FEATURES
To support the learning process and maximize the outcome


SUPPORT FOR MULTIPLE SCREEN SIZES AND DEVICES


Beeline Chinese Lesson App

An App for individuals to learn through lessons

The Beeline Chinese Lesson App is a great way for individuals to learn Chinese at their own pace. Characters have been carefully chosen for their arrangement together in lessons, and are presented in a convenient and intuitive interface.

The interface smoothly integrates learning with reading, listening, handwriting, exercises, flashcards, and notes, each at the right level.

The App also contains a handwriting interface that makes learning to write Chinese characters easy and fun. It includes features such as exercises with three levels that help one to develop one’s writing skill, step by step. An immediate scoring of one’s handwriting provides fast feedback for one’s learning. And the App allows easy access to one’s history and progress, to see how one is doing.


WHY WE'RE CROWDFUNDING

We are now seeking worldwide support on Indiegogo, releasing Beeline Chinese with the first 300 words of the Beeline Chinese course.

Although Beeline Chinese will continue to grow and improve, we’ve completed all the essential research, and both the structure and the content of the program are now in place. Our appeal here is therefore to raise the money we need to complete the pictures and animations, and adapt the program for different digital platforms, to fully bring it the world.

We've been developing the project with the help of volunteer professionals, but we now need to expand the team to produce all of the content. Our plan is to complete the presentation of the first 1,200 characters in three months; and continue to produce the rest of 6,000+ characters, as presented in the TIME LINE in the section below (see June, 2016 there, and up!)

To this end, WE'RE HOPING TO RAISE $100,000 (US)


TIME LINE

THE TEAM


OUR STORY

Beeline Chinese was developed over two generations: Hsiao-ying’s parents and Hsiao-ying. Both Hsiao-ying’s parents were educators responsible for setting up modern state schools in their home province in China during the 1930s. At home, they taught their children Chinese by revealing the etymological images of each word. When Hsiao-ying became a teacher, and taught Chinese language and literature, she used the same method and got to see how successful it was. Later Hsiao-ying went to England for her further studies and kept improving the method for both Chinese native and English speaking communities, working on the whole in terms of etymological analyses, and organizing it into the types of learning materials you see here.

Since the method was so well received, Hsiao-ying decided to build the full framework for Beeline Chinese online, in order to share this method with anyone who wants to learn Chinese. Over the last ten years, Hsiao-ying has been very lucky to have the constant support from so many of her colleagues, students and their parents. To her, they are the primary source for the birth of Beeline Chinese.


THANK YOU

Thank you for taking the time to get to know Beeline Chinese. We hope that you're just as excited as we are in introducing Beeline Chinese to the world. Your support is extremely valuable to us. If you have any questions, comments or feedback, please let us know through the comment section here, or by emailing us at beelinechinese@gmail.com

It still involved a lot of hard work until my mum introduced me to the Beeline Chinese. I wouldn’t really say that my Chinese has been improved tremendously since, but I really enjoy learning on Beeline Chinese, it’s fun and saving me a lot of time as well as improving my range of Chinese vocabulary. I can then use the spare time to learn many other things such as saxophone and piano as well as playing with my friends.
        

 


WHAT WE’VE COMPLETED





We’ve completed the research for all 6,000+ Chinese characters. We’ve also determined the method for arriving at appropriate pictures, and the way to present the various materials that make the learning process easy, effective, and fun. And we’ve compiled all of this content for the first 300 characters for two forthcoming products: the Beeline Chinese Dictionary and the Beeline Chinese Lesson App.

Beeline Chinese Dictionary
An intuitive Chinese-English dictionary for all Chinese learners and teachers

            While acquiring Chinese words is the vital first step to communication, learning Chinese has been greatly hampered by the lack of a good dictionary - till now.
        

            Beeline Chinese utilizes an approach that makes searching for target words far easier. Our multi-index system even enables people who have no prior experience to start their search right away. 

Core features of Beeline Chinese Dictionay:


VARIOUS WAYS TO FIND A WORD

Quick Search
Simply key in any trace you know of the target word







Pictorial & Categorized
Find the target word from categorized pictures







Component Index
Find a word by click one of its elements







Radical Index
Find the target word by its radical







PinYin Index
Find the target word by its PinYin








English Index
Find the target word by English equivalent






ADDITIONAL TOOLS AND FEATURES
To support the learning process and maximize the outcome

SUPPORT FOR MULTIPLE SCREEN SIZES AND DEVICES




Beeline Chinese Lesson App
An App for individuals to learn through lessons

            The Beeline Chinese Lesson App is a great way for individuals to learn Chinese at their own pace. Characters have been carefully chosen for their arrangement together in lessons, and are presented in a convenient and intuitive interface.
        
 

            The interface smoothly integrates learning with reading, listening, handwriting, exercises, flashcards, and notes, each at the right level. 
        
The App also contains a handwriting interface that makes learning to write Chinese characters easy and fun. It includes features such as exercises with three levels that help one to develop one’s writing skill, step by step. An immediate scoring of one’s handwriting provides fast feedback for one’s learning. And the App allows easy access to one’s history and progress, to see how one is doing.



WHY WE'RE CROWDFUNDING


We are now seeking worldwide support on Indiegogo, releasing Beeline Chinese with the first 300 words of the Beeline Chinese course. 


            Although Beeline Chinese will continue to grow and improve, we’ve completed all the essential research, and both the structure and the content of the program are now in place. Our appeal here is therefore to raise the money we need to complete the pictures and animations, and adapt the program for different digital platforms, to fully bring it the world.

            We've been developing the project with the help of volunteer professionals, but we now need to expand the team to produce all of the content. Our plan is to complete the presentation of the first 1,200 characters in three months; and continue to produce the rest of 6,000+ characters, as presented in the TIME LINE in the section below (see June, 2016 there, and up!)


            To this end, WE'RE HOPING TO RAISE $100,000 (US)
        



TIME LINE









THE TEAM









OUR STORY



Beeline Chinese was developed over two generations: Hsiao-ying’s parents and Hsiao-ying. Both Hsiao-ying’s parents were educators responsible for setting up modern state schools in their home province in China during the 1930s. At home, they taught their children Chinese by revealing the etymological images of each word. When Hsiao-ying became a teacher, and taught Chinese language and literature, she used the same method and got to see how successful it was. Later Hsiao-ying went to England for her further studies and kept improving the method for both Chinese native and English speaking communities, working on the whole in terms of etymological analyses, and organizing it into the types of learning materials you see here.
Since the method was so well received, Hsiao-ying decided to build the full framework for Beeline Chinese online, in order to share this method with anyone who wants to learn Chinese. Over the last ten years, Hsiao-ying has been very lucky to have the constant support from so many of her colleagues, students and their parents. To her, they are the primary source for the birth of Beeline Chinese.



THANK YOU



            Thank you for taking the time to get to know Beeline Chinese. We hope that you're just as excited as we are in introducing Beeline Chinese to the world. Your support is extremely valuable to us. If you have any questions, comments or feedback, please let us know through the comment section here, or by emailing us at beelinechinese@gmail.com

story:
Who are we?

We are middle school students at Lesher International Baccalaureate (IB) World Middle School in Fort Collins, Colorado.  We applied for and were accepted into an Extended Learning Opportunity focused on sustainability.  One of the many treats we experience as a part of the service learning class is a trip to Catalina Environmental Leadership Program (CELP) in California from November 11 -16, 2016. Part of being an IB student is striving to be knowledgeable, open-minded, inquirers, principled, balanced, reflective, and caring.  We hope to practice all of these characteristics while running this campaign and on Catalina Island.

What we're doing?

This unique, high-energy learning experience gives us what we cannot find in a classroom: a chance to study natural ecosystems and sustainable living firsthand and hands on. We learn about sustainable living practices such as composting, recycling, and organic gardening, discovering how nature provides perfect examples of communities functioning in a self-sustaining way.  Last but not least, we want to pay it forward by teaching others small things that make a huge impact on the planet!

There are 8 of us are participating in this fundraising campaign. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The hard costs for each student are $685.  All of our money for the trip is due by the end of October.  We are running a very short 10-day campaign so please donate today. 
  • Our goal is to raise $500 per student participating or $4000. Our stretch goal is $5000, and of course we're gonna GO FOR IT, but we wanted to set an achievable goal. 
  • Depending on your level of support, supporters will...
  • Receive a hand-written postcard from Catalina Island sharing what we have learned, OR
  • Receive a special thank you photo of our group at Catalina Island matted and signed by all the students.  

 

  • If we don't reach our goal, the money we DO raise will go towards the trip and we will brainstorm for new fundraising ideas.
  • If we exceed our stretch goal, we will help supplement costs for other students or teachers or will contribute to a fund to establish scholarships for next year.
  • If you have  a specific student that you would like to help, you may do that by putting the student's name in the "2nd address" section.  And, of course, you can donate to the shared fund as well. 

 

Students Participating

  • Gwen Rodriguez
  • Adelaide Kuehn
  • Shane Gleason
  • Giovanna Arelio
  • Thatcher Sanders
  • Deklyn Miller
  • Grace Prenni
  • Lydia Genson

************************************************************

If you are supporting a specific student, please make note of that in your perk donation in the "2nd address line" of your mailing address.    If no name is listed, we will be happy to see the group fund grow.  Group or specific, perks are from the entire Catalina Kids crew!  If you have any questions before or after your donation, don't hesitate to email us.  

*************************************************************************

 

Social Change & Leadership Skills

As middle school students we are working to build both social change and leadership skills through this program. 

 "Research shows that the foundation to both of these begin during the transformative years in adolescence and greatly impact the long term impact these have on individuals for the rest of their lives."

"Extensive studies provide enough evidence to conclude that adolescents can be developed as Leaders if required traits are identified and appropriate environment is created for nurturing such adolescents. Various theories have been propounded by scholars and researchers for developing leadership.  It is our strong belief that this is an excellent program for enhancing the development of these core leadership traits in these students.  The following graphic showcases the four C's of Leadership that will be enhanced through participation in this program."

 

So What are Our Risks?

  • This campaign is different.  
  • It is NOT just about the money. 
  • Its about the process of creating the campaign, working as a team, cherishing the opportunity to build leadership skills, and sharing how grateful we are for your support in a meaningful way. 
  •  We are learning to ask for help which is harder than we thought.  Its hard to put ourselves out there and take this risk. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you reading this know us and know the program, and some of you are learning about us for the first time.  We would love and appreciate your financial support.  However, your willingness to share our story with those around you is just as meaningful in some ways.  

  • Please help us the share tool from this campaign

story:
Overview

The Harry Potter Alliance is dedicating ourselves to showing up for immigrants, fighting for the climate, engaging young voters, and much more.

For 14 years, we’ve proven the power of story to inspire and drive change. Today, dark forces tell stories designed to drive fear, hate, and hopelessness. The HPA will fight back around the world by helping fans reclaim the power of story and make a major impact in communities, in the streets, and at the ballot box.

 

The Power of Story

The Harry Potter Alliance is a game-changing, innovative organization that uses the power of pop culture to transform fans into activists. We bring community organizing to online and offline fan spaces and channel fans’ creativity, passion, and critical thinking into making real world change. By pivoting people to action using the stories they already love, the HPA provides fun, hopeful ways for fans to become long-term activists. 

Our method is working: the HPA has over 200 chapters and 90K members in all 50 U.S. states and 30 countries. These members are largely young women and LGBTQIA+ folks, and nearly 60% had never before been involved in activism. In the last year, the HPA has trained over 1,000 emerging activists, worked with the ACLU to defeat an anti-immigrant ballot measure in Oregon (making over 7,000 calls to voters!), stocked a school library that serves primarily migrant children with thousands of books as part of the Accio Books campaign, and collaborated with Sunrise Movement to drive hundreds of activists to action opposing a new fossil fuel plant in Philadelphia.

This Fall, the HPA will continue to push fans to become passionate, engaged lifetime activists because we believe that by creating an interconnected community of activism and story experts we can reclaim and rewrite the story of civic engagement in America and around the world. 

 

Why Does It Need Funding?

As a fan-led nonprofit, the HPA relies almost entirely on generous donations from people like you. When you donate to our campaign, you’re not just getting some great perks - you’re investing in a community of people who are working week after week to make activism accessible to folks who might not otherwise be activists.  For every $1,500 we raise, we’ll be able to keep our world-class trainings and campaigns going for one week. If we meet our initial goal of $20,000, we'll be able to commit to 13 weeks of meaningful action to support fans in reclaiming the power of story. 

 

PERKS

Whether you have a dollar to spare or the resources to become an official member of the Order of the Phoenix, we’ve provided perk bundles to satisfy a broad range of magical philanthropists. Because we’re all about supporting long-term, healthy activists, everyone who donates will receive a copy of “A Spell for Feeling Well”, a guide to self care from our friends at Heroine Training! We’ll also be releasing exclusive perks from amazing folks like Jackson Bird, Neil Gaiman, Harry and the Potters, Tonks and the Aurors, Emily Graslie, Preeti Chhibber, and more as the campaign unfolds! Be the first to find out about new perks by joining our email list.

 

Meet the Team

Acacia Ludwig, Creative Director. Growing up in a family of artists and surrounded by the vibrant world of Chinatown, New York, Acacia strives to embody a deep and sincere love for artistic expression, good storytelling, and social justice for all people. While she has had stints in acting and modeling, Acacia’s most dedicated work is in music and design. As a musician, Acacia has had the honor to collaborate with some of the world’s greatest rock musicians while living in LA, NYC, and her current home of Woodstock, New York. As a designer, Acacia has created a countless array of logos and web sites for a variety of bands and social justice organizations. She has been working with the HPA since 2007, literally shaping the face of the organization with her artwork and attitude.

Amber Ducharme, Finance Director. Amber is a proud Hufflepuff who enjoys using her love of numbers to help make the world a better place. With ten years of experience in nonprofit accounting, Amber oversees the HPA's Finance and Human Resources Departments. She holds a B.A. in Mathematics and an M.S. in Accounting.

Janae Phillips, Director of Leadership & Education. In her ten years as a program designer and community organizer Janae has been a passionate advocate for creating more playful, engaging leadership training. She manages the HPA’s chapters program, which spans six continents, is the architect behind their immersive story-based leadership retreat, and is their lead curriculum writer. Janae holds a B.S. in Family Studies and Human Development, concentration in Leadership Studies and Practice, and an M.S. in Educational Technology.

Katie Bowers, Managing Director. As the Managing Director for the Harry Potter Alliance, Katie has organized thousands of fans across the globe to make a difference on gender equity, LGBTQ+ rights, literacy, access to education, and more. A Ravenclaw hoping to do some good, Katie has been integrating her love of pop culture and social justice through organizing initiatives and experiential education since 2005.  Katie holds an M.S.W. in Community Organizing, Planning and Development.

story: My name is Tess Barber. I am fourteen years old .I have attended a small non profit independent school in Bethlehem, NH, for 8 years called Woodland Community School. Woodland is an independent school serving grades K-8. As a tradition for graduating students, I am doing a capstone project before I transition to high school. This project will leave my lasting imprint on the school. Singing and performing have always been a great passion of mine, and it seems fitting that my last gift to the school is something that signifies just that. I want to build an outdoor stage where students can perform plays and other performances. I am also writing a full length play adaption of The Hobbit that the whole school will perform in June. ANY contribution will mean so much to me and my school, Thank You for your support.

story:
O ČO IDE?

BUDUJEME SYSTÉM VZÁJOMNEJ KOOPERÁCIE LOKÁLNYCH OBCHODNÍKOV A OBYVATEĽOV V MIESTE ICH BYDLISKA.

Projekt je zameraný na podporu zmeny myslenia, zlepšenie životnej a morálnej úrovne prostredníctvom obchodníkov.

Oni prichádzajú do kontaktu s ľuďmi a majú priestor na to, aby mohli podávať informácie, ktoré majú viesť obe strany k naplneniu stanovených atribútov systému, ZÁKLADNÝCH PREJAVOV ČLOVEČINY a SLUŠNÉHO SPRÁVANIA!

 SPÁJAME OBCHODNÍKOV S OBYVATEĽMI V MIESTE ICH PODNIKANIA 

Spoločná značka vytyčuje zónu miestnych obchodníkov, ktorí spolupracujú na princípe vzájomného doporučenia. 

VEDIEME ĽUDÍ

  • aby navštevovali v prvom rade miestnych obchodníkov, ktorí patria do   systému
  • aby vytvárali dopyt po produktoch a službách, ktoré im u nich chýbajú
  • aby až potom hľadali riešenie v nákupných centrách, inom meste alebo na  internete.

UČÍME PERSONÁL KOMUNIKOVAŤ SO ZÁKAZNÍKMI

  • ako sa zdvorilo pozdraviť 
  • poznať produkty s ktorými pracuje
  • vedieť sa opýtať, poďakovať, správne odporučiť, vysvetliť 
  • vedieť navrhnúť riešenie a nie sa vyhovárať  
  • slušne požiadať ak im niečo chýba v ponuke podnikateľa
  • jednať profesionálne, odborne s nadhľadom a úsmevom na tvári 

OČAKÁVANÉ VÝSLEDKY

  • zvýšenie počtu záujemcov o činnosť lokálnych obchodníkov 
  • obnovenie zvyku pomáhať jeden druhému 
  • prehĺbenie  záujmu o lokálnu sféru, o miesto kde ľudia žijú
  • zlepšiť úroveň komunikácie 
  • zlepšiť kvalitu života 
  • vytvoriť protiváhu veľkoobchodných reťazcov
  • stabilizácia a rast regionálnej ekonomiky
Ak si myslíte, že náš systém môže byť jedným z riešení pre lepšie Slovensko, podporte  jeho realizáciu finančne, alebo nám pomôžte rozšíriť ho vo vašom meste. 

ZÍSKANÉ PROSTRIEDKY POUŽIJEME NA

  • Rozvoj, akceleráciu a testovanie systému
  • Náklady spojené s prácou na projekte, cestovné náklady, a iné
  • Vývoj komunikačných nástrojov systému, letáky, brožúry, samolepky a iné
  • Vývoj web portálu pre užívateľov 
  • Právny servis - zmluvy, všeobecné podmienky systému, iné právne náležitosti
  • Prezentačný stánok 
  • Reklamnú kampaň projektu, nadlinka, podlinka

AKO PRISPIEŤ? 

Kliknutím na CONTRIBUTE NOW sa dostanete do sekcie v ktorej si vyberiete výšku príspevku. 

Ak nemáte zriadený účet PAYPAL, použite peňažný prevod.

Tu je bankové spojenie: 

IBAN:SK2811000000002928904815


CHCETE SA ZAPOJIŤ AKTÍVNE VO VAŠOM MESTE?

 Vybavíme vás od hlavy až po päty

 Napíšte nám na ja@podporujemsuseda.sk 

 Alebo volajte na +421 650 52 00 56  /PON-PIA 09:00-18:00

/prichádzajúce hovory sú účtované ako miestny hovor/

zlepšiť kvalitu života 
vytvoriť protiváhu veľkoobchodných reťazcov
stabilizácia a rast regionálnej ekonomiky

Ak si myslíte, že náš systém
môže byť jedným z riešení pre lepšie Slovensko, podporte  jeho realizáciu finančne, alebo nám pomôžte rozšíriť
ho vo vašom meste. 



ZÍSKANÉ PROSTRIEDKY POUŽIJEME NA





Rozvoj, akceleráciu a testovanie systému
Náklady spojené s prácou na projekte, cestovné náklady, a iné
Vývoj komunikačných nástrojov systému, letáky, brožúry, samolepky a iné
Vývoj web portálu pre užívateľov 

Právny servis - zmluvy, všeobecné podmienky systému, iné právne náležitosti

Prezentačný stánok 
Reklamnú kampaň projektu, nadlinka, podlinka




AKO PRISPIEŤ? 

Kliknutím na CONTRIBUTE NOW sa dostanete do sekcie v ktorej si vyberiete výšku príspevku. 
Ak nemáte zriadený účet PAYPAL, použite peňažný prevod.
Tu je bankové spojenie: 
IBAN:SK2811000000002928904815

CHCETE SA ZAPOJIŤ AKTÍVNE VO VAŠOM MESTE?

 Vybavíme vás od hlavy až po päty


 Napíšte nám na ja@podporujemsuseda.sk 

 Alebo volajte na +421 650 52 00 56  /PON-PIA 09:00-18:00
/prichádzajúce hovory sú účtované ako miestny hovor/

story:
About Me

I'm a young professional and civic engagement designer in Columbus.  In my community I manage member and community affairs for the Columbus Partnership, a non-profit CEO organization; run the Central Ohio Leadership Academy (COLA), our region's premier high school leadership development experience; and serve as Chair for the Create Columbus Commission, a millennial policy and grant making body appointed by the Mayor and Council President.  I am a pragmatic, result-driven, big picture thinker who endeavors to create structural support systems that drive continual improvements that have a wide-ranging impact.

Fund my Journey

I have been looking for an experiential leadership development experience - and I think I found the perfect one, the Millennial Trains Project (MTP), an award-winning non-profit that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers, grow as leaders, and launch projects that benefit and inspire their communities.

Participants get on board by pitching a project they want to advance across the communities where the train stops, and then race to crowdfund the cost of their ticket to ride.  My project proposal has been accepted, and now I need your help to raise $5,000 in the next month to secure my seat on the next journey.

MTP

If my campaign is among the first 30 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs.  If I am not among the first 30 applicants to reach  my crowdfunding goal, none of my supporters will be charged.

Here is the experience you will be funding:

  • We travel in a caravan of vintage rail cars -- it is an incubator of ideas and symbol of progress powered by millennial aspirations and a world-class coalition of partners.  

  • On the train there are daily purpose-based leadership development sessions in partnership withCity Year and multiple world-class design-thinking workshops in partnership with IDEO. 
  • The on-train chef prepares meals with ingredients sourced from local farmers and food purveyors in each city.
  • This year's journeys are a week long and we'll visit 5 cities.  In each city where we stop, MTP establishes a local hub (usually a creative design studio or startup space) where we will attend morning workshops led by local leaders. Here, we learn about local innovation and where the city is headed from a creative development perspective.  I then will get 5 to 6 hours in each MTP destination to advance a project that benefits, serves and inspires others. 
  • The train will be full with ambitious, eager, entrepreneurial, and community minded peers from around the country!  I can't wait to meet my kindred spirits :).
  • Here is a mini documentary from a previous trip.


My Project

I am passionate about two things, community development and leadership activation.  This trip, couldn't be more perfect for me.   Your funding will secure me a seat onto the Millennial Train, but more importantly provide me the opportunity to explore cross-generational leadership approaches to improving local communities across five different cities while participating in this experience.  

My MTP project,  “Co-Creation Road Map,”  will  identify best practices for increasing multigenerational collaboration to advance innovative civic problem solving.   The project will raise awareness of the benefits, best practices and strategies for breaking down age-oriented silos and increasing multigenerational collaboration, particularly in the public and non-profit sectors.

In each city, I will conduct a series of interviews and facilitated discussions about the direct and indirect benefits and barriers to engaging young professionals (YPs) as equal partners in shaping organizational strategy, influencing public policy, and tackling important community issues.  At the end of the trip, I will produce and share a series of informational resources to influence how organizations and leaders in Columbus think about engaging YPs.  

As part of the project, I will produce my first ever pod cast series.  I've never produced a pod cast series before, but am very much looking forward to learning the technology and curating the content.    

My ultimate goal is to increase the representation of emerging leaders in key positions and on boards.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Be my cheerleader and connector.  Please share my campaign with others.  If I secure a spot on the train, I'd welcome any introductions and ideas that you may have about who to engage with in each city.


Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

We would like to start by thanking all those who view our campaign and all those who contribute. We want you to know the gratitude we have for yoour support in helping us get to New York City. 

Now Introductions

Ashley Thorpe is a Junior at Northwest Missouri State University working towards a Bachelor of Science in Journalisms with a minor in Interactive Digitial Media. She has worked for NWMSU yearbook, working with the writing staff and photography staff. She has currently written an article on 2012 Spring fashion and provided a photo spread that will be published on the NWMSU online magazine. Ashley is a member of Digem, a Digital Electronic Media Organization, and enjoys doing design lighting for the NWMSU Dance Company. 

Cassie Swanson is a Junior at Northwest Missouri State University working towards a Bacherlor of Science in Applied Advertising with a minor in Interactive Digital Media. Cassie is apart of the Sigma Kappa sisterhood where she has held positions as Housing Chair, Overall Homecoming and Web Designer. She is also a Designer for the The Missourian Newspaper. Cassie is a member of The American Marketing Association, Sudent Activites Council, DigEm, and is an Executive officer with AdInk.

Our Trip

A one-week trip for Graphic Design and IDM students to New York City with the purpose of broadening our knowledge and exposure to some of the leading advertising agencies, design firms, publishing houses, broadcast media, and interactive firms in the world. This experience will show some of our potential career choices in each area, how we can prepare for our career search in those areas as far as course choices and portfolio preparation while attending Northwest, and the kinds of things we would be doing once we are hired. We will also hear from some leading creatives how to define and measure success when it comes to graphic design and how to think more creatively as a student and future designer. You will also be given a chance to present work and explore the city. 


What We Need

We would like to say that we understand our goal is steep considering the amount of time to raise it. Any money that is raised is greatly appreciated and will be split evenly between the two of us.

Your support will be going towards admission fees, travel, hotel, food, and the tuituion it takes to view up to 4 studios a day. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, and we absolutely understand that and thank you for simply taking the time to read our story. We hope that even if you can't contribute you will share this campaign with coworkers, friends, and loved ones. Please know, that even $5 is appreciated. 

Thank you!
Ashley & Cassie

P.s.
There is an assignment required after the trip, and 3 advanced/elective credits will be earned.

story:
As all of you know I have been in the middle of applying to work at Disney representing Canada in the Canadian Pavilion since August 2011. After phone interviews, online interviews and a flight to Toronto I have made the cut, the only problem is I never realized how much it costs getting to the US for a year! Flights, police checks, registration fees, living costs and insurance while there for 12 months have my bank in the red zone and I'm looking to raise money to fund this exciting once in a lifetime trip.

 

Thats where you come in. Your small contribution will help finalize my journey to Mickey Land and help me to grow as a Canadian artist while enrolling in studies at DisneyWorld and continuing to network with other artists from across the world.

 

Thank you in advance for all your support and I'm excited to share with you my exciting journey to Disney! 

.

story:
The CENTER FOR MULTIDIMENSIONAL PLANETARY HEALING

    There is a particularly beautiful place on Unci Maka ( Mother Earth) located south of Eagle Butte, SD.  People from all directions gather here for the annual healing of Mother Earth Ceremony and Sundance.  This gathering has been created and sustained by the people through the direction of a vision by spiritual helper, Harry Charger.  We invite you to assist in creating another vision given to Harry regarding this place of healing.  We are building a center for multidimensional planetary healing.  This center of necessity will be one with many facets.
    A primary component of the center will be a gathering place for a variety of educational venues and fellowship.  A small commerical kitchen will be included to provide food for gatherings and also to be used for classes.  This center eventually will be self sustained by the creation of a trades area where traditional local vendors and artists can sell their work.  Storage and manufacturing of trades areas are also to be included. A small meditation garden near the front of the building will showcase traditional healing and medicinal plants.  Passive solar designs and energy efficient concepts will be utilized in the designs for this project.  Opportunities for volunteer labor and expertise are abundant! 
 

BUDGET   *  $32,000 FOUNDATION AND DIRT WORK

              *  $40,000 MATERIALS, WIRING AND PLUMBING

              *  $5000 COMMERCIAL KITCHEN

The funds generated from this campaign will be used for this center.  We sincerely hope to fund this entire project.  If the entire amount is not generated we will use the amount to start with the foundation and exterior building.

We sincerely appreciate your interest in this project and look forward to bringing this center into an active and helpful space in the universe!

story:
Since 1998, it is estimated that over 6 million people have died in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) where multitudes of armed groups use guns and rape as weapons of war. The trade of minerals that are required to make electronics such as mobile phones, laptops, and mp3 players is fuelling and worsening this complex crisis. In response to student movements in the US calling for greater regulation, the Coalition for a Conflict Free St Andrews was started. The Coalition is the first student organisation of its kind in the UK. We aim to promote the use of Conflict-Free minerals in manufacturing processes, while attempting to ensure that products from the Democratic Republic of Congo do not become contraband.                                                              

This April, the Coalition for a Conflict-Free St Andrews is organising a conference: “Moving forward in the Eastern DRC: the roles to be played by the international community”. Academics, activists and Congolese diaspora groups based in the UK will be invited to take part in a two-day symposium held in St Andrews, Scotland.            

Keynote Speakers: Dr Gérard Prunier, Professor Koen Vlassenroot                        

Help us raise the profile of one of the worst humanitarian crises since the second world war, in country that has been labelled the ‘rape capital of the world’.  

Visit our website, www.conflictfreestandrews.org, for more information and to read the conference's full mission statement.

story:
Friends, we set our goal at $1,000 because we wanted to make sure this type of fund raising would work for us. Our actual goal is to raise much more.... $25,000.... so please give even if it looks like we reached our goal.


Exceeding our "goal" shows support for our cause and we want to show our community that many share in the goal of reinvesting in our students' success.

 

 

Donate to C.L.E.A.R. 113 and Invest in Student Success

Community member in District 113 have spent 18-months planning and developing a comprehensive Long Term Master Plan to guide the reinvestemnt in our High Schools. We now need to generate community support for the $89 million referendum which will pay for the projects.


Community Leaders Educating and Advocating for the Referendum in 113 or C.L.E.A.R. 113 includes community members who believe in the importance of re-investing in student success and want to see the referendum succeed.

We need your financial support to help us educate voters about the importance of the referendum.

Invest in C.L.E.A.R. 113 and help us share the message with our community

A contribution to C.L.E.A.R. 113 helps to fund our communication efforts. Yard signs, flyers, buttons, e-mail susbscriptions are expenses that we must fund in order to communicate our message. District 113 is not able to advocate for ther referendum, just educate voters, so it's up to us to get our message across and to do that and be visible, we need funding.
 
Please consider donating to C.L.E.A.R. 113 today and support the effort to Reinvest in Student Success.
 

Community Leaders Educating and Advocating for the Referendum in 113 is a ballot initiative committee registered with the State of Illinois. A copy of our report filed with the State Board of Elections is available on the Board's official website (www.elections.il.gov) or for purchase from the State Board of Elections, Springfield, Illinois. Paid for by Community Leaders Educating and Advocating for the Referendum in 113.

story:
Click this picture for a short comic on why this campaign is important!

Short Summary

Alexander Sellite is a motivated web-design major who is in desperate need of transportation to and from class at his local school. Contributing can help to enable the following:

  • Allow Alexander to get to and from class.
  • Allow Alexander a means to a social life.
  • Allow Alexander to explore the vastness of sunny California.

All contributions are greatly appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Share this with friends and family who might be interested in contributing.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on Facebook and Twitter!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hey y'all, my name is Brian, and I have a proposition for you. 

I have been given the opportunity to travel to the sub-continent to take on an internship... again.  This is a rare and unique opportunity for me, let alone for a second time.  The details of the trip are difficult to explain, but we can definitely discuss them in person (or by private message) if you need more information.  This three month trip will give me more real world experience in my areas of studies, and give me a competitive edge when I return to finish my education, and later when I enter the workforce.

At the end of the internship I will partake on a short excursion visiting various World Heritage Sites.

As with most internships, this will be unpaid.  This is why I have drawn your attention to this page. The time I spend abroad is mostly paid for, including food, shelter and some travel costs.  My life in the US unfortunately, is not.  This is were you come in.  While it would be crazy for me not to take this opportunity, it would also be crazy for me to think that I can just leave all of my bills behind.  If you believe in me, and have the ability (and desire) to help me reach my goal, and gain real-world experience in my area of studies, this is your chance to help me out. 

Setting up this page is just short of begging, I know.  But hopefully, I can make your contribution more worth your while.  Take a look on the right side there, and see if anything tickles yer fancy. You can also contribute any amount you wish (*wink!*). If my goal is not reached, these perks will still exist, so no worries.

I sincerely apologize for what seems to be a lack of information, but there are some details about this trip that cannot be shared in the open (the internet specifically).  If you have any questions, please feel free to send me a message.  I will tell you anything you want to know!!!!

If you cant help financially, please spread the word!  It is greatly appreciated.

Lub yew!

I have been given the opportunity to travel to the sub-continent to take on an internship... again.  This is a rare and unique opportunity for me, let alone for a second time.  The details of the trip are difficult to explain, but we can definitely discuss them in person (or by private message) if you need more information.  This three month trip will give me more real world experience in my areas of studies, and give me a competitive edge when I return to finish my education, and later when I enter the workforce.At the end of the internship I will partake on a short excursion visiting various World Heritage Sites.As with most internships, this will be unpaid.  This is why I have drawn your attention to this page. The time I spend abroad is mostly paid for, including food, shelter and some travel costs.  My life in the US unfortunately, is not.  This is were you come in.  While it would be crazy for me not to take this opportunity, it would also be crazy for me to think that I can just leave all of my bills behind.  If you believe in me, and have the ability (and desire) to help me reach my goal, and gain real-world experience in my area of studies, this is your chance to help me out. Setting up this page is just short of begging, I know.  But hopefully, I can make your contribution more worth your while.  Take a look on the right side there, and see if anything tickles yer fancy. You can also contribute any amount you wish (*wink!*). If my goal is not reached, these perks will still exist, so no worries.I sincerely apologize for what seems to be a lack of information, but there are some details about this trip that cannot be shared in the open (the internet specifically).  If you have any questions, please feel free to send me a message.  I will tell you anything you want to know!!!!If you cant help financially, please spread the word!  It is greatly appreciated.Lub yew!

story:
Dear Friends & Students of Astou:

 

I have known Astou for over a decade as our dance teacher and I am writing because Astou is going through a difficult time and needs our help. 

She is between homes and her work permit is currently "on hold." While she has a lawyer helping her, she is unable to apply for a job at this time.

Year after year, with a tenacity of spirit,  Astou has offered her enormous voice, energy and dance to the community and it's time to give back.

Despite long days of housecleaning (at a hotel where she worked for 10 years) and despite the physically demanding nature of her job, she has come to class to teach every week with a smile regardless.

It is hard to imagine the courage and strength that has been required of Astou, who from Senegal has worked hard to make a livelihood in America all these years.

When she teaches every week, she has a brave demeanor, but when I spoke to Astou a few days ago I witnessed her suffering a huge burden of stress. She is currently relying on the kindness of friends to put her up.

While her lawyer sorts out her work documents, we hope to help her find a stable situation. All proceeds will go directly in support of a more permanent residence.  

Although it seems not to be the case right now, if she is able to live rent free in a good situation while this gets sorted out, the funds will go to when she does find a good new home.

In the meantime we are hoping to provide first month, last and security.

$10, $20 or $50 can go a long way to meet this short term goal of her renting in a home in the near future. 

As there are also friends working on her case, we are doing this in good faith that she will be able to work in this country again soon and continue to give so much to this great community.

Thank you very much and if you have any thoughts, leads on places for her to live or would rather send a check or give cash, feel free to contact me:

rachelovehope@hotmail.com

Rachel Hope

& Friends
