story:
Hello! My name is Jonas Akers and I am a wellness oriented 

movement practitioner who has been working to overcome the 

limitation and debilitation that comes with living with fibromyalgia, a 

neuro-muscular disease that causes intense systemic muscle pain.

Background: I began, what has now become 9 years of study, the 

practice of Taoist Alchemy, Taoist Medicine, QiGong and 4 years of 

TaiJi and varying KungFu forms. This came after 9 years of good but 

unsuccessful relief using varying Yoga practices and after a foot 

injury that left me unable to walk for a year. My studies and daily 

training have improved my pain levels, flexibility, strength and 

movement consciousness to such a degree as to be able to win 2 

gold metals in the 2012 Golden State Wushu Chompionships for TaiJi 

and Bagua. As well, has brought a calmer and clearer perception of 

life and my place within it.


History: My studies started after a debilitating foot injury that left me 

unable to walk. I began with the 2 most basic standing postures, for 

20 minutes, twice a day, for 9 months. Toword the end of that enitial 

study time a teacher, Ruth Donnely, opened Quiet Moment in Homer 

Alaska. I spent about a year studying QiGong and Taoist Internal 

Alchemy with her. At the same time, in order to better understand the 

dysfunctions within my body I began to research and study anatomy, 

physiology, Traditional Chinese Medicine, Taoist Alchemy and 

Herbology.

After a few years of personal studies I knew it was time to find a 

Master who could help me progress. I went to China and studied with 

Master Yuan Xiu Gang of the Wudang Traditional Taoist Kungfu 

Academy in Wudangshan China. My focus' were meditation, QiGong, 

Tu Gu Na Xin, an internal exercise, TaiJi 28 Quan and TaiHe Quan. 

While there, during my first trip to China, I suffered from a Gallbladder 

infection that nearly killed me. I went to the Holy mountain when I 

woke that morning after pain the whole day before and vomiting black 

sulfur and worse all night. In the morning I fell, drenched in sweat, 

spinning in my head, and barely able to walk. I decided that f it was 

my time to die I was going into the mountains, the one place I have always found

solace and wellness. 

With the help of a friend, David Wei, we journeyed, quite painfully, to 

visit a Taoist master who lives with his bees in the cave where Zhang 

San Feng is pre-ported to have mastered TaiJi. Then we went to 

an abandoned temple high on a cliff. We spent the day talking and did 

QiGong. He had agreed to take me there so long as I was not going 

there to die, but to transform …Wudang mountain did it's trick and I 

had recovered enough to, still painfully, return and go to the hospital 

the next day to see what was happening. From the tests done during 

my visit to the hospital they discovered I had a .5 cm tumor growing 

in my liver. I opted for no western medicine and began an 

herbal regimen. 

After returning home to the US and discovering it had grown another .

25 cm, I went on a special strict Taoist diet, practiced QiGong and 

meditated daily on my liver and it's wellness. After 6 months of this 

practice, I had absorbed the tumor, it was gone. I had 2 more scans 

done over the next year and it was still totally gone. ...Yes, I love this 

stuff!!!

During my second trip to study with Yuan Shifu, I studied Fasting, 

more Tu Gu Na Xin NieDan, more QiGong and I learned TaiYi Quan, 

TaiJi 108 and worked further on BaGua and my other forms. During 

this time I came to realize that despite all I had learned, I now needed 

a school with a more in-depth approach to Taoist Internal Martial 

Arts. 

During this time a new friend recommended me as a potential to 

study with Shifu Li Song Feng at the Bi Ma Shan Temple, which has a 

fuller scope of training including: traditional Taoist philosophy, 

scripture, and music, QiGong, TaiJi and Kungfu Forms, meditation, 

NeiDan, application of form movements, contact training, internal 

alchemy, Taoist medicine which includes: acupressure and 

massage, qi massage, sound healing, and chinese herbology 

including field studies, preparations and usage while training. I was 

given a 1 month trial at Bi Ma Shan to see if Shifu Li Song Feng would 

accept me as a student. He quickly realized my form skills were highly adept and I

was accepted for extended study. Now I am 

returning for at least 5 months, hopefully longer, in april of 2014. 

My Goal and Future Impacts: To return to the Bi Ma Shan Temple to 

expand upon my knowledge base and become a disciple of Shifu Li 

Song Feng of the Chun Yang lineage. My ultimate intention is to share 

the myriad of methods of achieving consciousness and physical 

wellness. There is great potential to work with not only those who 

wish to better understand martial arts, movement and the body mind 

connection, but also there are many Veterans, seniors and chronic 

pain sufferers out there who could potentially find great relief in their 

bodies and calmer clarity in their minds. I have experienced enough 

change within my own mind and body to know that these methods 

are an amazing way to find wholistic wellness. 

Upon my return I will be traveling and doing workshops at various 

retreats and healing centers. As well I will also be soliciting The 

Veterans Association (who already support the use of QiGong and 

TaiJi in Post Traumatic Stress Disorder therapy), senior centers and 

clinics. Also, I am seeking and cultivating connections and clientele 

who may be able to further help expand societies awareness of these 

methods to bring it to the larger public light.


Funding: My immediate needs are the cost of tickets(approx. $1500), 

a minimum 5 months worth of visas (about $500 depending on 

China's constantly changing visa processes which sometime mean 

monthly, instead tri-monthy, fees.) and, in country travel expenses 

(approx. $500). Total=$2500. 


What would be even more optimal than being able to raise travel 

costs would be to be able to raise enough money to extend my trip 

and stay for the Advanced Taoist Medicine Course in fall which runs 

September until December and would cost an additional $2300 as 

well as possibly another $200+ for visas. Totaling another $2500. 

 To note: Currently I already have 5 months paid, April through 

August, for the QiGong and KungFu courses themselves.

story:
Help us raise $2,500 by December 27th to fund our training programs.

Our project start date is January 1, 2014 after what we hope will be a successful holiday season. We are not just asking you to donate money to our cause. We are asking you to support our artistry with a purchase of our work.

Our programs give opportunities for young artists to have a professional experience while still honing their craft.

Hi, my name is Bobby Fouther often called “Mr. Bobby” by my students, I am a visual and performing artist. I am a second-generation artist and native Oregonian. In my youth I was inspired by the wealth of artists and mentors in my life and the art that nurtured and surrounded me in my neighborhood. Some Portland, Oregon residents may remember the Albina Art Center of years gone by where many creative dreams like mine came to fruition.

Our goal is to create places for young people and their families to make high quality art in our community. We have been given an opportunity to continue our Open Door Art Gallery space on the accessible floor of a local alternative high school on Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard in NE Portland and the Kemba Shannon Dance Center in the North Portland, Kenton area. Both areas are in great need and painfully underserved.

After 20 years of saving my supplies, garnering the support of my artistic friends and community and 2 years of running on a zero budget (translation: out of our pockets) I feel the time is right to ask for your support to help us continue high quality arts activities to underserved young people and their families in our community.

For our 2014 first quarter project the funding goal is $2,500.

Project costs include:

$ 1500 will go toward taking a small group of very talented teens to the International Conference on Blacks in Dance in Dallas, Texas in January. This opportunity will be monumental in the lives and careers of our young dancers. You can view a video(in the gallery on this site) of these young people hard at work to pursue their dreams.

$ 1000 will be used as scholarships for young artists in the performing and visual arts. This includes classes, workshops, supplies and training. Last year we supported our students with free voice lessons, dance classes, opportunities to participate in major gallery showings, theatre tickets and ensemble performances throughout the city.

OUR OFFER TO YOU

We are Artisans who create works to be treasured throughout life and from generation to generation. We have selected a series of art pieces as gifts to our donors As little as $ 1.00 will help support our efforts and provide the giver with a piece of art from us.

YOUR GIFT TO US - will change the paths of many lives.

“Imagination is the true magic carpet.” - Norman Vincent Peale

We provide the training and space for our students to develop their skills, practice and showcase their work. Your gift will insure our ability to provide a permanent, safe, nurturing and creative environment in a traditionally underserved area of our city. You are in essence helping us share our resources and create an outlet for the massive amount of talent that is N/NE Portland.

YOU ARE OUR MARKETING TEAM

Your contribution can be in many forms. Email, facebook, twitter, phone and even snail-mail will help us get the word out. Indiegogo also has a wealth of sharing tools that you can use to save time.

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Justin T Shockley and I am an internationally published Fashion photographer, and freelancer for the New York Times. I’ve shot everything from fashion/editorial, lookbooks, fashion agencies, celebrities, news, and stock.

Currently I'm a photo editor, head fashion photographer, and consultant for Graceful Chic magazine here in New York City. I'm also a fashion commentator as seen on Huffington Post Live with: Kirsten Chilstrom (Vogue), recording artist/MTV star Tyrese and former recording artist/celebrity/author Rev Run. Ive been shooting 5+ years and am a second generation photographer. My client list includes celebrities, politicians, fashion magazines, newspapers and corporations to name a few.
 
Non Profit/Pro bono photo work includes (not limited to):  Hope For New York (photographer), HFNY Profesionals in action, 100Cameras (official photographer), Fashion Fights Cancer (official photographer),Social Alchemy (photographer), Picture the Homeless (photographer), Don't walk by homeless campaign, Price of Life (anti sex trafficking campaign), Nomi Network campaign (Anti Sex trafficking), Fathers Heart New York
 
 
 

Why Mozambique?

According to the United Nations Human Development Index which measures a country's welfare based on factors like education and infant mortality rate Mozambique has a country rank of 185 out of 187 , making it the third poorest country in the world.66% of the country is illiterate and 44% of the kids under the age of 5 were so malnourished they were debilitated. Fortunately, as Helen Keller once stated, although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.

Couldyou.org, in partnership with the Chissano Foundation, is working to overcome the education gap in Mozambique.  CouldYou? is a non-profit that provides innovative, individually tailored immersion programs in Mozambique that give people an authentic local experience while helping individuals find their own unique contribution to impacting poverty. It is about investment and partnership, rather than aid. (please read the powerpoint presentation here for more info  https://docs.google.com/file/d/0By-JYOF8FlwCaGFvdVBoaThsVVE/edit?usp=sharing )

What would I be doing?

I would be documenting the Gumbane Education Pilotproject for CouldYou? and the Chissano Foundation as well as spend 5 days with Erik Charas and Verdade working with his citizen reporters. This campaign is an important part of history but more importantly its an important part in the lives of the children in Mozambique. The children of that particular region will be changed for the rest of their lives by getting a decent education.  The ultimate goal is true transformation of a national education system through true partnership with the West, which ultimately will be changing lives. It’s a no brainer for me and a dream of mine to be a part of something like this. I’ve wanted to do something like this ever since I picked up a camera. It would be a dream training citzen journalists for Verdade http://youtu.be/CylkFTAZXtM which is the largest newspaper in Mozambique. Verdade is the voice of the voiceless in that region. Its the paper for the poor. To be able to play such a small role in the sea of history is humbling.

If you support me you would be walking in solidarity with them. By supporting me you would be helping silence the hammer of injustice. I will only play a small role but I think even small acts can change the current of history. If 60 people gave a mere $200 my campaign would be fully funded! You would be helping the children of Mozambique, sparking one persons dream and igniting a journey. Thanks for believing in me enough to give.

 

What I Need & what you  Get


 I need at least $12,000 to do this.  If 60 people gave around $200 I would be fully funded. I’m looking for at least $5,000 before the end of May so I can secure my spot on the trip and get my Visa. The rest will go towards production, post production, and equipment. The money Will cover airfare, ground costs, lodging, and visa expenses. I will be there for a little under a month. As a thank you for your gift the first $5000 will be tax deductible once I reach $12000 and donors who donate $500 or more will have an option of getting a thank you photoshoot. (possibly $200 as well for the first 60 peopole please email me) (commercial, non commercial, modeling, advertising,lookbooks, fashion, editorial, weddings, engagements you name it) As well as various other perks listed here. Also if the goal isn’t reached I will use it for the next couldyou.org trip. So please don't stop giving I’m not a quitter. :) 

The Impact

CouldYou? is a versatile and important organization partnering with various organizations to make this happen including We Partner, the Chissano Foundation, the ministry of education and science and technology in Mozambique, Growing Educators, Umoya, Jaradoa and Preschools for Peace.  There are also School Districts and Universities in the process of formalizing a partnership . They and prior partners like Halogen TV who did a tv special on them realize the value and impactCouldYou? is making. Please give as much as you can from the heart so that I can be a part of this as well. Thanks! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here is how you can help:
- GIVE ME A PERK TO GIVE AWAY! Nothing is to big or small! (small buisness, lindividual, large, corporate etc)
- Give generously to this campaign
- Tweet this campaign
- Post this campaign on your facebook
- Tell at least 10 people you know and urge them to give generously
- Use the indiegogo tools to spred the message
- Throw your own party to help me raise funds!
- Sign up for the White Mansion dinner party 5/31 in a two story brownstone in manhattan! 50 spots available for donations of $100, $200, $500, $1000, or more! email neohxc@gmail.com to RSVP Subject: White Mansion Dinner.
- Come to my  My Fashion Photoshoot rooftop fundraiser party May 27th! (dates may vary email neohxc@gmail.com for exact dates) and buy a Charity ticket to my Fashion Show Party at Holy Apostles Ballroom June 6th!
Cheers!




 It’s an honor for me not only to be chosen to document this project as well as train citizen journalists and work side by side with @Verdade, Mozambique’s largest newspaper for this near month long project. But as someone who has been published internationally in the fields of Fashion and Photojournalism freelancing for companies like the New York Times I would have to say this is a careerlong dream of mine. Everyone wants to do something worth doing. Everyone wants to be a part of something worth doing. So if you believe this needs changing please join me. There are dreams and they do come true. But it doesn't start or even end with people like me. It starts with people like you. Thank you for your support!

I'm also a fashion commentator as seen on Huffington Post Live with: Kirsten Chilstrom (Vogue), recording artist/MTV star Tyrese and former recording artist/celebrity/author Rev Run. Ive been shooting 5+ years and am a second generation photographer. My client list includes celebrities, politicians, fashion magazines, newspapers and corporations to name a few.
 
Non Profit/Pro bono photo work includes (not limited to):  Hope For New York (photographer), HFNY Profesionals in action, 100Cameras (official photographer), Fashion Fights Cancer (official photographer),Social Alchemy (photographer), Picture the Homeless (photographer), Don't walk by homeless campaign, Price of Life (anti sex trafficking campaign), Nomi Network campaign (Anti Sex trafficking), Fathers Heart New York
 
 
 
Why Mozambique?
According to the United Nations Human Development Index which measures a country's welfare based on factors like education and infant mortality rate Mozambique has a country rank of 185 out of 187 , making it the third poorest country in the world.66% of the country is illiterate and 44% of the kids under the age of 5 were so malnourished they were debilitated. Fortunately, as Helen Keller once stated, although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
Couldyou.org, in partnership with the Chissano Foundation, is working to overcome the education gap in Mozambique.  CouldYou? is a non-profit that provides innovative, individually tailored immersion programs in Mozambique that give people an authentic local experience while helping individuals find their own unique contribution to impacting poverty. It is about investment and partnership, rather than aid. (please read the powerpoint presentation here for more info  https://docs.google.com/file/d/0By-JYOF8FlwCaGFvdVBoaThsVVE/edit?usp=sharing )
What would I be doing?
I would be documenting the Gumbane Education Pilotproject for CouldYou? and the Chissano Foundation as well as spend 5 days with Erik Charas and Verdade working with his citizen reporters. This campaign is an important part of history but more importantly its an important part in the lives of the children in Mozambique. The children of that particular region will be changed for the rest of their lives by getting a decent education.  The ultimate goal is true transformation of a national education system through true partnership with the West, which ultimately will be changing lives. It’s a no brainer for me and a dream of mine to be a part of something like this. I’ve wanted to do something like this ever since I picked up a camera. It would be a dream training citzen journalists for Verdade http://youtu.be/CylkFTAZXtM which is the largest newspaper in Mozambique. Verdade is the voice of the voiceless in that region. Its the paper for the poor. To be able to play such a small role in the sea of history is humbling.
If you support me you would be walking in solidarity with them. By supporting me you would be helping silence the hammer of injustice. I will only play a small role but I think even small acts can change the current of history. If 60 people gave a mere $200 my campaign would be fully funded! You would be helping the children of Mozambique, sparking one persons dream and igniting a journey. Thanks for believing in me enough to give.
 
What I Need & what you  Get
 I need at least $12,000 to do this.  If 60 people gave around $200 I would be fully funded. I’m looking for at least $5,000 before the end of May so I can secure my spot on the trip and get my Visa. The rest will go towards production, post production, and equipment. The money Will cover airfare, ground costs, lodging, and visa expenses. I will be there for a little under a month. As a thank you for your gift the first $5000 will be tax deductible once I reach $12000 and donors who donate $500 or more will have an option of getting a thank you photoshoot. (possibly $200 as well for the first 60 peopole please email me) (commercial, non commercial, modeling, advertising,lookbooks, fashion, editorial, weddings, engagements you name it) As well as various other perks listed here. Also if the goal isn’t reached I will use it for the next couldyou.org trip. So please don't stop giving I’m not a quitter. :) 
The Impact
CouldYou? is a versatile and important organization partnering with various organizations to make this happen including We Partner, the Chissano Foundation, the ministry of education and science and technology in Mozambique, Growing Educators, Umoya, Jaradoa and Preschools for Peace.  There are also School Districts and Universities in the process of formalizing a partnership . They and prior partners like Halogen TV who did a tv special on them realize the value and impactCouldYou? is making. Please give as much as you can from the heart so that I can be a part of this as well. Thanks! 
Other Ways You Can Help
Here is how you can help:- GIVE ME A PERK TO GIVE AWAY! Nothing is to big or small! (small buisness, lindividual, large, corporate etc)- Give generously to this campaign- Tweet this campaign- Post this campaign on your facebook- Tell at least 10 people you know and urge them to give generously- Use the indiegogo tools to spred the message- Throw your own party to help me raise funds!- Sign up for the White Mansion dinner party 5/31 in a two story brownstone in manhattan! 50 spots available for donations of $100, $200, $500, $1000, or more! email neohxc@gmail.com to RSVP Subject: White Mansion Dinner.- Come to my  My Fashion Photoshoot rooftop fundraiser party May 27th! (dates may vary email neohxc@gmail.com for exact dates) and buy a Charity ticket to my Fashion Show Party at Holy Apostles Ballroom June 6th!Cheers!
 It’s an honor for me not only to be chosen to document this project as well as train citizen journalists and work side by side with @Verdade, Mozambique’s largest newspaper for this near month long project. But as someone who has been published internationally in the fields of Fashion and Photojournalism freelancing for companies like the New York Times I would have to say this is a careerlong dream of mine. Everyone wants to do something worth doing. Everyone wants to be a part of something worth doing. So if you believe this needs changing please join me. There are dreams and they do come true. But it doesn't start or even end with people like me. It starts with people like you. Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Are you passionate about helping entrepreneurs around the globe grow and peruse their dreams? Or it is you who needs a top-notch business coaching on making your business a viable venture? If yes, then read on. 

Having a dream and making it happen are two totally different things. It's a pity so many entrepreneurs, coaches and other professionals fall short to sustain their businesses while doing what they love. It doesn't have to be that way. Really. 

We have helped many entrepreneurs time and time again to get their heads around the business rationale and making a sustainable living. But there is a chicken and egg problem for most of them as they are ready to invest in their professional business coaching once they have their bottom line in black. And to get it in black they need to invest in it first. 

We are launching this campaign to break this cycle and to make it possible for at least 10 entrepreneurs from around the globe to get their entrepreneurship coaching for free. Your contribution would serve 2 purposes: 

- you would support somebody on their journey to fulfill their dream by running a start up company; 

 - you would get unique perks for getting your own business to the next level; 

Our 3 months entrepreneurship coaching program will consist of 6 individual sessions for each and every entrepreneur and will have the following scope and focus:  

- Business Model Fundamentals; 

- Blue Ocean Strategy - Design and Implementation; 

- Customer Development; 

At the end of the coaching program all participants will have a clear idea about who their best customers are and how to engage with them, what their value proposition is and how to make competition irrelevant. In short - all the basic ingredients of a successful business. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Upon achieving every 300.00 USD milestone of the total 3000.00 USD we will announce the entrepreneur who will receive the coaching program for free thanks to your support. 
  •  As we go we will make sure that if we exceed the 3000.00 target we will distribute every next 300.00 rounds to yet another entrepreneur. 
  • We will provide unique and unmatched perks exclusively only for this Indiegogo campaign translated into deep discounts for our strategy coaching services. 

The Impact

  • They say for a reason that every journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. Help somebody or yourself make the first step of this exciting journey of becoming a successful entrepreneur. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if you cannot contribute then you can help us spread the word. Every little bit helps. Share with your friends, family, partners or whoever you feel right. 

If you feel you are among these 10 aspiring entrepreneurs who need the free entrepreneurship coaching through this compaign, please drop us a line.

story:
On 1 August 2013, dyslexic singer, artist and make-up artist Klaire de Lys will shave her head to raise bursaries for people with dyslexia and on a limited income to access the Davis Dyslexia Programme.

21-year-old Klaire, who lives in Reading, Berkshire, founded KlairedelysArt in January 2009, a Youtube Channel devoted to artistic make-up tutorials. To date, the channel has accumulated over 380,000 subscribers. There have been over 86,000,000 views of the videos on the channel. Klaire was featured in a recent article in the Observer, “YouTube UK: 20 of Britain's most popular online video bloggers”.

After years of going undiagnosed, Klaire underwent a Davis Dyslexia Programme to address her personal challenges with dyslexia. “To say that that experience made a difference is a serious understatement,” says Klaire. “It changed my life completely and gave me the tools to achieve things I could only dream of before.”

The Davis Dyslexia Programme was created by Ronald Davis, author of the internationally best-selling book, “The Gift of Dyslexia”. The programme originated out of Davis’ own experience of severe dyslexia and is now provided in over 30 languages and in more than 45 countries. It plays to the perceptual talents inherent in dyslexia and makes innovative use of plasticine clay as a learning medium.

“At present, the Davis Programme receives no state funding,” says Richard Whitehead, Director of Davis Learning Foundation, the non-profit UK arm of Davis Dyslexia Association International. “We are delighted with Klaire’s amazing gesture, which will bring the benefits of the programme to people who could never have dreamt of them before.”

At the same time as shaving her head, Klaire will launch her new band, Fenix, with a song that is all about her experiences with dyslexia.

 “I'm hoping that by approaching this project by both shaving my head to raise awareness, and releasing my song Paper Wings, I can really make a difference in the lives of Dyslexics,” says Klaire. “Not only raising funds to help, but also by hopefully creating a song which will continue to raise awareness long after my hair has grown back.”

People with dyslexia will not be the only people to benefit from Klaire’s gesture. After shaving her head, Klaire plans to donate her hair to Wigs for Kids, a non-profit company providing hair replacement for children who have lost their hair because of cancer treatment, burns and other medical issues.

story:
Please note that it doesn't matter if someone has already claimed a certain donation perk, you'll still be able to donate the same amount.

---

Dear everyone!

I'm Mari, a MA Social Anthropology student at SOAS. I created this page to invite you to support my field trip to Mongolia this summer! Many of you may know how difficult (impossible) it is to get funding for MA level fieldwork, I have looked and not found those grants. However, I feel the fieldwork is very much central to my project and future, hence I have decided to unite my first field trip with my first fundraising project. I welcome you to be part of it!

The field trip would take me to Northern Mongolia, to a small group of reindeer herders called the Dukha. Due to being nomadic and shamanistic - exotic - they have become a hotspot in Mongolian tourism. This has led to establishing a tourist oriented Reindeer Festival. I will be attending the event with the Dukha. The Reindeer Festival creates a new type of migratory route for the Dukha and their reindeer down from the mountains where they normally spend their summers to Tsagaannuur village. I want to prepare for the event with the reindeer herders, participate in the festival and travel back to their summer pastures with them after the event. The project is to shed light on tourism's possible impacts on nomadic migration in this marginal part of the world.

To be able to take up this field work I'm trying to raise £1326. This would cover all the costs from the moment I take off on June 13th until my return to London on July 11th. It does not include Mongolian inflation rate but should ofterwise be fairly accurate. Please see the full budget below.

I am extremely grateful for any contributions you are able to make towards sending me to Mongolia. Your participation in this project will not be forgotten!


Please see http://marimongolia.wordpress.com/ for updates and progress concerningthis project.

There's a FB event which aims to unite and also provide information on the cake sales to take place on March 20th at SOAS, London  https://www.facebook.com/events/113634698825927/

 

With much love,

Mari

 

 

FIELD TRIP  BUDGET 13 June - 11 July 2013; London - Ulaantaiga - London

 

Visa and travel insurance

Mongolian visa for 30 days            £40 (London)

Travel insurance for 30 days          £25 (Salva, Estonia)

Total £65

 

Travel to and from Mongolia

Flight London-Istanbul-Ulan-Bator return        £500 (discount ticket for my sister works for an airline)

Bus Ulan-Ude airport to centre, return            £1

Bus Ulan-Ude – Ulan-Bator, return                 £42 (1050×2 rub)

Total £543

 

Travel in Mongolia (exc in the field)

Bus Ulan-Bator – Moron, return       £31 (35000×2 tugrik)

Bus Moron – Tsagaannuur, return    £15 (15000×2 tugrik)

City transport in Ulan-Bator              £1 (400×6 tugrik)

Total £47

 

Accommodation (13 hostels, 2 bus, 13 campsite/festival, 1 airport)

Hostel Ulan-Bator                           £35 (Mongolian Steppe £7×5)

Hostel in Moron                              £20 (Gan-Oyu Guesthouse $15×2)

Accommodation in Tsagaannuur    £60 ($15×6)

Total £115

 

Food

Mean per day      £112 (£7×18, excl. field site)

Total £112

 

Fieldwork

Total day cost in the field

(including horses, guide/translator, some food, accommodation)    £404 (day $45×14)

Gifts (ecological soap, sweets, coffee and MacCereal drink)          £40

Equipment                                                                              £0 (borrowed and private)

Total £444

 

TOTAL £1326

story:
Short Summary

Louisville Adventist Academy is a private school in Louisville, KY. Approximately 70% of the students receive financial aid to attend this school.  All of the financial aid given is funded by people from the area. With the economy breakdown, their funds have dried up.  The school continues to grow in number of students and we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

LAA is trying to raise $25,000 by October 11, 2012.  We are expecting 83 kids with the majority of them needing financial assistance.  Our school does not have a gymnasium and does not have a cafeteria. The kids who attend our school attend because they love the school, they just need help for tuition.  If we do not reach our goal, the collected funds will still go towards financial aid.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.... get the word out that there is a small private school in need.  Tell everyone you know and make sure to use the share tools...broadcast on Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, etc.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we're Jungle Red Salon, located in Minneapolis, MN. 

Deanne is a 52-year-old lovely woman, having been a full-time stay at home mother for 25 years has little professional skill, who recently was left by her husband with four children and very little child support. Trying to quickly adjust to this new life, she lost her house, and is struggling to raise a teenage daughter who was highly impacted by the abrupt family change. In the midst of this, Deanne suddenly developed breast cancer, requiring a double mastectomy and many other surgeries to recover. Jungle Red feels that Deanne needs a break in life to pursue her passion and fulfill her second chance at living her dream, and we would like to help her. We are raising money for an Aveda scholarship for her new career and we are going to make sure everyone has a great time doing it!

 .

By donating to this campaign, you will be a huge part of Deanne's success and passion in life.  She will be forever gratefull to your gratitude.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to reach a minimum of $10,000. We have earned $8000 so far, so any donation will help!

You could revieve anything from a discount to a professional haircut to a professional massage as a perk for your donation.

If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go to Deanne's schooling. We are currently 3/4 of the way there, just a little bit more and our campaign will be a success!

The Impact

You could be a part of Deanne's life changing experience. Once she graduates from the Aveda Institute, she will show the world her talents and put a smile on peoples faces.

Jungle Red has been successful in other campaigns such as teen  .

Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? DON'T WORRY! Spread the word around to family, friends, aquaintences, etc. 

Remember to use the IndieGoGo sharetools!

story:
What’s Our Purpose Simply put, we’re raising money! The Jack Story is a well written Screenplay that has touch to Hearts and Souls of many and should be seen on the big screen by many. On October 1st, Tomel sent an email to his Cast and Crew that despite a strong screenplay, a stellar cast, and rave reviews, the film would be put on hold - because there was not enough funding. We thought that since the Story itself is so unique, why should the funding come traditionally? We submit that the funds for this movie should come from the people who the Story actually impacts. It should come from the millions people whom the Story will help Save the Lives of. It should come from friends, families with youth, teens and adults and Companies that support new direction for Youth, Safety, Drugs, and Guns awareness. We are raising $50,000 to help in developing cost to get the actual budget needed to start production and January or February 2013. To make the impact needed to reach the thousands, we need to make a quality film that can compete with the todays market..... Be apart of something that will make a HUGE difference....

Why We’re Doing It I’m just a average guy who decided to take a chance, a leap of Faith. When the Cast and Crew heard the news about the film being halted, we thought to ourselves; “There’s got to be another way.” We dreamed big and now here we are. We know this is possible. The Jack Story has reached a massive amount of people, the script has SAVED a LIFE and if it were to become a film, it would SAVE even more LIVES. Most importantly, we believe that this is going to be an incredible life changing story for many, mostly our single parents and youth. Think about it… investors back out, the movie's put on hold, then the family, friends, there friends, friends, families, organizations, companies step up and say; “No, we will HELP fund this movie.” That is a story we want to be a part of. Will you join us? Be apart of a great Film about CHANGE and REDEMPTION.

-- FAQs

Any Hollywood Actors Committed? ABSOLUTELY! The Actors that have read the Script are: Lou Gosset Jr., Leon Robinson, Charles S. Dutton, Vivica Fox, Brian McNight, Christian Keyes, Richard Tyson, Adrian Kali Turner, Cuba Goodings Jr. Clifton Powell, Cisco Reyes and several others. Some are fully committed, some will commit upon funding.. Can you imagine having this cast be apart of this Project.... With your help it's very possible.

When exactly is “The Big Night?” The Big Night in HOLLYWOOD has yet to be scheduled, mainly because parts of the movie schedule itself are still up in the air. You can count on it being sometime in May or June 2013, weeks before the theatrical release of the movie. We promise we will give you a heads up WAY in advance.

Can I Gift An Incentive? YES, Great idea. If you would like to donate to the film but give the reward to someone as a gift, go through all the normal process of making a donation in your name. For billing purposes, this action must be in your name. After our deadline, we will send a message to you on Indiegogo. (It will be forwarded to the email address you provided) We will request things like your t-shirt size and address from you at that time. Please reply with the entire person’s information that is to receive the reward. We will make sure they are the person who receives the reward.

How will you get my number? How will you get my T-shirt size? We will be going through all the people who have donated to request their phone number. If you have donated, you will get a message from us pretty soon. Please reply. We hate rejection, and he wants to thank you. Please bear with us though, as we have thousands of phone calls to make. Once we cross our deadline we will immediately begin manufacturing and completing incentives for everyone involved. You will get a message from us requesting information from you like your T-shirt size, address, etc. At that time, please reply to us as soon as possible so that we can complete your incentive.

Can I increase my pledge once it’s been made? YES! Once you donate to our campaign, you may want to change your incentive reward to a different one, or increase your pledge amount. To do so, go to Indiegogo and sign in. If you go to our campaign page, the green “Back This Project” button has been replaced with a blue “Manage Your Donation” button. Click it and you can enter a new amount, or choose a new incentive.

Can we exceed the goal? YES! What an amazing problem to have. Indiegogo will allow as much money as is given before the deadline. Maybe that would mean a more widespread theater release, or more unique physical copy packaging. The possibilities are endless.

How do we contact you? Glad you asked! You can contact us directly at thejackstory@yahoo.com. We check it everyday. We will get back to you. We promise!

Is The Jack Story Project a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization? Unfortunately neither this movement nor The Jack Story is set up as a non-profit. Donations are raw gifts. Non-tax deductible.

If I donate, when can I redeem the incentive? All incentives, big and small, will only happen if our goal is met. If we do meet our goal, immediately after our filming and post production we will start to manufacture and shipping out all products directly to you. It will be our priority to schedule the more personal incentives as soon as possible. You will hear from us. (More on this as we get closer to our deadline)

Who does the money go to? Every penny (minus the fees for Indiegogo’s involvement) will go directly to Director Tomel Griggs movie budget escrow account - i.e. your money goes directly to the funding of this film.

$50,000 seems like a low number for a developement budget. Doesn’t it? You are correct. Fortunately, we’ve have so many support that have come through for us, helping at no to low cost in area that would cost a huge amount of funding. The $50,000 figure is merely to help with Securing Hollywood Actors Contracts, Legal paper work, Casting, Attorney retainer  fee and some crew expensive and miscellaneous items for developement. Our goal is imperative for the film to be a reality and realistic. We would absolutely love to raise more. Please help this Life changing Project. We'd LOVE to raise enough to shoot the entire movie, YES!

Any other questions? Just ask us. We’d be stoked to answer them. tomel@thejackstorymovie.com

-- Tomel Griggs – Director/Writer/Producer -- www.thejackstorymovie.com -- tomel@thejackstorymovie.com
story_txt:
What’s Our Purpose Simply put, we’re raising money! The Jack Story is a well written Screenplay that has touch to Hearts and Souls of many and should be seen on the big screen by many. On October 1st, Tomel sent an email to his Cast and Crew that despite a strong screenplay, a stellar cast, and rave reviews, the film would be put on hold - because there was not enough funding. We thought that since the Story itself is so unique, why should the funding come traditionally? We submit that the funds for this movie should come from the people who the Story actually impacts. It should come from the millions people whom the Story will help Save the Lives of. It should come from friends, families with youth, teens and adults and Companies that support new direction for Youth, Safety, Drugs, and Guns awareness. We are raising $50,000 to help in developing cost to get the actual budget needed to start production and January or February 2013. To make the impact needed to reach the thousands, we need to make a quality film that can compete with the todays market..... Be apart of something that will make a HUGE difference....
Why We’re Doing It I’m just a average guy who decided to take a chance, a leap of Faith. When the Cast and Crew heard the news about the film being halted, we thought to ourselves; “There’s got to be another way.” We dreamed big and now here we are. We know this is possible. The Jack Story has reached a massive amount of people, the script has SAVED a LIFE and if it were to become a film, it would SAVE even more LIVES. Most importantly, we believe that this is going to be an incredible life changing story for many, mostly our single parents and youth. Think about it… investors back out, the movie's put on hold, then the family, friends, there friends, friends, families, organizations, companies step up and say; “No, we will HELP fund this movie.” That is a story we want to be a part of. Will you join us? Be apart of a great Film about CHANGE and REDEMPTION.
-- FAQs

story:
Hi, my name is Jared Smith. I am seeking your assistance so that I may complete my academic year as a Culinary Arts major, at Johnson and Wales University in North Miami, FL.

Undoubtedly, almost everyone has felt the pinch stemming from our country's recession. It hit home a year ago when my mother became unemployed right at the time I graduated High School and would head off to college. My mother insisted that college is a MUST and that she would "make a way out of no way to send me".

As a Black male, the statistics were already against me, however I was taught from a young age that three elements would almost guarantee my success -- a driver's license, establishing and building good credit, and an education.

My mother raised me as a single parent for 11 years until she was married to my step-father, who would finally complete our family unit. My biological father has been incarcerated for 15 of the 19 years of my life, and is currently serving out a twelve year sentence until his release in 2018.

Your assistance would help pay off the total cost of tuition, undergraduate housing, books, uniforms and culinary supplies not covered by my Student Loans, grants and scholarships that have already been applied. The full annual tuition at Johnson & Wales is $32,000 per year as an out-of-state student.

"I Just Want To Be Successful", and with your help, I will.

Jared

story:
In January this year, I was fortunate enough to be part of a team of students from Padua College, Brisbane which won the prestigious Australian Space Design Competition which was hosted at the University of Queensland. Winning the Australian Championship has afforded us the opportunity to form a part of the combined Australian Team to compete in the International Space Settlement Design Competition (ISSDC) in the United States in July this year. The ISSDC is administered by NASA in their headquarters in Houston, Texas.

This once in a lifetime opportunity comes at a huge cost and the College has indicated that it cannot provide funding for its students and it is up to each individual team member to secure their own funding. The cost of the proposed trip, including equipment, and spending money totals to approximately $6000 and thus I am seeking any sponsorship for this trip.

I am a hardworking and dedicated student who sees this project as life changing experience. I have always enjoyed studying science and am planning to further my knowledge of engineering and robotics at University level next year. Attending the ISSDC would certainly provide me with an excellent opportunity to develop my understanding of technology and its application in a real world context.

story:
www.barrioplantaproject.org

Dyani Makous and the Barrio Planta Project

I first arrived in Nicaragua in August 2008 for a six-week stint writing travel guides for a travel-writing publication based out of Ecuador. What I experienced while here, especially in the town of San Juan del Sur, touched me so deeply that I never left. I decided to stay and focus all of my energy on providing much-needed education to a well-deserving community who are ready and willing to work hard for opportunity.

About fifteen years ago, San Juan del Sur was just a small fisherman village. The majority of fishermen traditionally reside in the neighborhood Barrio La Planta, located just behind the port. As tourism rapidly grew, and the town began to gain notice for its beautiful beaches and laid back, friendly culture, many fishermen fishing for national companies lost their jobs to better-funded private companies and tour businesses. With little to no training in other fields and minimal education, residents of the community became increasingly impoverished in spite of the financial boom that the town has been experiencing.

When I arrived in San Juan del Sur, I stayed with a family in the Barrio La Planta. They looked after me with hospitality and generosity, sharing the little food they had, giving me advice, and offering their home to me. The experience was so humbling that I wanted to share something with them.  They suggested that I teach them English so they could begin to access all of the new opportunities the blossoming tourism industry had to offer. I agreed and posted a sign on my door that said “Free English Classes. Sign Up Here”. What started with ten children during the day and ten adults at night quickly grew to sixty children and twenty adults in just two months.

Four years later, we have hundreds of children attending the Barrio Planta Project, and have expanded programming to include dance, art, theater, computers, recreational activities and other events. I could never have guessed that an informal act of gratitude would change my life so dramatically. I am now the Executive Director of the Barrio Planta Project, a 501c3 and NGO that continues to grow alongside the community, providing free supplementary education for whoever wants to attend.

Our Winter Creative Arts Workshop

January is a very important month for us. Every year for five weeks from the beginning of January until mid-February, our students participate in our Winter Workshop: an intensive creative arts workshop culminating in a performance for the entire community. Past workshops include a theater workshop, a hip-hop workshop, and a rock & roll workshop. This year, the workshop will be focused on the production of the musical Grease. The students will do everything from set and costume design, production, and singing and dancing.

Unfortunately, many children are not able to participate in our year-round programming. Due to their economic situations, they often lack the resources to dedicate time outside of school to additional activities. Often, when something happens in the family like the birth of a sibling or a new job for their parents, they have to withdraw from classes in order to do household chores and take care of their younger relatives. We call these students our safety-net students. Many of our safety net students live in Barrio La Planta, the neighborhood that inspired me to start the project in the first place.

 Although our safety net kids often miss too much class to continue with year-round English, we enroll them again every year, hoping for the best. Even though they often times can’t keep their commitments, they are still eager to participate somehow. Because the Winter Workshop is held while school is on break, we are able to reach most of our safety net kids during this time, and they are given priority in participation. Many of these students look forward to this workshop all year and leave with new skills, discovered talents, and enhanced confidence to start of the New Year. This year the performance of Grease will be held on Saturday February 9th, and again on Saturday February 23rd at San Juan del Sur’s 5th annual Earthship Pitaya Festival.

 

What We Need

The Barrio Planta Project’s goal is to raise $10,000 by Saturday January 19th. This gives us the time we need to do bank transfers and access the funds in order to make the necessary investments in presentation materials such as cool fifties clothes, set design equipment, sound, lighting, student-designed playbills and other expenses. We also have some visitors coming from the States at the end of January who will be filming the workshop and can bring materials from there as well.

The money raised also goes to supporting our general operating expenses for the months of January and February and making investments in our upcoming school year. This will give us more time to focus on the workshop, which each of our five staff members participates in, directing our non-teaching time on securing long-term funding and launching our 2013 school year off with a bang. No gift is too large or too small. All of your contributions make a difference.

What happens if we don’t reach our goal? We will survive! We are dedicated to providing free education in Nicaragua, and will continue to work hard to towards this goal, regardless of setbacks.

The Impact

I started BPP with a $50.00 donation from a family friend in the small local library with no resources, no experience and no plan. What began as a simple gesture of gratitude suddenly took on a life of its own, fueled by the enthusiasm of our growing student body and facilitated by hundreds of generous donors and volunteers

The Barrio Planta Project has been featured in numerous national publications in Nicaragua, the U.S. and even Norway as well as made guest appearances on national television. The Ministry of Tourism (INTUR) as well as the President of Nicaragua, Daniel Ortega, has officially endorsed us. BPP has renovated a previously unused school building and developed three classrooms and one office. We have developed and personalized five levels of school age English as a Second Language Curriculum, two pre-school levels and three adult levels, including a conversational level.  

On February 29th, 2013, we will have our four-year anniversary.

While there are so many things we have accomplished, there still remains much more to do. We look forward to expanding our programming and possibly taking the project into other communities in Nicaragua. Most importantly, we want to continue to provide an enriching environment for our students.

“At the Barrio Planta Project, we take advantage of our talents and our abilities, because we are capable of anything we put our minds to,” says student Israel Pizarro, age 14.

Our students our capable of great things and because of your contributions, they have the opportunity to discover their talents and most importantly, believe in themselves.

story:
About Texas Bombers Baseball

A team of hard-working high school students doing what it takes to make it to the next level academically and athletically :

  • 14 incoming Juniors/Seniors from 8 different high schools in the El Paso area.
  • This summer we will be traveling to New Mexico,Arizona (2X),and California.
  • Calculated expenses are to cover uniforms,registration fees,travel expenses.
 The El Paso area has no organized baseball for high school students during the summer to help enhance their opportunities to play college level baseball and potentially receive a free/reduced education. We are in need of donations to help give these young athletes a chance to succeed.

Where your donations are going:

  • We are asking for a total donation amount of $13,360.00
  • Team Registration fees-$3,350.00 (4 tournaments)
  • Team Equipment-$3,870.00 (uniforms,bats,balls,helmets,gear)
  • Travel Expenses-$6,150.00 (hotels,fuel,insurance)

The Impact You Provide for us as a Team:

Every dollar received makes a differnce in each of these athletes lives:

  • Every player has committed to doing the necessary work to achieve a college education. All players GPAs are monitored by Bombers Staff
  • All funds are 100% used for player expenses only (all coaches are volunteers)
  • All players are requried to help with fundraising to keep parent cost down since costs of summer campaigns are so high.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money isn't something that everyone can afford to give away, if you aren't able to help us with donations here are some alternative ways to help out the Texas Bombers:

  • Pass this link along through your Facebook,Twitter,or Emails
  • Circulate news about upcoming Bombers events posted on the Facebook page ( type in Texas Bombers Baseball in the Facebook search engine)

story:
If you always wanted to give back to the troops, here's your chance. 

 

Why I can use some help

Unfortunately, the Navy doctors have found a serious recurring condition in my latest examination. It's called RHABDOMYOLYSIS, and it's very serious. Basically, it's from my muscle fibers break down and releases a harmful toxin into my kidneys, which can cause them to fail. For a more detailed description check here. If you have served before then you can guess why my muscle might be working so hard. Hard work! This is going to eventually lead me to either be medically separated or ineligible to re-enlist causing some unavoidable hardships for my son Hendrix, my wife Cassie who has a more severe condition compared to mine, NF. 

    

 

What I need help with 

I have enrolled in college full-time while being Active Duty, perusing my degree in marketing online with UMUC. I also love education, technology and entrepreneurship. Along with some wonderful people, I started a company, ReaderUp INC. I pitched this idea at Startup Weekend San Diego, and placed third and soon realized that this is what I want to do with my life. Although, some may think being the C.E.O. of a company is all sugar and candy, I can assure you it's the toughest part of my day. We're still in the development process so it is really putting food on the table.

However, I have followed my passion and savvies with business, technology, education, and all things Internet related to start a career in Web Analytics. I am passionate about helping businesses, foundations, and individuals with there online presence with the use of data. Everything I have learned has been self-taught so far. I want to receive some form of formal education. This new field doesn't offer a lot of options, which really limits my use of Military tuition programs. I have been researching and talking with leaders and determined the best place for m to get this education will be at the University of British Columbia (UBC) Award of Achievement in digital Analytics . This program is online and starts every month. Its not covered by my Military G.I. Bill or tuition assistance.

How you can help

Like Mentioned above, my earned Military tuition programs will not cover this program due to it being so new and also from an institution from another country. Hendrix, Cassie and I would appreciate all the help we can get. We have sacrificed so much in the last 4 years while serving in the Navy to make sure we can all get up the next day and be able to see our loved ones and have the freedom that is so sought out from people of other countries. You can help out by donating to help me pay for this certification program and jumpstart my career, I will take care of the rest. If you cannot give, you can help out by spreading the word to others, and lending any type of support you may have to offer. 

What I can do for you

I don't have much to give besides my appreciation, however, my son Hendrix is the creative type. He loves to doodle and write and he's only 2! Hendrix makes custom cards for special occasions and his art is very sought after in the market. You'll recieve the gift of his finest creations, custom to you. Its very heart warming, trust me. 

I will also have some things from the military for the Super American out there or for anyone who shows pride for the men and women who truly sacrifice it all for our freedoms. Check the rewards section out.
story_txt:
If you always wanted to give back to the troops, here's your chance. 
 
Why I can use some help
Unfortunately, the Navy doctors have found a serious recurring condition in my latest examination. It's called RHABDOMYOLYSIS, and it's very serious. Basically, it's from my muscle fibers break down and releases a harmful toxin into my kidneys, which can cause them to fail. For a more detailed description check here. If you have served before then you can guess why my muscle might be working so hard. Hard work! This is going to eventually lead me to either be medically separated or ineligible to re-enlist causing some unavoidable hardships for my son Hendrix, my wife Cassie who has a more severe condition compared to mine, NF. 
    
 
What I need help with 
I have enrolled in college full-time while being Active Duty, perusing my degree in marketing online with UMUC. I also love education, technology and entrepreneurship. Along with some wonderful people, I started a company, ReaderUp INC. I pitched this idea at Startup Weekend San Diego, and placed third and soon realized that this is what I want to do with my life. Although, some may think being the C.E.O. of a company is all sugar and candy, I can assure you it's the toughest part of my day. We're still in the development process so it is really putting food on the table.
However, I have followed my passion and savvies with business, technology, education, and all things Internet related to start a career in Web Analytics. I am passionate about helping businesses, foundations, and individuals with there online presence with the use of data. Everything I have learned has been self-taught so far. I want to receive some form of formal education. This new field doesn't offer a lot of options, which really limits my use of Military tuition programs. I have been researching and talking with leaders and determined the best place for m to get this education will be at the University of British Columbia (UBC) Award of Achievement in digital Analytics . This program is online and starts every month. Its not covered by my Military G.I. Bill or tuition assistance.
How you can help
Like Mentioned above, my earned Military tuition programs will not cover this program due to it being so new and also from an institution from another country. Hendrix, Cassie and I would appreciate all the help we can get. We have sacrificed so much in the last 4 years while serving in the Navy to make sure we can all get up the next day and be able to see our loved ones and have the freedom that is so sought out from people of other countries. story:
HELP A 7th GRADER GO TO COLLEGE!!!!

 
Every year my son Andrew is invited to participate the Academic Talent Search (ATS) program at Sacramento State University! ATS is a program started nearly 30 years ago to bring challenging summer classes to gifted children in the northern california area. Classes range from cooking and cartooning to mathematics and chemistry. Andrew has been participating in ATS since 4th grade. The week he spends at Sac State every summer are some of the best weeks of his life! Andrew has an incredible interest in learning, particularly in science and engineering.  Last year due to time and financial restraints we were unable to attend and I want to make sure that doesn't happen this summer! So I am asking now for you to help finance $1500 so we can ensure Andrew makes it this year! Each class ranges from $150-$420, with most of the classes in Andrew field of interest being on the higher end of the scale ;-) I want to ensure we have enough to cover transportation costs and registration for 2-3 classes. Every $1.00 counts so thank you for any donation! Check out the link below to learn more about the program!
http://edweb.csus.edu/projects/ats

story:
Who We Are

While traditional aid and charity can provide short-term relief to the poor, long term sustainable change can only take place through training and equipping people to affect and improve their own communities. The mission of PursueHope International is to train the poor to rise above generations of absolute poverty by using the cumulative expertise of doctors, veterinarians, agricultural specialists, and conservationists who have many years of in-field service around the world. Leveraging diagrams, pictures, and real-world demonstrations through a combination of video and written materials, Pursuehope aims to reach people of every level of education and knowledge.

Our beginnings are humble, and our goals big. Since our official founding in February 2012, we have been able to plant 32 community development centers throughout Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania. We have been able to accomplish this through

  • Generous monetary donations by a few individuals.
  • Generous donations of time and expertise by a few volunteers.
  • Generous donations of time and expertise by doctors, agricultural specialist, and more who develop the courses we film and distribute.
  • Partnerships with other non-profits which have graciously allowed use of filming equipment, software, etc.

We want to change the face of poverty, but we can't do it alone. We. Need. Your. Help.

Why are we asking for support?

We currently have courses on effective livestock management, extending the growing season for crops, basic dental hygiene, healthy sexual behavior, purification of water, and others. The people who have completed these courses have been surprised by the new information they learn and how it can improve their lives. We have already begun to see some significant impact from our courses.

We recently received a report from Tanzania that a rural community was learning from our course on healthy sexual behavior. Through taking the course they realized that FGM (female circumcision) is not healthy or beneficial. They have begun to change the practice, which carries with it myriad complications and health issues. FGM has been a major health issue in various communities througout the world and it is encouraging for us that our educational material is making a positive difference on the prevelance of such a brutal practice.

However, while we were meeting with community leaders throughout East Africa, one question was continually asked, "do you have courses on micro-enterprise?". Though it is on our list of courses to develop, we currently do not have a course on micro-business. Unfortunantly, developing new courses requires funds that we do not have. This is where you come in. We need to develop a course on micro-enterprise and we need your help to do it.

The Numbers

Our Typical course is 14 sessions long. The numbers break down like this:

Cost of Production/session: $158
Cost of Post-Production/session: $204
Cost of Translation/session: $238
Total Cost for 14 Sessions: $8,400
Distribution Cost: $4000 (actual distribution costs are significantly higher, but this helps)
Total Filming and Distribution Cost: $10,400
Cost of Perks: $1,000 (postage, production of t-shirts, stickers, etc.)

Indiegogo Fee (9%): $936.00
FirstGiving Fee (4%): $416.00

 

Total Campaign Funding Goal: $14,752.01 -- the penny is for good measure :)

It may seem high, but, when compared to the average cost of film production, the budget is incredibly low. The only reason we are able to film the courses on such a low budget is because our awesome volunteers donate so much time and talent into each course. 

Your Benefits for Supporting Us

  • You will get "warm and fuzzies".
  • You will get some cool Perks (see left).
  • You will get a tax deduction (this one is obvious).
  • You will make a positive impact in impoverished communities for years to come.

Can't Give? You Can Still Help!

If you can't give, we understand. You can still be a huge help if you...

  • Get the word out about us and make some noise about our campaign.
  • "Like" us on Facebook.
  • Find us on Google Plus.
  • Subscribe to our YouTube page
  • Connect us with community leaders who can use our materials.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

And that’s all there is to it. Easy, right?

Questions???

Send us a message. We would love to hear from you!

story:
Not too long ago I was asked on a college survey whether I plan on studying abroad while attending the University of South Florida, St. Pete (USFSP). Study Abroad programs have always been appealing to me, but I never thought this was a realistic route for me so I never whole-heartedly researched any programs at my school. Because I only have a summer semester left until I am finished with my degree I thought that studying abroad now was even more unrealistic than before. Little did I know Universe had some different plans for me!

 

Not too long after being asked if I plan on studying abroad and responding with a big fat NO, I was informed of a trip to Vietnam hosted by school, that my friend Le had actually went on last summer. I found the timing odd, but odd in a serendipitous way, I had to look into this program because it had come up twice in one week and I try to follow the signs I get in my life. The same week after already feeling suspicious about this trip, I was in an elevator that I don’t usually take on campus, there was a flyer for this trip to Vietnam that Le had been raving about! That was it, I was in…

 

Le immediately made me an appointment to speak with Dr.  Biafora  the Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences and one of the head advisors for this program. When I arrived for my appointment Dean B spared no time in diving right into what this trip is about and what it means to me and how it will change my life. He pulled out a huge map of Vietnam, started naming places I had never heard of and pointing to locations all over the map. Despite having no idea what / where he was pointing to, his enthusiasm and passion for this program had me locked in. On my second visit with Dean B I felt comfortable in sharing with him the synchronicities that were popping up everywhere in my life pertaining to this journey (when I went to check on my passport I realized that it was issued to me on Aug. 13 (My late grandpa Buzz's B-day) and expires on Aug. 12 (My late Nana's B-Day) --If you know me, you know that I am a HUGE believer in signs/synchronicities/connection---so this was a HUGE nudge to go. While reading A New Earth by Eckhart Tolle, in the middle of his chapter on "ego" he starts talking about VIETNAM! See the perfection?). His replies made me comfortable that I was in the right place at the right time and this trip is part of my destiny.

 

Leaving our second meeting I was excited as hell and scared as hell… I had moments of fear based thoughts, when my mind told me I can’t make this happen and that it’s just too impossible, followed by moments of clarity and confidence. I have come to feel worthy and deserving of this trip. I am passionate about my journey in life. I practice being mindful and present throughout my day because I believe it keeps me growing in the right direction. This trip comes at the perfect time; this past year has been one of great losses, as well as extreme healing, and transformation. I am asking for your help in traveling to a country that I know very little about, a country with beauty and life. I am asking you to help me with this big/little dream of mine

 

We will arrive in Hanoi July 8th after traveling for 24 hours. When we arrive at our destination we will get settled into our hotels for the evening and spend the weekend in Hanoi. We then travel to Ha Long Bay, the beautiful place pictured above, where we will be exploring this little town and mingling with the locals. After our time here we take an overnight train ride to Vinh City where we will be staying on campus and paired with a Vietnamese student who will double as our tour guide and study buddy. I will be living and studying at Vinh University for 2 weeks. We will be engaging in hours of talk discussing our two cultures, similarities, differences, pros, cons, what we want to do about it, where we feel stuck, etc... The whole point of this trip is to discover who I am and where I fit into this great big world as a passionate, spiritual, resillient woman..

 The breakdown of my trip:

 

$2,200.00- cost of Study Abroad Program. (I have paid for this)

$2,000.00- cost of plane trip. (Where your contributions will be used!)

$1,500.00- cost for food, travel, housing, and personal use while in Vietnam and surrounding countries. (I will be covering these costs)

story:
Seametrey Residential and Bilingual School (SRBS)

A dream school for village children in Cambodia

 

Phase 1 campaign to build a nursery house: started on 14th November 2012

Phase 2 campaign to build a primary house: 15th December 2012

When we started this campaign, we didn't know what to expect.  Our goal seemed like a receding horizon but we thought we would not know if we didn't try. So try we did and support poured in and made our dream come to life. We are ever so grateful to all our funders. Thanks to them the construction of the nursery house will start in mid-February 2013. 

Now there are still 25 days to go on indiegogo. We need $20,000 for the primary house. We are realistic. We do not expect to raise this much. But anything would help. We have been raising funds elsewhere and friends have been helping too. In this season of love we reach out to all good willed people in the world to bear us in mind and help build a better future for children in Cambodia. You can see in our updates what kind of education we offer our children. It goes beyond basic skills and survival. They thrive and breathe happiness, don't they?

Who I am

My name is Muoy You. I am from Cambodia, home of the magnificent Angkor temples, exquisite Apsara dance but also the site of one of the most devastating genocides in history.

In 1975, the Khmer Rouge came to power and my country was ripped apart. Up to two million people were killed by the regime, among them my parents and siblings. A scholarship from the French Government saved my life - I was in France at the time. But I was forced to live in exile for 31 years, waiting for the chance to come home.

Now I am back in my country and my passion is to help children. Since education saved my life, this is the vehicle I have chosen.

 

The school: Seametrey Children’s Village

I founded Seametrey Children’s Village, a Montessori school for children that come from all backgrounds and income levels. "Seametrey" stands for Freedom, Civilization and Love. In the school, poor and rich children work and play together and parents pay according to their income. We now have 104 students, aged from 2 to 22. The majority of them are poor.  Volunteers come from all over the world to help us and we have 10 children and five support staff who live under our roof.

 

What we are raising money for

We are now at a turning point. Our lease will not be renewed after 2015 and without a new location, our school will be forced to close. We cannot afford a new location in Phnom Penh where we are presently located. And we are also seeking new ways to provide quality education for those children residing in the countryside.

We are excited to have found land in TonleBatiLake (30km south of Phnom Penh) where we want to build a new and improved school.

My dream is to provide quality education to Khmer children.

Our first step, is to build a nursery and primary school as individual houses. We would like to build and equip the first house to be ready for September 2013. The cost will be $15,000 split between the construction of the buildings, the school equipment, and a year's salary for 2 teachers.

$2,000 to fill in the land and put in drain pipes.

$2,500 to build the foundation and hard floor

$2,500 to build the walls and roof

$1,000 for a bio-digestor and two toilets

$1,000 for fence and landscaping

$2,400 to equip the school.

$3,600 for the salaries of two nursery teachers for a year.

This will benefit 50 children in the surrounding villages who would otherwise have no access to early education. 

 

Why are we raising funds?

I am passionate about education and want to empower poor children by providing them with access to quality education. I want to pass on my legacy to them so they are able to realise their own opportunities and dreams.

My dream for my country is to build academic excellence and human excellence, and I am convinced it must start from early childhood. Only then, will Cambodia truly develop.

I cannot do this alone. I need your help. So how can you help?  Firstly, by making a donation. Anything you give, no matter how small, will have an incredible ripple effect for years to come.For each donation, we have a unique way to thank you (see our perks).

 Secondly, you can help by spreading the word about our unique project or, if visiting Cambodia, staying at You Khin House, the beautiful guesthouse we have opened to help sustain our school. You can also support us by joining our team of volunteers. No matter what you do, everything will make a difference. By working together we can make this beautiful dream come true for the benefit of children in Cambodia.

Thank you.

 

Acknowledgements

Seametrey would like to thank the videographer Daniel Valencia who has kindly donated his time and expertise to produce this video.

School Website   www.seametreycambodia.org

Guest House website www.youkhinhouse.com

Jam project: www.kanikajam.com

A video to cheer you up: www.youtube.com/watch?v=CirWdmlTN6s

Energy Is Education: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLecv19EE6E

 

Recently published in Latitudes magazine, in the Netherlands: http://latitudes.nu/keeping-hope-alive-in-cambodia-muoy-you-comes-full-circle/

I cannot do this alone. I need your help. So how can you help?  Firstly, by making a donation. Anything you give, no matter how small, will have an incredible ripple effect for years to come.For each donation, we have a unique way to thank you (see our perks).
 Secondly, you can help by spreading the word about our unique project or, if visiting Cambodia, staying at You Khin House, the beautiful guesthouse we have opened to help sustain our school. You can also support us by joining our team of volunteers. No matter what you do, everything will make a difference. By working together we can make this beautiful dream come true for the benefit of children in Cambodia.
Thank you.
 
Acknowledgements
Seametrey would like to thank the videographer Daniel Valencia who has kindly donated his time and expertise to produce this video.
School Website   www.seametreycambodia.org
Guest House website www.youkhinhouse.com
Jam project: www.kanikajam.com
A video to cheer you up: www.youtube.com/watch?v=CirWdmlTN6s
Energy Is Education: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLecv19EE6E
 
Recently published in Latitudes magazine, in the Netherlands: http://latitudes.nu/keeping-hope-alive-in-cambodia-muoy-you-comes-full-circle/

story:
Short Summary

We believe in children.   It is our belief that EVERY child has the capacity to succeed and that EVERY community can be empowered to provide an exceptional academic experience to children. Our outreach  is focused on:

  • STEM
  • Literacy 
  • Community Service

What We Need & What You Get

We believe community-based programs can do more with less.  We make magic in our classrooms with just basic household supplies and shop at Goodwill and the Dollar Tree to lead the science investigations.  We believe that sound financial stewardship enables us to reach and teach as many young people who need us.  And to assist in our young people's development, service learning is a core component of what we do. 

    We will share via our website what we are doing to help our children succeed.  This platform will enable families, communities and educators across the nation to access to practices that effectively enrich the academic, social and physical development of children. 

    We want you to be a partner in our learning community!


    The Impact

    Through our service learning initiatives held each week, we improve the lives of the elderly, under-served families and our environment

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please share our work, mission and progress with others by email, Facebook, Twitter, etc.  Thank you in advance for helping us help others. 

    And that’s all there is to it.
