story:
I am so thrilled to bring Kindermusik programs to Vancouver this fall!

Kindermusik is the world's leading provider of music and movement programs. We offer developmentally-specific music classes for kids from newborn to age seven, with curriculum based on the principals of Kodaly, Suzuki, and Orff. And our mission? It’s simple. Music is the best vehicle for early childhood learning, and we want to a lifelong love of music and learning and children and their families.

Partnering with Kindermusik as a Licensed Educator is a great opportunity for me to combine my 10+ years experience working with children and youth with my lifelong passion for music and dance. I'm especially excited to be bringing Kindermusik to Vancouver, where there are no programs currently operating.

I need your help to bring the magic of Kindermusik to Vancouver kids and their families! We need start up funds, so we can secure instruments and other teaching materials, insurance, and studio space. With this start-up secured, can focus on delivering and growing the best Kindermusik programs!

In the name of music, learning, and good ol' fashioned kids' play - will you please contribute, even a small amount, to help launch our Kindermusik programs in Vancouver? We have great perks for our contributors, including priority enrollment for our fall session classes, Kindermusik CDs, instruments, t-shirts, and hoodies - check it out! Please note these are flexible - of course you can give any amount you would like above any perk level, and if you have any custom perk requests, let us know!

Thank-you so much for your support. Please spread the word about this fundraising endeavour and our programs, and be in touch if you have any questions or comments!

Much Music Love,

Sarah

story:
Update

If you’re reading this after November 19th then we’ve already gone on our trip with the boys.  They had an AMAZING time- for many of them it was the single greatest thrill of their lives.  We sang on the bus, saw the Maharashtrian countryside whiz by, explored the caves, and soaked up the amenities at the excellent resort we booked for the boys.  For us, the best part was a tie between enjoying the smog-free air and seeing their faces light up when we got to the hotel.  For the boys, the highlight was also a tie, between being able to swim for hours on end and being introduced to the concept of “room service.”

What a trip.  Thank you to all of you who made it possible.

Our campaign continues.  We’re still collecting funds for the boys to cover the myriad of needs AND to take them on another trip in 2014.  So it’s not too late at all to contribute— in fact, it’s exactly the right time!  We need your contribution in order to make next year even better for them.  From shoes to book-bags, from games to dentists’ appointments, your contribution will go towards a general fund that we’ll draw on for their acute needs. 

For more on the shelter and the boys, keep reading.

Who We Are

We are Carlin Carr and Michael Burns, two Americans living and volunteering in Mumbai, India.  It's been our home now for nearly three years and we've come to truly appreciate both the challenges and rewards this place has to offer.

The Shelter

Since February, 2011 we have been volunteering at a shelter in Mumbai that houses sixteen homeless and semi-homeless boys between the ages of 6 and 17. The space is actually an "emergency" shelter where the boys can spend one night as they and their families scramble to find a more permanent place for them to live.  But instead of spending a night or a week at the shelter, the majority of the boys spend months, years, and for some even decades at the facility, some with no contact from any family other than the day they're dropped off. 

The boys live in one all-purpose room, sharing everything with each other.  In this room they sleep, study, have exercise programs, and eat. Their shelter is on one of the glitziest streets in Mumbai, alongside some of the city's best 5-star hotels. The contrast between their lives and those of their neighbors is stark. The shelter is very, very basic, but better than the streets of Mumbai.

We came there to volunteer and to teach English and math once a week, but we grew to care for the boys as if they were our own. Now, we spend nearly every day there, picking them up from school, teaching them, helping them access basic needs (toothbrushes, soap, etc), and bringing them to doctors and dentists in emergency situations. The kids all attend schools at the local government-run facility. During breaks and on Sundays, we watch movies or take them to a local park. 

The Boys Are Amazing

Working with these boys is by far our favorite thing about Mumbai.  They have so little materially, but their capacity for love, generosity, and self-improvement seems to know no boundaries.  They inspire us every day with their attitude toward life, their humor, their creativity, and their kindness: and we love them beyond words. 

One of our dreams has always been to take them on a trip outside of Mumbai to see some of the truly astounding sights of the state they live in, Maharashtra.  For the first time, we had that opportunity. The administration of the shelter gave us permission, during their upcoming school break for Diwali, to take the boys to see one of the most incredible sights in India, the 1000+ year-old 63 hand-carved caves of Ellora/Ajanta:http://goindia.about.com/od/historicalplaces/p/cavesguide.htm

We brought them and they loved it to say the least.

Your contributions covered the following expenses:

  • Transportation- a bus to bring the boys there, around the sites, and back home 
  • Accommodation- a minimal but adequate hotel with shared rooms for 2 nights
  • Food- energy-filled, nutritious meals for the boys to eat (and clean water to drink)

Help Change Their Lives

Every time we work with the boys they ask us over and over again about what life is like not just outside of India, but outside of their neighborhood here in Mumbai.  They have no opportunities to see the world around them.  Some boys simply can't stand it any more and run away.  We can't even describe to you what the consequences of that usually mean for the boys- when that happens they are truly on their own with no support system, no further education, and no job skills.  

Our goal is to keep them at the shelter until they can find stability either with an extended family member or at a more structured facility somewhere in the city.  Until then, we see it as our job to help fill in the many gaps they have in their lives.  We provide encouragement, support, and the advice they need to stay in school, improve themselves, and set high-standards for their own futures, even against the massive odds they face.   

Reaching our Goal and Beyond

Thank you all so much for your contributions so far! We've reached our initial goal but we're thinking of this as a dream fund for the boys where we can use this funding for not only this trip but at least one more, as long as we keep raising money at this pace.

sites, and back home

rooms for 2 nights


Food- energy-filled, nutritious meals for the boys
to eat (and clean water to drink)









Help Change Their Lives
Every time we work with the boys they ask us over and over again about what life is like not just outside of India, but outside of their neighborhood here in Mumbai.  They have no opportunities to see the world around them.  Some boys simply can't stand it any more and run away.  We can't even describe to you what the consequences of that usually mean for the boys- when that happens they are truly on their own with no support system, no further education, and no job skills.  
Our goal is to keep them at the shelter until they can find stability either with an extended family member or at a more structured facility somewhere in the city.  Until then, we see it as our job to help fill in the many gaps they have in their lives.  We provide encouragement, support, and the advice they need to stay in school, improve themselves, and set high-standards for their own futures, even against the massive odds they face.   


Reaching our Goal and Beyond

Thank you all so much for your contributions so far! We've reached our initial goal but we're thinking of this as a dream fund for the boys where we can use this funding for not only this trip but at least one more, as long as we keep raising money at this pace.

story:
One Pair of Teens has been funded!

Let's see if we can do a second pair........


This campaign is raising funds for the all-volunteer Cyprus Friendship Program, a verified nonprofit. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose. 

 

Cyprus Friendship Program

Cyprus, located in the eastern Mediterranean, east of Greece, south of Turkey, north of Egypt and west of Syria, has been divided by a patrolled UN buffer zone since 1974, with Turkish-speaking Muslims on the north and Greek-speaking Christians on the south.  The Cyprus Friendship Program (CFP) brings together teenagers from both Cypriot communities to promote peaceful interaction and understanding between the two groups. CFP is a year-long peace-building and leadership training program in Cyprus, with a four week cultural exchange component in the United States in the summer. By developing cross-cultural friendships, the teens build mutual respect for each other, breaking down the historical stereotypes and mistrust that exist. Upon return to Cyprus, the teens are in a position to share the message with family and friends of their own communities that Greek-speaking and Turkish-speaking Cypriots can live together peacefully. Indeed, many of the students who have participated in the program are doing just that – working together for peace.

“We are tomorrow’s adults, and we’re seeking support from the whole world.” Idil speaking at the House of Commons, London (from the video from The Elders.org, “The future is in our hands”), with Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu.

 

How can you help?

By contributing to this campaign, you can help CFP bring more teens to the US.  This year we had 146 students apply, but could only bring 60 to the US due to lack of funds.  Each pair of teens has a multiplier effect on building peace in Cyprus because each pair of teens represents two families - parents, siblings, grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins.  Next year, we would like to bring 80 students, or 40 pairs, to the US. 

Each $3,400 in donations will cover the travel expenses and insurance for each pair of teens.  CFP, an all-volunteer organization, is recognized by Great Non-profits, so you can be assured that every dollar you donate will go to bringing teens to the US.

Become a peace-builder.  Join our campaign.

CFP teens create "Peace" Bumper Sticker

 

 

 

Why Cyprus?

The conflict between the two communities (Greek-Cypriot in the south and Turkish-Cypriot in the north) has its roots in the 1950's and 1960's. In 1974, a war brought about a geographical militarized partition with UN Peacekeepers that continues to exist today, separating the two deeply divided communities.

●  Most Cypriots born after 1974 have grown up without contact with anyone from the other side.

●  Each community has its own version of history and “the demons” are the people on the other side of the divide.  Because English is a common second language, communication is possible to address these differences.

●  The island is small enough that a program of Cyprus Friendship Program’s size can make a difference.

●  Both communities are filled with wonderful people who have much in common
culturally, but the long years of separation have made most unaware of this
fact.

●  There are adults willing to volunteer enormous efforts to help promote friendships between the two communities and teens in both communities seeking to become friends with members of the other side.

●  Since 2003 it has been possible for Cypriots to cross the divide through a small number of checkpoints.  Although it is possible, it is still politically and culturally complex to cross.

●  Cypriot society remains polarized.  Extremist groups have harassed program coordinators and teenagers. Despite these problems not even one member of the Cyprus Friendship Program’s family in Cyprus suggested giving up the struggle. On the contrary, the work continues to grow.

●  We know of no other youth programs that are as effective as Cyprus Friendship Program in bringing together Cypriot youth and their families from across the divide.

●  Cyprus is one of the more densely militarized places on the planet. Citizen peace
building work that replaces fear with trust is a necessary component for any political agreement leading to the demilitarization of the island.

●  Hatred and prejudice against the other community is common amongst the youth of the island and cases of peaceful coexistence are very rare. Cyprus Friendship Program’s teenagers are a living example that peace is possible and have, in the first five years of the program, already inspired and given hope to many thousands of Cypriots.

●  Peace in Cyprus could offer a model elsewhere in the Middle East.

●  Families hosting Turkish and Greek Cypriot teens in their homes in the US show the goodwill, caring, and generosity of Americans. The strong relationships that develop between the host families and teens result in bonds between Americans and two Cypriot communities, both of which in recent decades have been strained.

●  Those in Cyprus seeking friendship between the two communities greatly appreciate the involvement of Americans who are without a political agenda and who treat communities, their cultures and their beliefs, with equal respect.

 

About Cyprus

 

For nearly 40 years, the island of Cyprus has been divided between the Greek-Cypriot side in the South and the Turkish-Cypriot side in the North. Following independence from British rule in 1960, the Republic of Cyprus was established and tension between the Turkish-Cypriot and Greek-Cypriot communities intensified. In the ensuing years, hostility between the two sides increased.

In July 1974, a Greek-Cypriot coup took place in an effort to unite the island with Greece and, in response, Turkey landed troops on the island and fighting between the two sides broke out. About 160,000 Greek-Cypriots fled to the south and about 50,000 Turkish-Cypriots fled north. The two communities are separated by a physical barrier called the Green Line that is patrolled by UN troops on the longest peacekeeping mission ever undertaken by the United Nations.

In 1983, the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus declared its independence, which today is only recognized by Turkey. On May 1, 2004, Cyprus as a whole (with the government in the south) was offered entry into the European Union without resolving the conflict.

Ever since 1974, there have been several failed plans and initiatives to negotiate an agreement to reunify the island, mostly under the guidance of the UN. In 2004, United Nations Secretary General, Mr. Kofi Annan, drafted the 2004 Annan Plan intending to reunify the island. The northern Turkish-Cypriots accepted the Annan Plan with 64.9% voting in favor; however, 75.8% of Greek-Cypriots rejected it. Talks between the current leadership of the two communities continue, but no agreement has as yet been reached.

As a result, Cyprus remains a divided island, with the Turkish- speaking community in the northern part of island and the larger Greek-speaking community in the southern part, separated by UN peacekeepers. Each community has its own version of history and is familiar almost exclusively with the suffering that it has experienced at the hands of the other. So, there is a serious divide and little contact between the two communities. Teens in each community, indeed anyone 40 years or younger, have grown up with little, if any, contact with anyone from the other community.

Even those teens willing to explore a friendship with teens from the other community have little ability to do so. While it is possible to pass through one of the few checkpoint crossings in the Green Line, when they do, they enter a land that uses a different language, a land where their cellphones do not work, and where many of the people will be hostile to them. Moreover, they have no place to go where they know there will be counterparts from the other side who might have an interest in meeting them. CFP provides rare, safe opportunities for teens from the two communities to meet and to get to know one another.
story_txt:
One Pair of Teens has been funded!
Let's see if we can do a second pair........

This campaign is raising funds for the all-volunteer Cyprus Friendship Program, a verified nonprofit. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose. 
 

Cyprus Friendship Program

Cyprus, located in the eastern Mediterranean, east of Greece, south of Turkey, north of Egypt and west of Syria, has been divided by a patrolled UN buffer zone since 1974, with Turkish-speaking Muslims on the north and Greek-speaking Christians on the south.  The Cyprus Friendship Program (CFP) brings together teenagers from both Cypriot communities to promote peaceful interaction and understanding between the two groups. CFP is a year-long peace-building and leadership training program in Cyprus, with a four week cultural exchange component in the United States in the summer. By developing cross-cultural friendships, the teens build mutual respect for each other, breaking down the historical stereotypes and mistrust that exist. Upon return to Cyprus, the teens are in a position to share the message with family and friends of their own communities that Greek-speaking and Turkish-speaking Cypriots can live together peacefully. Indeed, many of the students who have participated in the program are doing just that – working together for peace.

Become a peace-builder.  Join our campaign.

story:
Listening to that tiny but ever so persistent voice in my head is what brought us here. Life is short, gritty but beautiful. After 9 years in a community service based career, I'm forging a new pathway for myself and family. Massage school here I come! Giving back through the healing arts! I'm also a professional dancer, aspiring jewelry artist and mother to two awesomesauce kiddos. They've watched me give and give and give, and I need to show them that you can give in a way that brings you joy and replenishes the spirit as well. Life isn't static! It's ever changing, and if you do not allow yourself to come off autopilot, you miss the amazing journey. Please help me bring my dreams to fruition and inspire theirs!

I have received an award letter to begin studying at the Onondaga School of Therapeutic Massage for the January 2014 term and the loans the government will provide leaves a gap of approximately $5300, excluding~$500 for books and cost of living (rent, groceries, gas).I am absolutely determined to make this happen, take charge of my life and put  my skills to work! I'm raising funds before the start of classes in January. I've started an Etsy shop to sell my creations and am teaching and performing Dance whenever and wherever I can!.

What will you get out of this? 

If you are in the Rochester,  New York area, you are welcome to sign up for a rejuvenating massage during the clinics which will be offered once I begin school in January (it will be fabulous). If you contribute $25 or more to my dream, I would like to send you a token of my heartfelt appreciation in the form of my handmade jewelry to be worn by you or someone you want to share it with. Any amount will be gratefully accepted and put to good use for this aspiration.

When I put my mind to something, I make it happen! It took 7 years to get that undergraduate degree and I've made a decent life in the Arts. I know I can give more with the healing arts! I look forward to mastering many styles of massage from shiatsu to hot stone, but then I'd like to mesh it with some of the community based ideologies I've used in my previously held position doing home visiting. Pediatric massage, and at the other end of the spectrum, massage for the elderly or infirm

story:
In the past years we've paid for it from TROM's money because we've got more financial support and this was included in the amount we asked for, but this past year the support dropped so we need your help to pay it. We pay for everything from the Patreon, PayPal, and Credit Card support - server, plugins, other accounts,  etc., but the Joomag account is the most expensive one and it is a yearly payment so it is very difficult to put money aside every month for this (very little money).

I am always in contact with the people from Joomag, they have great and fast support, and they said they will do some big improvements the following months to their service, and the most anticipated one is to move away from Flash to HTML5 on the desktop. They will give me early access. It should be ready in a month or two from what they said. That's awesome.

So please help if you can. There is no way to not pay for it, so if we don't raise the amount I'll have to borrow money or see what I can do to pay for it because I am not going to give up on this and lose all TROM ebooks in the online format (the format that we rely upon).

Thank you in advance.

story:
What is BrightTrack?

BrightTrack is a nonprofit organization that provides no-cost college admissions advising through mentorship to all students, especially youth from low-income and underresourced backgrounds.

www.brighttrack.org

Mission

Our mission is to help students navigate and shine in the competitive and complex world of college admissions.

Organization Overview

BrightTrack was born from a shared belief that college advising shouldn't be reserved just for students from families with unlimited resources. Getting into a top college - or the right college - is a life-changing accomplishment that every bright and determined student should have the opportunity to pursue.

How does your program work?

Students of our program are connected to a mentor that will holistically guide them through the college admissions process as early as their sophomore year in high school. Mentors will engage the students in program activities such as the Capstone Project, college and company tours, as well as scholarship opportunities to enhance their student profile as an applicant to their dream colleges.

Where will my money go?

Dontations from this fundraising campaign will go to the following:

  • Two $250 scholarships for selected graduating seniors of the program
  • $500 to obtain nonprofit status, including legal fees
  • Any additional money raised will go towards outreach initiatives and increasing scholarship amounts

How else can I help?

One of the most impactful and free ways to support BrightTrack and our mission is to help spread the word. By sharing our site, liking our social networking pages, or retweeting our posts, you can help us reach out to folks we may have otherwise missed.

Thank you all very much in advance!

-The BrightTrack Team

story:
Short Summary

We would like to introduce you to some of the students of Detroit Community High. We are artists and educators, and have been working with these folks since they started high school and we think the world of them.


It's just a short month now between the end of classes and senior prom, and for most of these Detroiters the future is wide open. Remember that time of your life? Prom is one of the rituals bridging that gap. Who do you ask? Will someone ask you? This new world of formalities, social cues and miscues is part of the passage leading seniors into the less certain world that will follow after graduation, as they head off from the friends and people they've known. 

It's easy to forget that this transition is even harder when you may not have the means to buy a dress or to rent a tuxedo. You can help us enable these students to embark on this journey.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution goes directly to buying or renting prom clothes for 22 students who have stepped up to let us know that they'd love to go to the prom, but can't afford clothes to wear. We are assembling a small book of pictures of prom dresses, and will make sure each girl gets her dream dress.

As part of our thanks to you, you'll get a group portraiit or a video message from these incredible people from their special evening

We'd love to achieve our total goal to make sure eveyone who has identified their needs is met with a full embrace. If we fall short of the goal, we'll work with what we have, and make our collected dollars stretch a little further.

The Impact

One of the students who is part of this effort wrote this letter and we wanted to share her words:

"I am a senior at Detroit Community High School. I am Class Secretary, work after school in our community wood working program and, in the fall, will be attending the College of Creative Studies in Detroit. I was struggling, wondering how I was going to get clothes for Prom. Then I heard about Prom attire on the intercom. I was nervous to go ask because I didn't want my firends to see me or anything like that so I never said anything. A few days later someone told my Mom about it and she said I should go ahead. I have my eyes on a pretty powder pink Cinderella dress. I don't know what I would have done without your amazing help, and I will be sure to save a picture just for you."

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Would you ask friends to get the word out, to help make some noise about the campaign? You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

Let's get to the prom together!

story:
Bright Sparkling Summary

Help me give something beautiful that
      goes directly and immediately to families with precious
            children suffering from cancer or other terminal illness.
                Yep, a bright sparkling picture of them!
              How about that,
         a charity effort that will put a smile on YOUR face right away.

•    I am an independent artist who does graphics work
             for individuals, children with cancer, and businesses each week. 
                 My process is converting people’s photos into large, beautiful scenes
             that are filled with light, color, and sparkling highlights.
   
    •     The Goal - let parents see their children in a bright, warm glow
                that puts a smile in their hearts.
                      How?  By creating dramatic pictures from their photos..
                           scenes that are amazing, surprising, wonderful, exuberant,
      shining, sparkling, dazzling, fun, funny, inspiring, uplifting, and joyous.
 
      •    Enjoy lots of examples on my web site,
               Wow Factor Studios - Bright-Sparkling-Pictures-For-Kids
                  where you can see the marvelous graphic changes
                         that I can make to ordinary photos and snapshots. 
                     One of the ingredients is emotion, another is inspiration,
                 and those add to the mix of shapes and colors and light. 
             Now add a spinning computer and a goofy guy like me
         and you get some amazing results.
 

What I Need - What You Get

So here is how it works...
                  I raise money, contact families,
                          they send some photos, and immediately
                              I send a beautiful, large picture to them.
               In most cases the family will let me tell you all about it
         and send their thanks to you for such a thoughtful gift.

   •    Of course, it is possible that I won't reach my goal in 61 days,
               but that won't stop me from building my graphics business
                     and give that one day per week to families in need.
                        Yep, a super duper picture of them!


    •    For those who give a large enough amount,
               I will also turn one of their own photos into a special picture,
              such as a wedding photo that becomes more romantic or
                            a birthday picture that becomes very festive and cool or
                              a Valentine’s special picture.


    •    I will tell more of my story on my web site,
               since the drama, light, and color are best viewed there.
               Wow Factor Studios - Bright-Sparkling-Pictures-For-Kids

The Impact

Give a child a picture he or she can show everybody..
             with a big smile. 
      Let me put that small boy in his favorite tree house,
          and that little girl in her dream doll house serving tea to her playmates. 
              Perhaps it is a cool skate board or
                    a magical mermaid that joins them in
                         a bright sparkling scene of their dreams.
My goal in each case is to make a picture that becomes
          the family favorite and is
               shared around the world to the entire family circle.
Join those around me who are excited about the possibilities. 
          Everyone is surprised when they see
              how many bright and colorful pictures I can create.
                   So many nod yes and wish me luck because
             there is such a need for comfort and support for the children,
         the family, the extended family, and the circle of friends.


Other Ways You Can Help
OK, so right now you maybe you can't help me,
        but consider that if you spread the word, 
            Your simple efforts would mean that there would be
                 one more family that would receive
            a picture they would treasure for a lifetime.
Also, it is free, and easy, to use
          the IndieGoGo.com tools for sharing the news. 
             Just say "here's a really good one, folks"
               Please help me exceed my goal and
          I have to work very hard to keep up with the demand !!
     Yep, more super duper pictures of them!   ALL of them!

And when you are on the internet,
          stop by Patch.com Safety Harbor Florida
                 and say "Hello, Jim - love your work"
       I will be there and many other places on the web, as you can see below.
story_txt:
Bright Sparkling Summary
Help me give something beautiful that       goes directly and immediately to families with precious            children suffering from cancer or other terminal illness.                Yep, a bright sparkling picture of them!              How about that,          a charity effort that will put a smile on YOUR face right away.
•    I am an independent artist who does graphics work             for individuals, children with cancer, and businesses each week.                   My process is converting people’s photos into large, beautiful scenes             that are filled with light, color, and sparkling highlights.        •     The Goal - let parents see their children in a bright, warm glow                 that puts a smile in their hearts.                       How?  By creating dramatic pictures from their photos..                           scenes that are amazing, surprising, wonderful, exuberant,       shining, sparkling, dazzling, fun, funny, inspiring, uplifting, and joyous.
 
      •    Enjoy lots of examples on my web site,                Wow Factor Studios - Bright-Sparkling-Pictures-For-Kids                  where you can see the marvelous graphic changes                          that I can make to ordinary photos and snapshots.                       One of the ingredients is emotion, another is inspiration,                  and those add to the mix of shapes and colors and light.               Now add a spinning computer and a goofy guy like me          and you get some amazing results.
 

What I Need - What You Get
So here is how it works...                   I raise money, contact families,                           they send some photos, and immediately                              I send a beautiful, large picture to them.               In most cases the family will let me tell you all about it         and send their thanks to you for such a thoughtful gift.
   •    Of course, it is possible that I won't reach my goal in 61 days,                but that won't stop me from building my graphics business                      and give that one day per week to families in need.                        Yep, a super duper picture of them!
    •    For those who give a large enough amount,                I will also turn one of their own photos into a special picture,               such as a wedding photo that becomes more romantic or                             a birthday picture that becomes very festive and cool or                               a Valentine’s special picture.
    •    I will tell more of my story on my web site,                since the drama, light, and color are best viewed there.               Wow Factor Studios - Bright-Sparkling-Pictures-For-Kids


The Impact
Give a child a picture he or she can show everybody..              with a big smile.        Let me put that small boy in his favorite tree house,           and that little girl in her dream doll house serving tea to her playmates.                Perhaps it is a cool skate board or                     a magical mermaid that joins them in                         a bright sparkling scene of their dreams.My goal in each case is to make a picture that becomes           the family favorite and is                shared around the world to the entire family circle.Join those around me who are excited about the possibilities.            Everyone is surprised when they see               how many bright and colorful pictures I can create.                    So many nod yes and wish me luck because              there is such a need for comfort and support for the children,          the family, the extended family, and the circle of friends.
Other Ways You Can HelpOK, so right now you maybe you can't help me,         but consider that if you spread the word,              Your simple efforts would mean that there would be                  one more family that would receive             a picture they would treasure for a lifetime.Also, it is free, and easy, to use           the IndieGoGo.com tools for sharing the news.               Just say "here's a really good one, folks"               Please help me exceed my goal and          I have to work very hard to keep up with the demand !!     Yep, more super duper pictures of them!   ALL of them!
And when you are on the internet,           stop by Patch.com Safety Harbor Florida                  and say "Hello, Jim - love your work"       I will be there and many other places on the web, as you can see below.

story:
I am the kind of person who generally does not like to do things that would make me feel uncomfortable. I have become very accustomed to having a comfort zone in my day to day life. As I grow more mature I have started to realize I will never reach my full potential if I don’t start doing things that make me feel a little uncomfortable. I made a decision when I heard about this opportunity to take a step by becoming a part of the US Brazil Connect program. It may seem like a leap, but as you read about me more, you will understand how determined I can be to move ahead with my life; once my mind and heart are set on a goal I make it a reality.

I know the only way to get what I want from life is to put my full effort into the task at hand. I have been doing just that. The fall after my high school graduation was my first semester at Jackson Community College and I was studying for a medical field career. Starting my second year of college presented many obstacles for me, my parents filed for divorce and I was facing financial problems. I ended up leaving mid way through the semester which ruined my grade point average. I took the rest of the year off to figure out how I wanted to spend the rest of my life. I returned to school this fall with a clear focus. During that time I realized the health field was not the path I wanted to continue I decided teaching was truly in my heart. Teaching has been something I have wanted to do ever since I can remember and I have finally begun my journey. My education classes are exciting for me and I can’t wait to become a teacher.

I had never felt confident that I would be able to fulfill the dreams I had planned for my life. I had always been a girl with big dreams but I had focused on pleasing my parents and being a good example for my younger sister for so long that I never really worried about improving myself. I have recently learned that the time to work on me is now. I began to work on my confidence and my sense of self and the more I started to grow as an individual the more I was ready to push myself further. I started making decisions based on what would make me the happiest. Hearing about the Brazil program seemed perfect to me. I’m in a position now where I want to keep pushing myself further and further outside of my comfort zone. If I had heard about this program my first year in college, I wouldn’t have ever applied. I wouldn’t have had the confidence to feel like I’d ever be accepted and I would not have felt comfortable being such a great distance from home for so long. I now feel through making my own decisions, I have gained confidence and a sense of readiness to embrace the world as me.

I have a very strong desire to be a part of this program and I have never been offered such an unbelievable experience. I feel my greatest fulfillment in life will be when I can make a positive influence in another individual’s life. I feel deep in my heart nothing can stop me from trying my hardest to be a finalist. I know all of the amazing doors this will open in my life and for that I will put in a 210% effort to be the best I can at adapting to a new country, culture, language, and to teach as much English as I can to the students. I am excited and honored to have been given this opportunity and I intend to give to the students in Brazil everything I have received by being a part of this exchange.


I am working at earning $2,200.00 to cover my airfare, visa, insurance, and room and board.
